iZ8DO_YgTcsECNFFTiT7bw.text: The food looks promising. It never seems to deliver on taste though. The staff always seems to be confused too. It's a great location though, and the people viewing is unmatched on the Southside.

4AKEng3sPm0J9qohOREiIQ.text: I have to say that I am incredibly underwhelmed with this place. For a restaurant that prides itself in vegetarian cuisine, I would say that the food I've had there is significantly below par. I've been to the Double Wide a couple of times for drinks (even though I avoid the South Side like the plague), but I recently stopped in for food after work on a Groupon. I was by myself, so I had to get a bunch of food to cover the $20 I got on my Groupon :). I started with the seitan wings, which were not cooked well at all. The flavors was great (I think I got the BBQ flavor), but it left a lot to be desired. If you want killer seitan wings, go to Spak Brothers on Penn in Lawrenceville! After the wings, I got a tofu dish with rice. Again, while the flavors and spices were tasty, the tofu wasn't cooked well at all. I know it's difficult to cook tofu well, but come on guys, you advertise yourselves as a vegetarian/friendly restaurant! More so, all of the food was sooooooo overpriced! The seitan wings to start were $10 for 10 wings. Next, the tofu dish was around 12 bucks. I think they jacked up the prices because they know most people are going there with Groupons. For food this bland and untasty, the bang was definitely not worth the buck. I will definitely not go to Double Wide for food again, and I can't recommend this place to vegetarians.

WkC38fR831xoPYLLLibvUQ.text: Decent beer selection. Above average barbecue for a restaurant in Pittsburgh. The Rueben Rolls are really good but I wish they gave you more than three. Great outdoor seating area. There isn't anything awful about this place but there is also nothing exceptional.

iFaHv7tppYPE9I0kkKj4Bg.text: Really great service, great food, fun atmosphere, great vegetarian options, reasonable prices.  Had some of the best service I've had in recent memory, left the place full.

qRk9VKhs-cyWw0TPxEAH2Q.text: As I was in town strictly to imbibe, I didn't have chance to try the food at the Double Wide, but the restaurant was a spectacle by itself. The renovated service station motif was executed brilliantly, with no detail spared. Drinks were awesome, and we were happy to have the opportunity to enjoy the sunshine a little as there were many other places within walking distance that weren't able to offer outdoor seating. We went up and down the cocktail menu and thoroughly enjoyed everything that we were fortunate enough to sample. Some of the signatures, such as the highly advertised frozen mojito, didn't pack too much of a punch, but whatever. The wait staff was very attentive and kind, and prices weren't out of control. Great spot at which to waste an afternoon.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

akfMVJ06H20rerNIW4En4g.text: Was there in August moving daughter into Pitt.  She's a vegan and this place hit the spot for all of us.  From service, to decor, to food...all superb. A friendly funky find.

ytVMKLj2WYs7uvzATCRLoQ.text: We were seated at 8:00. Our waitress didn't come to our table until 8:25.  I ordered the all you can eat ribs. After 2 plates and about 10-12 ribs I was informed that the kitchen closed at 9:00 and even though we had ordered all you can eat the last order had to be in by 9:00.  I told the waitress to quickly bring me another plate of ribs and asked her to be back before 9:00 so I could order one last round. At 9:05 she returned to the table with three ribs and walked away. My personal opinion is my order wasn't taken until approximately 830 why was I not informed that the kitchen close at 9? The point that I set for 25 minutes before the waitress showed up  didn't help my cause at all. They were not busy so it's not like  anyone was in the weeds. I would have much rather ordered a full rack of ribs and been done with it. The whole "all you can eat ribs" night was supposed to be fun, as any gimmick should be.  Anyway I will not go back there and I will not recommend this restaurant to anyone. As far as the food is concerned it wasn't bad. I would say a little bit above average at best.

sHpB1cyHM1CEpf3NIzLcgg.text: Ugh. I don't know if brunch just isn't the best time to eat here or what, but we had a bad experience on Saturday. My beloved seitan "wings" were hard as rocks (like so hard they were difficult to cut with a knife). Our waiter went AWOL. My son didn't like his cheeseburger, and he likes almost anything. On the plus side, well, they have some Jenga-esque game that kept my kids entertained until our food arrived.

y9KF8Felg_upWyAaVcMmjQ.text: Awesome food, great service and the bartender was a Browns fan. Doesn't get much better than that

llGQcVNbpAMs3b_UsXlOsg.text: I came here for brunch and I had the French toast and sausage. It was soooo good. My friend had the veggie omelet. I will defiantly come back again. Food and service was great. Only thing that was weird was you can drink alcohol (ie: mimosa) until 12noon. I'm from Philadelphia and we don't have that law so I was shocked about that but when it was noon I had the mimosa and Bellini and both were very good.

KbYzBw4cLXbmwnyUg9O92Q.text: Our last out of town on New Years Day and I should have been here earlier. We spent the morning driving around looking for someplace to have brunch, bloody marys and watch the football games. Next time I am in Pittsburgh this is my sunday brunch location.  Lots of TV's, the food looked, at least we got to enjoy a bloody mary.

0psAHFugGe-RSJOwnhCU6A.text: The food was delish. Seitan wings are so awesome. So many vegetarian options but also lots for carnivores too.   I have been organizing a regular monthly event for two years and needed a new location. The Double not only reserved a table for 20+ people but were really flexible when more people than usual showed up. The wait staff was AmAZinG! Seriously. So friendly and attentive and never made us feel like we were a pain.   Great place, lowkey atmosphere. Definitely recommend it!

SOxDlG9EkMyAXpej9CjsDQ.text: This place has a BIG veg. menu.  The seitan wings are very good!  There regular(aka chicken) wings are good too.  Great during the day, but very busy at night.  Good mixed drinks and a pretty nice beer list.  The pulled pork was good(not excellent).  I usually stick to the wings when I am in town.

261ZC3GnE3VPstzUvEhkAQ.text: Double Wide Grill is an old gas station converted to a bar and grill. I am a sucker for places like this! The corner spot is perfect for the bikers who hang out there and the eclectic decor is cool.  I ordered a Hogaarden, which I get very excited to see on a menu and I got Tilapia tacos for dinner. Never had that kind of fish taco before, and living in San Diego has made me accustomed to getting breaded fish or Mahi Mahi grilled. I loved the Tilapia though! It came with a side of rice and black beans too.  The food was better than expected, based on just the overall feel of the place. They had a few veggie options like grilled tofu and a veggie burger. Good for families, large parties and just plain old fun!

RdvT3a7I6UtVCjfykckIHQ.text: Our very first time here and I have to say I'm impressed.  Great service which is one of my musts to return to a restaurant.  We will be back. Their corn bread kicks ass and so does their beer list!  Reasonable priced and great food.  I had the pineapple  chicken wrap which was  phenomenal!  My husband loved their meatloaf with chipolte gravy.  The corn  black bean fritters were great if that's something you like.  Enjoy!

LpsJOKvSJBLu4CpOV8MBtg.text: I've been here twice and had the same bad experience both times. The ambiance, food selection, and tastes are amazing. This should be a regular place for us, however, the service is terrible. The servers are not staffed properly. Our server last night, while very fiendly, was in waaaaay too many sections and had 4 parites of more than 6 people that we could see. Not one person at our table was offered a refill on their drinks. The people in my party eating the all you can eat ribs were only offered a second serving 30 minutes after they were done eating the first set. Their second set took an additonal 30 minutes to be delivered to the table.  At that point everyone was ready to go...but we couldn't leave because we were waiting for our checks.for what felt like an extra hour. I love a relaxing slow paced dinner, but 3 hours is waaaaaay toooo long. Both times I was there, I could not identify a manager on site. This place feels really unorganized. Despite the great food, we won't be back. It's not worth the wait.

k39rJ2Et7D8xJD_uHj3nEA.text: This is the only place I've ever seen before that has vegan BBQ food, and man is it great.  I had the BBQ pulled seiten sandwich with vegan fries and garlic coleslaw.  Super good.  My meat eating boyfriend even said it was good.  They were packed when we got there but we were seated in a timely manner.  Our waitress was very nice, wasn't overbearing and didn't hover like some do.  I would definitely go back asap.  Yum!

Ei-z6vfCx4_op7e1z7EiJw.text: Great food and really cool atmosphere. Get the Philly cheeseburger!

fVlRYzF249E5F7_I7r2rXg.text: The food was excellent and the staff was awesome. We were seated immediately and treated like family. The host and waitress were so personable :) the menu had so many vegetarian and vegan options, i was very pleased. This is definitely a place i will visit again.

jBimU1i6nueM1lH4ePncng.text: In a word: inconsistent. I have had some of my best Pittsburgh dining experiences here, but also some pretty bad ones. In general, the service is slow. Sometimes it's nice to have slow service so you can sit and enjoy the mealtime company, but sometimes the service is really, really slow.  Also, I have gone to the Double Wide craving their seitan wings and left disappointed -- it seems like they change the recipe monthly! In spite of this, I continue to go back because when the service is good and the food is prepared well, it's one of the best places I know. I especially like going for brunch. Although it's a gamble, we take out-of-town visitors here and they are usually pretty impressed.

Zyqcicnl5sdBc4ahOCJc1w.text: I almost didn't stop in and what tragedy that would have been. The "make your own TV dinner was one of the best meals I've ever had. Brisket (that sauce!!!), Carolina style pulled pork, grits, cherry coleslaw (loved it!), and the cornbread? It could have been dessert. A business trip to Pitt will not be complete for me again without a stop at one of my new favorite restaurants. BTW: the menu is overwhelming with choices and the vegan selections are phenom.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. A quiet and clear evening at Double Wide.

Z4vZqV5i9vVsF40loOPCgQ.text: Best mussels I've ever had. Great food, great prices, great staff, and awesome atmosphere!!! We'll be back.

Vh7PrLjeCqm-MBJk6ao74A.text: Terrible. I find it to be overpriced for what you get, and the food is mediocre at best. Been here several times, have yet to leave satisfied. Won't be coming back.   Most recently ordered the jerk chicken... Didn't expect it to be so incredibly greasy, and there wasn't actually much chicken there (mostly all joints--got served a plate of bones and tendons).  Not worth the $14 that was paid.

4epnMMkDxMr1ueurvwAV6g.text: Awesome choice to end out day in Pittsburgh before heading home. All four in our group left full and happy. Food was great and out server was very friendly and attentive. Happy we stopped here.

miLAQJmCeCY7YSw5SOWdIQ.text: Recent visit was a big disappointment. Had a burrito and it was beyond weird tasting. Just chicken, beans and rice and it was almost inedible. Pulled pork Sammy was a let down as well as the 15 french fries I was given. Place wasn't busy at all. Beer was solid , same old crowd . Avoid the black bean burger, it looks like it's cut from a square loaf. Tasteless and dry as a bone. I'm one visit away from throwing in the towel with this place.

EY0LBgpGyz-yR83bi9HMRg.text: DONT EAT HERE. Unless you like waiting for HOURS to eat when the establishment is empty and staffed. Oh and if you want to deal with people who obviously don't like their job. Let me start by saying I only came here because the person I was with wanted to eat here for a couple months now. We approach the host stand only to see a miserable looking straight faced girl say "there's a wait it will be 35 minutes" ok no big deal we grabbed a seat. It's 5pm on a Sunday, Pens just won. Apparently this is what a "35 minute wait" looks like (see pics) Empty tables everywhere. Hostesses waiters and waitresses just standing around gossiping. That 35 minute wait quickly turned into a 45 minute wait. As we're waiting at a table we can hear people approach the host stand and the hostess girl is telling them there's a 45 minute wait, they can't sit and wait at a table but they can sit and wait at the bar. THE WHOLE PLACE IS EMPTY WHY CANT THEY SIT AT A TABLE???? Ok long story short by the time we're asked what we'd like to order 45 minutes have gone by, by the time we get our food we were sitting down long over 2 hours waiting. It took everything not to just get up and leave but the person I was with really wanted to try it out. He wasn't happy about the service whatsoever. Just not a good way to run a restaurant. Atrocious. Horribly run business and poorly managed, if there was a manager there tonight they should be reassessed.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

40a4cZU-LdXn11-Z1Mf47A.text: Food was ok but for the price it wasn't good enough.  Brisket was dry and didn't have a good flavor.  The ribs that came with the brisket and rib dinner ($20) only contained 3 ribs and they weren't very good.  This place is ehh at best.  The chicken sandwich was ok but not worth the cost.  Best things about this place are the service and the atmosphere.  Cool place but food could be better.

wGKKzvJypO1urLyQ-Dp6Jw.text: I'm a vegetarian slowly trying to reduce my animal product intake so I guess it's safe to say I prefer more of a Vegan diet. I used the Happy Cow app on my phone to find the restaurant as I am in town from Philadelphia. I ordered the BBQ seitan wings and let me tell you, they were better than I could've hoped for. My boyfriend got actual bone-in wings and said they left a little to be desired as far as taste goes (he got a spicy flavor. Forgot the name). We shared the Veggyro and it was just ok. The sauce it was cooked in was very heavily salted...and the cucumber sauce it came with left a little to be desired. Overall, I would 100% come back for the seitan wings, the good atmosphere and the location.

xRyQhlNpSzmRvJTi7EThRg.text: I'll start by saying the staff was very nice! BUT, the food was awful. Everything was definitely frozen. Kid's Mac and cheese was definitely Kraft and reheated. Make your own TV dinner is such a cute concept, but everything on the tray was awful. Frozen vegetables, colorless carrots, pulled pork that disintegrated when you touched it, and yellow crusty potatoes. We brought it to the attention of the very sweet waitress. She came back from the kitchen with a plate of fresh mashed potatoes, and new pulled pork (still not good). Why would the kitchen put out old food, if they have fresh??? More ridiculous (and partially our fault for not making a bigger deal) was that the virtually untouched food (including the new food) was not taken off the bill! We wasted $100, don't waste yours!!

Cu6A3kdUf34aXffNntuYwA.text: This place was aggressively medium. The vegan wings were fine, the vegan "cheesesteak" was fine but way too sweet. The non vegans I ate with all said their food was bad to average.

bbOs80-eqYkKHAFWID51qw.text: If it's a nice night and you don't have enough wait staff.  Don't seat every table.  We waited 15 minutes before someone said is anyone helping you and said would be back.  5 minutes later we leave the table.   Ok go to bar.  Maybe get service there. Yes we're hungry and already there.   Wrong.  Bar tender only serving wait staff.  Only when we get up to leave at 5 minutes he says do we want something.  Nope not anymore.

WjnG-Fu4DLgbzeZyXXzsrA.text: As you can see from my profile, I rarely leave low star reviews. But the brunch we had at Double Wide Grill really bothered me throughout my day and I felt compelled to share my experience on Yelp.   My friends were in town from Chicago and we wanted to sit somewhere outside, so we tried Double Wide since they have a big patio. The patio was really the only good thing about the experience. Our server seemed clueless. She took our drink orders which included bloody marys, beers, and 3 waters. She came back a long time later empty handed and said "they are still making the bloody marys". Great, well bring the waters and beers then!!! It's hot as sh*t outside and how hard is it to bring water right away?  We ordered our meals, my friend got a veggie omelette. Instead, he was given a meat lovers omelette. My friend got the wrong side with his meal. The service overall was slow and lackadaisical.   As for the food, it was not memorable in any way. You could get this type of breakfast food at any diner or Denny's. Brunch is about unique creations and stuffing your face. The portions were not up to par either. This will not be a place I go back to for brunch.

HWCA8MZhFDXZ7jpn3YmZ5Q.text: Went to the Pittsburgh VegFest 2016 today.   Got a few *Hail Seitan* bbq wings from their food truck a tasty snack with a lil kick. On my list to try Veggyro the only downfall is I will bring my own tzatziki sauce, they use tofo to make theirs. Also want to try the stroganoff w/ red pepper rice. Can't wait to go back and try new snackies after some new tats.

EzeVbKrxLQ9650FQeDOqDA.text: My family went here last weekend for a late lunch - around 2:00, so it wasn't very busy. We were seated inside and then waited and waited for a server to come over for our drink order. No one came over so after 20 minutes or so, we left. Won't try again.

iyWCYpcxzF5II8InGyipgw.text: I love this place for a casual dinner or a brunch door to hit every pallet, my friends love burgers and i love the vegan options!

g7eCTmod35qqU2P4lrLhPQ.text: Had brunch on a Saturday morning. Atmosphere and service were great! The menu had a huge selection of great looking breakfast choices. I enjoyed the double wide eggs Benedict with a bowl of cheesy grits. Excellent. We will be returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

pYoEL6kXTceJLTNY2OwxtA.text: I ordered a 15$ pasta dish. Normally these dishes twice the size of what I got. Finished the dish and was still incredibly hungry, I weigh 150lbs so I'm no fatass either.

k0tr-Elib5an03FZnI9gFg.text: Great food and atmosphere with a ton of vegan/vegetarian options. Ask for Bilyta as your server - she is amazing and goes above and beyond!

bCbqiuY9MPwtTClJ1Ra5Mw.text: A gem. This is one of the strangest restaurants of all time. I felt like I was hanging out on the set of Trailer Park Boys (they commit to the theme hardcore), yet they offer an impressive array of vegan and gluten free options. It's quite the juxtaposition. They have gluten free bread and buns, and they even have a gluten free / vegan dessert that was killer. They call it a Goo Ball, and it consists of honey, oats, crisp rice, flax seed, and peanut butter. This place was so unique and satisfying... I just couldn't resist leaving a review.

lecMfAvZQy2Pow0hokYbnA.text: The Pros: GREAT comfort food Strong drinks Delicious brunch menu Endless vegan and vegetarian options - EVEN FOR BRUNCH!  Yay! Huge outdoor patio space Nice women's restrooms Expansive cocktail list Adorable, kitschy atmosphere Flo, the waitress in the bar, is the best  The Cons: You can't make reservations They can get pretty packed Food is reasonably priced, but the cocktails hit the wallet a little harder than the atmosphere makes it seem like they should.

sRhhu7Y-Ni9eJvjsxtP18g.text: vegan friendly! great atmosphere. cool vintage looking gas station and crazy decor. the seitan wings are the BEST!! must try, even if youre a meat-eater!!! my go-to is the seitan cheesesteak, on a nice hoagie bun with grilled peppers & onions and a vegan cheese sauce. :) the bartender Anthony is the greatest!!! such great service every time. LOVE!

P74Zam3XPQ93Nbc4J99V5g.text: Very friendly staff. Amazing selection of food, definitely recommend trying the mac n cheese.  Best part is the dog patio available.

D5W98ljfGyUtIt_8hNcVYQ.text: I like sitting on the patio to eat here. And it's dog-friendly (you can bring your pups to eat on on the patio--very cool). Decent beer list. Food is pretty good, but disclaimer-I'm not vegetarian or vegan, and this place is known for that sort of fare. I think if you are a vegetarian or vegan, you would give this 5 stars.

lmFqm0Rygv6mNbQIN4mqzg.text: It's very hard to get a drink at Double Wide's.  First you enter the restaurant and are made to wait at a hostess stand while the host or hostess ignores your party.  Then when you decide to go sit at the bar because you are tired of waiting around like a fucking asshole; you sit and sit and no amount of gesturing or gesticulation directed at the bartender yields your drink.  Meanwhile the bartender(s) are either updating their Twitter, "I'm like, so @ work right now, LOL!!!", chatting with their bff on Facers, or texting away like it's the first time they ever had a cell phone.  When you finally do get your drink, you better not drink it too quickly or by the time the bartender comes back around, your bleached bones will resemble a skeleton in the Sahara.    Went in for lunch during the work week one time; big mistake.  First the whole getting told to wait at the hostess stand, in an empty restaurant, while she disappears for an inordinate amount of time.  Then the whole "we have no regard for the fact that you might have to get back to work, so we're to take an hour and a half to complete the process." Seriously Double Wides, you've never had lunch customers that have to get back to work?  Lunch is about getting in and getting out, not about dessert drinks and seconds on pecan pie.   Now, I'm not just being a gigantic malcontent for no reason.  I've been to Double Wides about 20 times and its always the same shite service.  Why do I keep subjecting myself to their lazy ways?  Well, the food is really good with a definite Southern flare.  Plus, if you can get a drink, they have an excellent beer selection and two awesome drink specials: $2.75 Jagers (anytime) and "Breakfast" one Tecate and one tequilla shot for $5.25.  SOLID.    So Double Wides, stop hiring these hipster jerks that won't take your customer's drink orders and streamline the seating process; it's annoying as hell to get ignored.  Oh, and one more thing.  Get your science right about fraqing.  Nothing is happening to the drinking water.  Fraqing happens at 7500', the water table is at less than 1000' nothing is matriculating up through a mile of rock.  Naturally occurring methane (coal) is to blame for whatever wad the felonious Gaslands documentary has gotten your panties into.  GO GAS!

lymYN69o204pMYWW-a85TA.text: So, while I really, really do appreciate that DWG have more than a couple vegan options, I just haven't had anything great here. Nothing about this place is great and on top of that, it's kind of expensive! I did here that they opened up a section of their deck where you can bring dogs again, and because I love to bring my two furkids out into the world, I might give this place a fourth try... But it really is only so-so.

rbUamVtI58tdqBhcJmyytQ.text: Brought a team out for the Tuesday rib special. Long wait and once the guys ate their first round of ribs (after waiting an hour), the waitress said it would be a longer wait for the next round. That and a rib eye steak that was paper thin did not make it a good experience.

LNFOpxAnd_TSLUoJ2wMqnA.text: "All you can eat" ribs on tuesdays should be called "all you can wait for". Went in for the first time yesterday Tuesday the 19th of August, and had VERY slow service. I waited only 10 minutes for my first piece which was great.  After that I waited 25 minutes for another serving. Then after I finished that second plate - HALF the size of the original - I waited 35 minutes for a third. After more than an hour and a half I had less than a single rack of ribs.  Sincerely, Disappointed

pZa0spB2546DyX8YE6OgXA.text: The outdoor seating is great, really get to see all the sights of the South Side. I ordered a cheese burger which was excellent, 1 of the best burgers I ever had. Came with a side of fries which were pretty good but wish they would of gave me more.  My wife had the cooked vegetable and Brie salad and added grilled BBQ chicken.  She said it was also really good. Other than not getting enough fries the 6 blue moon beers we had were a bit expensive ($33). They have a huge extensive menu and can't wait to go back and try something different.

Cwmle_IqgZIjRWcmU0RMhw.text: I've had some pretty mixed experiences here; it's very hit or miss. Great place to surprise friends with their inventive vegan offerings. Good place to take kiddos as well.

juVOz8a9ehjg83Gk51HKVA.text: I was there 7/5/2014 & ordered a whole slab of ribs platter. The ribs were fall off the bone. However, the ribs tasted quite like they were baked & not smoked. They were overpriced. They didn't have any hickory or mesquite flavor. I told the waitress that. My fruit cup was not full. My grits were Ok but not delicious, but cheesy. The service was good, but my food was overpriced, more than $24 per order. That's why I only ordered water to drink. The atmosphere is good. I sat outside on the patio. For the price, I expect delicious and I didn't get that.

4NaroOBn02jGjfTZgrdjyQ.text: Love it! Relaxed atmosphere, good beer, and the dog patio makes this place our go to after a long day.

SDw3KAhDulXqC8EXXOwJjQ.text: I probably would have never chosen to go to this place as a new resident of Pittsburgh but when I saw it on Groupon and read the reviews stating that it had a good vegetarian selection, I thought I would give it a try.   The aesthetic of this place is like a sports bar with decor such as beer bottles made into lamp covers and hubcaps all over the roof, but the vegetarian cuisine was as dead on as some run down hipster vegetarian joint. The seitan wings with parmesan garlic sauce were incredibly delicious. My girlfriend had this coconut fried tofu dish that had great potato sides that was pretty tasty as well. I personally had this dish called a potato taco. This was quite a unique and delicious dish.  All in all, the seitan wings were definitely the highlight and I would go back for that alone. The bar seems to have a good beer selection so this is probably a good place to take beer snob friends. Also looks like they have a good creative mixed drink selection that I would be interested in tapping into next time. I recommend.

MAMOoWigvJIdm_NQRwSDgw.text: I found out about Double Wide Grill on the search for great restaurants with plenty of vegetarian options, which they certainly have!  I've come here for dinner and drinks a couple times and it's been fairly decent both times. Their service and location are both unfortunate, seeing as the hostesses do a good job of ignoring guests and it's located smack-dab in the middle of the Southside (womp womppp). I will say, however, those veg chicken wings (make sure you get the garlic parmesan) are the BEST veg wings I've ever had! Spak Brothers is definitely a close second.  My main entree for both instances was pretty good, but not outstanding. I had a crispy tofu dish with lime and cilantro and rice. While it was yummy, it was one of those situations where it wasn't tasty enough for me to want to eat the leftovers for lunch the next day.  All in all, Double Wide has a wide variety of O.K. vegetarian options, though there isn't a whole lot that really stands out (aside from the seitan wings). Be wary of the service! They can tend to be a bit on the unfriendly side.

oAxvg4W-APjhUeqO4630ag.text: Why don't I come here more often? That is what I am asking myself after coming last night. The food is surprisingly good and there are tons of options ranging from small plates to BBQ to vegetarian. If you happen to follow my reviews, you may have noticed that my theme this week is OUTDOOR SEATING!! (I guess it's that time of year...) With that in mind, Double Wide is one of the best options on the east end of the flats. While they were out of almost everything on tap, our waitress told us upfront and handled it well, apologizing profusely and offering to let us try some new beers. And now for the kicker... they have corn hole on the weekends!

_omnM6w4drW9wV6S5rE9-w.text: One of my favorite places to eat in the Southside. I love the food. The service is always amazing. The vegan and vegetarian items are clearly marked, and makes it easy to order. Prices are great. Awesome selection of beer. Try the bbq seitan on a wrap... with cheddar cheese. And shoestring fries. It makes my day.

CRkHG3xdTphJiQcm461Hiw.text: Double Wide is a place I like going to in the summer. I love the outdoor seating and it doesn't get rowdy at this end of Carson. The waitstaff has always been quick and response. I've only had the BBQ but its always been good. They have a pretty minimal beer selection compared to other Southside establishments but still decent.  If you want a good relaxing night out in he Southside, I would suggest Double Wide.

hyzWJkErSlP9wCVouFzJ-Q.text: Very hit and miss. Some items a great (the appetizers) and pulled pork, while others are bland and lack flavor, the fish tacos and chicken sandwich.  Decent Draft list. Best to go in summer and chill outside.

V15Hjmc3oekGR_rFR1h8Qg.text: This is quite possibly the least dog friendly establishment I have ever been to. It is highly advertised as "dog friendly" but in fact they completely isolate you and your party from the rest of the restaurant. In addition to that, it is beyond self service. We had to move our own table together, wipe and clean it ourselves and then you must walk up to a counter to order drinks and any food items. You must also pick up or drinks and food yourself at said counter. The worst part is in this area all silverware, cups and dinnerware is paper/plastic. The food took a terribly long time and food was not the best. There are open trash cans lining the area for you to then bus and dispose of your waste. Compared to every other establishment I've been to that is dog friendly that has outside seating or a patio where we have been treated as every other customer just with an animal companion, double wide grill was just not a pleasant experience.

maR1g8usRiYC9sacVlSuNg.text: This place is great for vegans and omnivores. They have a vegan/vegetarian menu with plenty of options for all. My favorite are the seitan wings with vegan BBQ sauce. I get them every time I go. I have tried a few of the other vegan dishes and liked them all but my go-to is still the seitan wings.   The service is slow but staff are friendly. Gets loud during peak hours and when there is a big sports game on. Parking in this area of South Side isn't too bad either.

81ZZww-_Cj_6uwKJyNYyJg.text: I was seated outside with a cigar. I just wanted a beer. Later I was treated very rudely because the hostess didn't realize I had a cigar and was told to move. The food here is not good at all. Also, if you are white DO NOT come here with black people and order food.

nX1HOe2igbwxF1-eszY2RA.text: Had a pretty mediocre breakfast here today. The 'side' of home fry potatoes on my plate and my son's consisted of 6 pieces of new potatoes. I thought it was just a garnish. The eggs Benedict were pretty good though.   I brought it to the attention of the server who said I could go talk to the manager. If the server actually cared, she'd bring the manager to me.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

u-0WaHbCddk_70CwpkbWhg.text: This place is great! The staff is friendly and incredibly helpful. The decor is a fun nod at its original roots of being a full service gas staion/garage.   They definitely cater to a large crowd. Anyone can find something to eat here whether your vegetarian, omnivore, or even vegan! I highly recommend their Bloody Mary's. Their a perfect blend of kick with a little bit of heat without any of the crazy fad nonsense garnishes. You also can't go wrong with their Seitan Wings, even if you an omnivore! The breading and sauce are just too good to be True.

HmpQUKAvKybVW_v0MSrDFw.text: That's it. Done.  I tried it as a meat eater over 7 years ago...FAIL - on all levels. And giving it another go on their vegan menu today. . .FAIL again. This is the type of restaurant that I am referencing when I say that the Top Owners aren't real chefs or foodie people. This is the type of restaurant where a group of savvy real estate people who bought property in busy and upcoming areas, and decorated the insides to pander to certain demographics.   That being said. The food was awful and they will never get my business again. I literally threw away $30 worth of food tonight. I thought wrong that in looking at their extensive vegan menu, that the kitchen knew what they were doing.  I ordered ToGo thru GrubHub around 3 hours before my estimated pick-up. Thought that makes it easy for everyone. . . It was inedible. We just couldn't eat it. First - everything was cold; but at the same time, there was burnt tofu. So we put the food in the oven to reheat it. That didn't help it at all. The flavors were super vinegary and over salty - I'm not even sure what was trying to be accomplished in either dish. And the vegan veggie of the day were gross packaged vegetables, sauteed in something super salty. My husband and I are both former line cooks for multiple restaurants, and even if we don't particularly like something, we almost NEVER complain, and will finish almost any dish. But we called and complained. It was too much food we were throwing away. :(  I'm mostly mad at myself for giving them another chance. In all of the times I had been there, it was a traditionally bad experience. But no - I had to believe the sheeple and believe that "their menu really IS good now." No. It's not. And it never will be.   I will end with the ONE plus side - the manager on the phone handled the situation very well with my husband, and took flavor feedback for the kitchen. I don't know what will come of the flavor feedback, but neither will I be willing to find out.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tofu was sliced too thin and burnt on one side. The sauce was like peanut water. And the baby carrots were gross.
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Meatless Stroganoff was unappealing, unappetizing, and vinegary.

m4gACMc-YhmGn_GxNvynIg.text: Very poorly staffed.  Waited 30 minutes to be seated when there were plenty of open tables.  Waited another 60 minutes for our food.  Felt really bad for the server who just kept refilling our drinks while we kept asking where our food was.

xKcdkxn5u3zsa10kIsJ3uw.text: Neat restaurant located in an old gas station/auto garage. The four of us sat outside under an umbrella for brunch. We ordered a black and blue burger, a trucker breakfast, the porker pancakes, the double wide eggs Benedict, ic d tea, and a bloody Mary. The portions were generous but not obscene. There were no survivors. Service was decent, and prices were fair.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Double wide eggs Benedict

FpQZnA7VgNl5WGqxcEhKEA.text: We went to the Double Wide last week and left after being told that our favorite server, Billie, was "no longer working there." We went to the Double Wide Grill every week just to see Billie, and I was so upset to learn that she had been fired that we turned around and left. We won't be back -- Billie was far and away their best server, very warm and personable, always on top of our drink and food orders, and took the time to really get to know us. I genuinely can't imagine what justification they would have to terminate Billie, as she was truly fantastic, and we were just two of many regulars who came there just to see her.   The food at the Double Wide is just OK. It isn't particularly flavorful or anything that you would make a special trip to eat. Its main claims to fame are (1) having vegetarian and vegan options, (2) having a patio, and (3) having a spot for dogs outside. NOT the food (I don't know anyone who goes there for the food...). My son would get the pizza, and the pepperoni was almost always burnt (how do you screw up a presumably frozen pizza?!?), while my meals usually were under seasoned and dry. For example, the refried beans in the vegetarian tacos seemed like they had been sitting in a pan for hours before being slapped into a taco. Again, we went there because Billie was so friendly and warm, and made the place seem like home. Now we'll find a new spot for our Monday night dinners.

mu_54agJJaymzHYVIcyNcA.text: So gooooood!! My bf and I are vegan and we're struggling to find any good vegan restaraunts - this place caters to vegans/vegetarian/meat eaters.  Their seitan wings are to die for and I'm in love with the vegan philly cheese steak .. highly reccomend for all types of diets!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Seitan wings - to die for
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegan stroganoff
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegan philly cheese steak - AMAZING

pAum1Amyw6QtWjIco-W9jg.text: Since I couldn't find the double-wide trailer that served food, I decided to stop here and was happy to discover that this converted body shop was not an actual double-wide but a restaurant. More to my enjoyment was that they served vegan food. I decided to have the Seitan Barbeque wings and my entree was the TV Dinner (Barbeque sandwich, mixed veggies, French fries, veggie kabobs, and cole slaw). Yes, this was all vegan and I was drooling thinking about it. But as I've experience in the past looks and thoughts of a delicious meal can be deceiving--this meal was not the case. Everything was delicious and was the best TV dinner I've ever had, even when I was a bachelor and this was my nightly meal.   Outside of the meal, the ambiance and service was great. We sat outside on the patio and experienced an amazing night of beautiful weather.  Would I go back? Heck to the veggie yes, and encourage any vegan, or vegetarian, to support this trendy establishment.

1JGJFNvJCXhrHIuIo8zojQ.text: I typically visit Double wide for the outdoor seating, and their food is decent as well. Was very disappointed yesterday when I was told Happy hour is only offered if you sit inside at the bar. Enough said... I left. Being in the Southside, there are PLENTY of other options that offer both outdoor seating AND Happy hour prices.

O4D9soO6_GkTaVN5ZdbCuA.text: Terrible service, came here on a Sunday and the staff was so unhelpful it was almost unreal they literally had 50 tables available didn't want to seat us told us to get a seat at the bar which had no seats purely don't like this place for the staff and their lack of customer service.

f2PfRoUldwheMRzk5e4kFA.text: Ordered two ribeyes for a table of six people along with other food. After twenty min the manager came over to tell us that they only had one ribeye left.  I ended up with the one and wished I would have ordered anything but the ribeye. Sides were wrong and the meat was undercooked. They won't ever see me again.

9rQlJ0My7CZJYg_-O2U-jA.text: I wanna love this place bc of the vegan options but every time I order 8/8 there has been an issue with our order.

AC9eDmuRc1KfB_3UUmT4qA.text: Groupon is bad news when all is said and done. The manager made me whole monetarily but the experience made me angry, and that ruined the evening.  I responded to an ad for a $20 groupon and wound up buying a $40 Groupon accidentally. I didn't even realize it was an option until it was too late. Well, a $40 groupon will work when I take my family but tonight it'll just be us two so I went ahead and also bought the $20.  Turns out, three of us went so I expected to use the $40 Groupon after all. When I went to redeem it, the waitress said oh the fine print says for four people and you only have three.  Nevermind that we had over $50 in food between the three of us (and adding alcohol we were just shy of $80.) I didn't want the $40 Groupon to begin with and felt tricked into purchasing it, and now the waitress is telling me I am violating the small print, but I could use a $20 groupon. (Now, why would she think I might have both?). And she kept going on and on about it and finally I told her to stop! Just stop talking. I was angry now, the night was ruined at this point feeling that I had been swindled and I simply wanted to leave.  By this time they had both of my groupon numbers and I clicked redeem on the $20 one. Apparently she let the manager know I was not happy and he said they can use the $40 groupon after all.  But now both groupons show redeemed so to make up for it they gave me a $20 gift card. (And I tipped based on the $80 sale even though the waitress could have prevented the whole episode.)  So ok, yeah, I am not out anything moneywise.  But the experience was infuriating and not one I want to repeat.  I won't remember my meal in a couple months but I will always remember this terrible Groupon experience at Double Wide.   Groupon just isn't worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Helltown Mischievous brown ale.
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Woodchuck amber cider

GJUz4x0qbj39mL9YVeczPQ.text: I normally only take to Yelp for outstanding reviews, but I will make an exception here. It was very slow, but the food took forever and was all cold, but our server didn't come to check on us until we were basically done, so we just ate it out of hunger. We had to track someone down to ask for the check. Really disappointing.

VpNSZKGmEdbsAtxQRGdEzw.text: We stopped in here for a drink based on the recommendation of our shuttle driver. It is a tastefully decorated themed restaurant and bar. Although we did not eat, they had some really interesting and unique menu choices. Everyone that was eating seemed pleased with their food. The staff was all friendly. I am guessing that most of the patrons were tourists because there was no vibe of them being regulars or even locals. Since there wasn't much going on in the way of conversation or interaction at the bar, we just had one drink and left. We will have to go back in the future to try the foods.

d73-_5rA8PKokkHkpf_1wg.text: Good food, OK service. Ordered a plate to share, but took staff a bit to get us an extra plate. Nice enough, but really?

VOVTxgKzwN04gE40VxHqiw.text: The double wide grill is a dangerous investment. Harry S and myself used to frequent the establishment and receive excellent service and delicious food. Some would say A1. Upon arriving at double wide on September 20th 2018. Well, let's just say things have changed. The food was trifling. The waitress was trifling. The table was wobbly and my drink was too cold. Harry and I might come back but probably won't.

b_lER6-veWCTqPjFIHUL_g.text: Last summer, double wide was Peter and I's favorite spot to eat. Food was amazing and service was great. Unfortunately, I'm here to inform you times have changed. The wings were the wrong sauce, mostly tasting like chewing tobacco, and our waitress would have been faster if she had no legs. I'm very disappointed. Would probably come back, but most definitely won't.

zqF95nsfjhn6dBtG_ea6WA.text: I have never been disappointed at the double wide Grill. I have given up eating red meat and pork. Still they have a great selection of fish dishes. I had to dry rubbed Mahi Mahi.  They also have an excellent selection of vegetarian dishes.

Xq_om8xix8whCaV72FIj2Q.text: Very disappointing- I've been here a number of times in the past and it was good, but not so much today. One person I came with ordered a burger medium rare and got a charbroiled, burnt patty (the booth next to us had the same problem). The fries were short and crusty, basically the end bits from the fryer.  Two of us ordered the seitan cheese steak- it arrived slathered in BBQ sauce with no cheese! I double checked the menu- no mention of sweet BBQ sauce. I would have never ordered it if I knew it would be sweet- but there was no mention of BBQ sauce in the menu AT ALL.  Generally disappointing. Wait staff was disappointing- I hate to blame her tho because maybe they were short staffed. Sadly won't be back again :(  My friend asked me to add- no toilet paper in ladies room. WTF Doublewide?

tn6SfUiVdz6KeD48lD7UhA.text: I had high hopes for this place and it was slightly disappointing. The seitan wings were delicious and a great choice, I highly recommend them. I had the trailer park punch which was advertised as "Best cocktail Winner" No, it wasn't. It was bland, and overall kind of yucky. For a cocktail that costs almost $8 I would like it to taste better. I had the seitan pulled pork sandwich, the bread it was on was a terrible choice. It was a multigrain bread that was super thin and it was hard to eat, and it was messy in a not delicious way.  My boyfriend had the pulled pork platter, and it was delicious. It had a syrupy, tangy sauce and came on the perfect bread. He left fat and happy. The creamy cherry coleslaw was bland, I was waiting for something special but it never came.  But overall, it was a nice experience. The decor is cool, the service is quick and courteous. I could see this place being fun in the summertime.

yg_LPVNObFpVGPaejxTD_Q.text: I get the pineapple chicken wrap with sweet potato fries every time I go here for lunch and they never disappoint. It is a truly unique wrap. I used to not like this place because the food I got was always so-so until I discovered this gem. I get an extra side of the buffalo sauce because it is THAT good and the sweet potato fries come with a cinnamon sugar dipping sauce, which is phenomenal. I would highly recommend this place to anyone in the southside area.

acWIYx0fxs5PU4VzL5X6Bw.text: The Tuesday all you can eat ribs are just a joke. The ribs are cold inside and served with lukewarm fries and crappy coleslaw. The beer selection was good, but food is just too bad.

XlkdkSQifetLQVCTySWT-w.text: It was nice to sit outside. I went there on a blind date, and ended up have a great time.  I have the Rice balls which were delicious.  I don't really eat there, but the atmosphere was decent.

ATNQo7yxONHM6w7dmhFyPw.text: Great time.   Good food, nice beer selection and funky atmosphere.  We were there for a large (20 people) birthday party.  Kia was a fantastic waitress!  Very attentive.  I'll go back next time in Pittsburgh.

DHbTpU8j87cvpgqBEsSeMw.text: Food is great with a ton of selections!! They also have opened back up the dog friendly outdoor section. They had to section off from the rest of the area and they did a great job.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. A little historic too. Read the history on the menu.

hPCR2K9uoj1grHoNgcxNzw.text: For advertising as dog friendly this is one of the worst places to eat with your dog. The dog area is some sort of self service where you have to clean your own table, order at a counter, and retrieve your own food.  I understand that it must be some health code requirement that they do this but you can get full service at pretty much any other restaurant with a patio.

a_bvl9CcycyHY_WkUzRT0w.text: Not the typical place you'd expect to find lots of veggie options. By the looks of it, you'd expect at best to have a veggie burger as the lone non-meat option. But out of nowhere, Double Wide has an entire vegetarian and vegan menu!   It's a unique mix of people there, but I guess that's to be expected when you're part sports bar, part biker bar, and part hipster vegetarian restaurant.  Lots of outdoor seating with picnic tables, delicious vegetarian options, and a huge beer menu. The Double Wide would be right at home in Austin, but it's on Carson Street.   Five stars for sure.

7ABHNU0JAhSv4kj7tYL0gw.text: They have lots of vegetarian options here and in my humble opinion, have the best seitan wings anywhere. Good variety of beers on tap as well.

oNB29tz7aHn31YbH3h-Sig.text: Double Wide has good beers and food, cool atmosphere, and corn hole outside. What more do you need?   Double Wide is a pretty cool place to eat and have a drink. It's located in a converted gas station complete with garage doors. The food is pretty good with good burgers and BBQ.   They even have some pretty awesome vegetarian options that are good by anyone's standards. Their Seitan Wings will make you change the way you think about tofu.   They have a pretty awesome beer selection and the bar is super cool situated under a lift with an old truck on it.   This place is great for groups and can handle large and small groups well.

aKJAPbMhAbDphkCVsItImQ.text: This is the review of the dog patio. Yes, they have a dog patio. There's a few basic rules, but the awesomeness of having lunch with your pooch far outshines it. Nice patio and ADORABLE doggy menu. Our dog prefers the chicken breast. All in all, our best double wide experience yet. Oh, and the people food is delicious!

-TEdJOlEylxoo70_2ZL_Ag.text: Went for Sunday Brunch. Walked in around 1:40 and they said they stopped serving brunch for the day already, meanwhile the table next to us ordered it after we arrived. The waiter seemed to have little to no personality. I had to ask for a water around 6 times before I got one. He also knew very little about the menu and cocktails. It seemed like a great environment but sadly didn't get to experience it.

Ks77uY4GJi6haYUKEJ52dg.text: What's the definition of crazy - doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.  Well I can honestly say I've gone crazy b/c of Double Wide.  I keep going back, thinking and hoping that this will be the time it's good, this will be the time it's great, but then reality slaps me in the face and reminds me of why I avoid it here.  Besides the outdoor seating which is awesome, DWG doesn't have much going for it.  I've tried so many things on the menu and nothing sticks out as being "good".  But at the same time, nothing really screams "bad".  It's a totally forgettable dining experience.    I refuse to be DWG crazy - I've reached the end of our journey together and hope that we don't have the unfortunate pleasure of meeting again.

1hQtn1ZnXgwg6d3EaNF69w.text: We frequent the Double Wide, for both food and drink. My go-to dish is always the chili, with their delicious cornbread (and I have been known to order cornbread just as my meal, there!). We also really enjoy the Junkyard Nachos. If you are there during lunch, the grilled cheese with bacon and pears is fantastic, and I am a huge fan of their weekend brunch! We love the staff (especially at the bar), and they are always fun and attentive!  Definitely a "regular" spot for us!

ZzKk5HsS5_2VdHgmyGOE3A.text: We went to Double Wide because We had a coworker with us who needs Gluten Free options. They have a separate menu for GF options which made it really easy for her, with no guess work needed. We were in Pittsburgh for 3 nights and we ate at Double Wide for 2 of those nights because the options were so vast. I had a chicken salad the first night which was massive, and the cajun tilapia the second night. My coworker had the meatloaf which he thought was amazing! A good option for those looking for healthier dinners.

u36Rax6cKMsgNBPK7U1u-A.text: Let me start by saying that there are a lot of chairs. This is the sole reason for a four star review instead of a five star review. They were slightly too tall and a shorter person may not have been able to have their feet touch the floor. I am not short, and my feet firmly touched the floor, but I worry for my short friends and family who may have their legs dangling while they eat. This could be quite a displeasure. What I do like about the chairs is that you can use the posts for a temporary cup holster in an emergency situation. Very handy! The padding on the chairs are mediocre at best and left my buttocks slightly asleep during and shortly after my meal. Along with these minor grievances the chairs are too heavy for the average human, which leads me to believe these chairs quite possibly weren't made for human beings. Just a thought. All in all, good food. Horrible chairs. Great atmosphere.  (P.S. The booths looks more comfortable)

ySXvjNotA9ByHxowkFOkzA.text: I came here with my family, as it was one of the few places we could find that catered to both carnivores and vegans.  Our server - let's call him Alex - was a little odd.  First he introduced himself and took our drink orders.  He came back with our drinks a few minutes later and asked us if we were ready to order.  We were ready to order, but before waiting for our answer he turned to my father and started talking to him about the baseball game playing on the television.  My parents don't speak very good English and it was obvious that my father wasn't able to follow what Alex was saying.  Alex seemed to suddenly realize this, and then inexplicably walked away without saying anything.  We were confused, to say the least.    He came back ten minutes later and introduced himself...again.  He took our orders.  I ordered the full order of seitan wings with vegan barbecue sauce with some vegan shoestring fries.  My brother ordered a sandwich.  My parents ordered something or other - I can't remember.  A while later, he appeared with our food.  He put down a small plate of cubed seitan in front of me.  He then asked, "You ordered the half order right?"  I said no, I ordered the full order.  He said, "Crap, I'll be right back with your full order."    He came back shortly with a second plate.  I noticed that everyone but me had a little plastic cup filled with sauce.  There was a pitiful amount of drizzled hot sauce on my seitan blocks.  I reminded Alex that I had ordered barbecue sauce and asked him to bring me a cup of it.  He said, "No, you ordered hot sauce.  I KNOW you ordered hot sauce.  I would have remembered if you ordered barbecue sauce.  Do you want to add barbecue sauce as well?"  I insisted that no, I'd ordered barbecue sauce and he insisted that no, I hadn't, I'd ordered hot sauce.  I didn't want to ruin what was supposed to be a pleasant evening out with my family so I let it go.  I was extremely annoyed.  Borderline furious.  He came back later on to check on us and asked us where we were from.  We could see that he had no idea that it existed, nor that he cared.  He said, "Oh, I was wondering why you didn't understand the baseball thing," and then immediately left again at a half-trot.  Soooooo weird.  My brother noticed that his "sandwich" lacked a piece of bread.  Last I heard, two slices of bread are the required criteria for a sandwich.  My family members' meals were so-so.  My vegan seitan wings were actually really good and tasted exactly how I remembered chicken wings to taste like.  However, the hot sauce which I hadn't ordered or wanted gave me an upset stomach.  I was definitely peeved.  The atmosphere was great.  You can eat outside or inside.  It was too humid to eat outside so we chose inside.  It's set up like an old mechanic's shop, which I'm assuming it used to be.  Real cool set up.  There's only one huge TV instead of a thousand small ones, and normally with a more professional/attentive server and food served the way I'd ordered it, I'm sure I would have had a great time.  I wouldn't really recommend this place if you have other options available.  We all left dissatisfied with the food and service.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegan seitan wings with vegan shoestring fries.

ob_weQhk8POcImeDZz0R6Q.text: Love love love this place!  No where else have I been able to eat my own vegetarian diet while watching my husband blissfully eat his carniverous one!  He says the pulled pork sandwich is his favorite, followed by the ribs.  I am just so happy I can find tofu AND seitan cooked well in this town! I like getting the TV tray dinner, which I still have not been able to finish but gives me the option to ahve a variety of different dishes.  Oh, and the cornbread is AMAZING! Great selection of beers, fun place to watch a game or grab dinner. Mindy, the server, is awesome too!

kIPXpmUBuuDpeNIfm-ulvw.text: I have been to the Double Wide about a dozen times and have never been disappointed with the food.  My favorite is the Rubin and I am still trying to duplicate the sauce they serve with the sweet potato fries!   The servers have aways been friendly and right there when we needed them  My partner is vegetarian and always enjoys being able to order tofu anything!  Not a lot of restaurants in Pittsburgh offer tofu unless they are Asian.

t-9qH6BT5WnXv0DDs3ppcg.text: The menu is confusing, it will list that a dish is served with rice and daily vegetable. It also says you get two sides. If you get the two sides, you don't get the things the meal comes with. We were confused, asked our waitress, who was completely clueless. If you order stroganoff, you need rice or something. We explained we wanted the meal as served. She was rude and acted like it was our fault. Food was cold.

Poe9QAGcJIiiCV87618kwg.text: This review is for their brunch which is served on both Saturday and Sunday.  (3 stars for lunch or dinner).  It was a rainy Saturday and our group was glad to sit outside under their porch for a very lovely brunch.  I was somewhat skeptical as their food for dinner is just mediocre bbq.  I was pleasantly surprised they had a huge brunch menu with lots of options I wanted to try from omelets to French toast and pancakes.  I went with an omelet that was served with brie, apple slices, and walnuts.  It was delicious and these toppings were actually put on top of scrambled eggs but nevertheless a great combo.  The dish also came with potatoes and a slice of fruit.  I would love to go back and try the pancakes which others in our group ordered including chocolate chip and blueberry which looked fantastic!  They also have lots of fun drink options including a bloody mary and mimosa.  The service was excellent and our food came out very quickly.

BGWIFzS-MW7bx2G3mhqZXQ.text: Double Wide Grill is a surprising place to find vegan options, but I was more than happy with my findings. I went in and tried the lentil burger and fries as well as an order of seitan buffalo wings. My two friends ordered what I believe were vegetarian dishes - a portobello burger and some type of hearty chili.   For a place that sells bar-like junk food, my lentil burger was certainly healthy. It tasted healthy. I wouldn't order it again because it was too healthy for a restaurant meal, and when I eat out, I like to indulge a little. Either way, I recognize its value as a good menu option and it is definitely a great choice for someone who wants to eat healthier when they eat out.   The seitan wings were interesting. The restaurant obviously doesn't specialize in vegan food, but they had a unique texture and flavor I have never experienced with seitan before. That's a GOOD thing.   The chili my friend had was also amazing. It was filling, nutritious and flavorful.   Prices are great for the portion sizes, and our server was incredible. She was very helpful in helping us choose items, and she brought refills promptly.   I look forward to returning to Double Wide Grill and trying some of the other vegan items on the menu. It's a fun atmosphere even though we went while it was quiet. I would love to go here again during the night and have drinks.

fVDH47Kl0aXlfEPUGlCf3A.text: Lots of meat on the menu - ribs, BBQ,. I got the meatloaf - pretty good with lumpy garlic mashed potatoes- the strings beans were hard, I sent them back only to get the same beans back just hotter and tougher, the waitress couldn't fix it.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

NjDAf4plqR3UTmO5VNloNQ.text: After a couple of visits, I have to say I do enjoy this place!  The first time we went it was blazing hot and we were there with a largish group.....including a very well-behaved puppy.  They actually have a special outdoor place for the pooches to hang with their owners, but (and I'm sure this is for sanitary reasons) the servers can't actually enter that area so it makes the service a little disjointed.  That, and it was blazing hot, made it a little awkward.  But then the food, oooooh, the food!  They have an impressive vegan offering, and so many fun combinations....I ended up with a yummy chicken sandwich and the cheesy rice balls, and sweet potato fries.  It was one of those times I ate so much it was uncomfortable....but oh so worth it!  Plus, for the gluten free they do take care of you, too, so definitely stop by.

MRiJGbXAq9TxhNzOdydhJA.text: Great place to bring out of town guests, or to go with people who have different dining preferences.  This former gas station has a cool garage-themed ambiance with a friendly (though not always very attentive) staff.  They have a pretty diverse menu, including many vegetarian and gluten free options, as well as ribs and other BBQ fare.  There is also a huge outdoor patio, with a sectioned-off space for those who want to dine with their dogs.   I highly recommend the brunch. The lunch/dinner menu can be hit or miss. For vegetarians, I recommend the coconut curry tofu, the potato tacos, and the veggie chilli cheese fries, the salads, and everything veggie on the brunch menu. I would probably stay away from the lentil veggie burger unless you like a mushy burger. The seitan "wings" are interesting, though not necessarily good. They also have a great selection of cocktails.

HaUEkzqd8ahjouFlhvq1tQ.text: I'm into places with great outdoor seating. I think it's because I like to people watch/spy on people.  It always makes the dining experience more enjoyable!    It also doesn't hurt that there's a delish brunch offered on Saturdays and Sundays from 10 - 2.  I struggle to find a good Eggs Benedict besides my beloved Perkins Eggs Benny!  They have two versions to choose from, and let me tell you my friend, go with the Double Wide Benedict!  Fried eggs, bacon,  spinach, and CORN BREAD!!   WINNING!  And what makes a brunch even better....a boozy one!  The peach Bellini hit the spot!  What's also great is they have a ton of events like trivia and karaoke nights.  Surprisingly, there are few places in the burgh to get your roake on, so this is a welcome addition!  I'll be back to eat and spy on people this summer!!

g0XRDlHV9iRHnbRj_qMIBA.text: Food was very good and my wife said the brisket was the best she had ever had.  Busy Saturday night - the wait was only 15 min but it took longer than expected for our meals to arrive - server apologized for the delay - deserts to go where awesome later!

qlkkFWS9KM0vQBaqqfr-ow.text: The pulled porky sandwich and fries ever very good. I would recommend this sandwich if you like sweet BBQ. The outdoor seating was lovely and the waiter was attentive

Px-iLWXbL0lVvOxcH2ZfDQ.text: All I have to say is Seitan Wings! For all my Vegans trying to curve you Hot wing cravings this is the place!   I was in Pittsburgh for work and my awesome driver found this place for me. I wasn't sure what to expect since I hadn't been to many Bars that had vegan options. I 'm from Texas where beer and BBQ go hand and hand not meatless wings. I was thrilled to be able to sit at the bar have a beer and enjoy a vegan meal!  The staff was helpful and friendly . This was my first time to Pittsburgh and Double Wide definitely left a lasting impression.  Great Food and great service. looking forward to my next visit to Pittsburgh!

LAOpClw5-VMOkwqM1_5k7g.text: I was very excited to go here since there are so many vegan options, it's a definite plus. I ordered the veggyro with red pepper rice and my sister ordered the pulled seitan sandwich with a fruit cup. It's a great place to watch the game or have a big group. When our food came they got my sisters order wrong and didn't put tomatoes or lettuce in her sandwich. They also gave her coleslaw instead of her fruit cup. I thought the seitan in the veggyro had way too much sauce spilling out of it too. At least the food was good and the service was friendly and fast.

D-KeXO3evUh5BB9qbSvFEA.text: Double Wide Grill is like an abusive relationship: you keep telling yourself that the last time will indeed be the last time. The last time you eat their terrible food, the last time you put up with their absolutely atrocious service, the last time you put up with their usuals, who they only pay attention to, that may be brain damaged and do nothing but scream the same three things across the bar. Well I'm wising up. No more, Double Wide Grill. No more.

sFvu4suAFjNjNi86ucfaqg.text: Food Was just ok. Salt and pepper, perhaps the kitchen manager could introduce the cooks to these two kitchen items. Omg the noise from clanging plates was so loud. The waiter was kind and effective.

_Qkcd5AGTZZAUGfRmi0OUQ.text: The best thing about Double Wide is the outdoor seating and the cute servers.  They have a decent selection of beers too, but the food wasn't that impressive.  I only got a burger with onion rings, but my dining companions weren't super thrilled with the food either.    It's decently priced though and good for groups, but the meats in the burgers weren't very flavorful nor was the onion rings I got or the soggy fries that T9 got.  They did have a lot of vegetarian and vegan options though for those non-meat eaters.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cheeseburger w/onion rings

G3hynddpTjckfkyri9XNxQ.text: I'm writing this based purely on the dog park section. I'm not sure what the full restaurant is nice. The only reason we ever go here is because we can take the pups. They have a small doggie friendly menu and offer lots of bowls with water pitchers. The people food, however, is always lacking. Tiny portions and always feels half-assed. I've heard nothing but excellent things about the inside restaurant, though!

6Zgop3jD99DSSMwQjMHHrQ.text: Great food, super fun atmosphere & honestly the service was the very BEST we've had! Kia waited on our group of 20 boisterous family members as we celebrated our brother's 60th birthday. She never faltered! All the orders were correct, water glasses filled, drink orders timely. She even cut & served the birthday cake. By the time we left the restaurant we were hugging & kissing her. Lol. There aren't enough ways to say thank you!! We'll be back.

ZeCo_i9WRP5M8bSbG_6BPQ.text: The first time I visited double wide, I was very pleased with my experience.  I ordered coconut-flavored tofu and it was delicious! The seitan wings were also very tasty and the service was great, however, the last two times that I have visited it was very disappointing in terms of service.  The service was very slow in seating us (said it would be 20 min for 2 people and it was 45), taking our order, and bringing out our food.  I'm not sure why there would be such a huge difference in service between my experiences, but I can only guess that it was because the second and third times were during the winter when they didn't have additional seating outside? I will probably give it another chance in the summer to redeem itself!

6e3x3wrE58UlWQPruz6XGw.text: While I have family in the area this is the first time staying in the city and I was in the mood for some BBQ. The Double Wide Grill hit the spot. Service was great, food was wonderful. I just wish I had had enough room to finish it all in one sitting. We will definitely be back.

di6yLA_lWPlX8DMk0seCvA.text: One of my favorite places in the Southside!  All around good food! Outdoor seating and plenty of drafts.  They have awesome mild wings, the BRIKET is great (if they have any left) in the summer.  + cornhole outside when the wether is nice

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sunday stack! Thanks for awesome service as always Jaime!

YLRB-Ww-DgRQeJnENXT7PA.text: I've been to the Double Wide several times - it definitely has it's pluses, but also has minuses (hence, the middle of the road rating).  Pluses:  The cornbread:  It's good. It has a sugary crust on it that is a delightful surprise. I love corn bread and the Double Wide has gooood cornbread!  The drinks: Fantastic, in general. The beer selection is great and they will bring you a sample of anything they have on tap to make sure you like it before you order a full draft.  The mixed drinks are generally pretty good too. They have a great mixed drink/cocktail menu that has a lot of fun stuff on it. That said, I've been there for brunch and what they serve as their bellini is NOT a bellini, which is really disappointing.  The seating: It's big. You likely won't have to wait for a table. The outdoor seating is awesome when the weather is nice. It's a good place to watch sports (hockey!) because they have two huge TVs in the dining room and several other smaller ones.  Minuses:  The service: I've never had great service there. It's always slow and spotty. So frustrating.    The food: It's hit or miss, really. It's a shame because the menu is super varied and has a ton of options for everyone - carnivores, vegetarians, vegans, gluten-free, etc. It's just NOT consistent. I've had really good food there, but I've also had really bad food there. I've had great pulled pork and horrible ribs. Great fries one time, crappy, cold fries the next. But the cornbread! The cornbread is always good!  Sooo. Bottom line: I never go out of my way to go to the Double Wide, but it's a good place to go to if I want to watch a hockey game w/ a group of people or every place else is packed.

mMrkyIovGzDTbC5tTZza-w.text: Went with family on Saturday night, so no excuse for not being at their best.  The menu is very extensive so it was hard to chose. Started with the nachos which were good.  Came with a side of dipping cheese which was a pleasant surprise.   I was leaning towards either the ribs or a burger but the waiter recommended the brisket so my wife and I both went with the brisket sandwich.  I was expecting a heaping mound of brisket on a bun but the sandwich was so small that I literally finished it in three bites.  Without the fat it would have been two bites. My daughter had the chili fries and the were also disappointing.  The fries were mixed with what appeared to be chili made with brisket but the dish looked more like soup than chili.  It was so soggy that the she didn't really eat it.  She also complained that it had no flavor, probably because all the liquid drowned out whatever flavor there was. My son had the boneless wings.  He didn't eat them as he was in a bad mood so my wife and I cleaned them up.  They were the best part of the meal with the buffalo sauce being a very good flavor. Overall, vey disappointed but the waiter was so nice we didn't feel like complaining.  Anyway, won't be back.  Too bad as its a nice place with lots of outdoor seating.

2HmLeHHt542Q-e_WrMZzmg.text: I had a dismal dining experience last night. Went for the all you can eat rib night. We arrived at 7:00, and were informed that the kitchen closes at 9. Normally that would be more than enough time. We didn't get our first plate until 7:45. We sat for another 30 minutes with empty plates and glasses. Iced tea was warm with a couple of ice cubes. Had to ask for more ice. Second plate shows up, that was fine. Third plate showed up ice cold, we got our check and left. Not going back.   Update... went back last week for the ribs again. They were worse this time. Our server didn't know the menu, so we ended up ordering the wrong sauce on our ribs. Also, the ribs were tough and dry. You guys need to fire your chef, kitchen manager, whoever is in charge of the food. If you're going to you do BBQ, you need to know how to properly make ribs. It's clear that you do not.

8gZNyZQsc8PTEMnvuSbPZg.text: I frickin' love this place.  Get on their birthday mailing list and get a free birthday meal.  You MUST try the vegan Seitan buffalo wings! We end up getting them every time because they're incredible.  We love buffalo sauce or the sauce that has some dude's name in it.  Get them with ranch or blue cheese, your choice.  My favorite thing to get here is the TV dinner.  I love sampling all the different items.  From ordering this I discovered how much I like their Coconut Mango Tofu!    My partner loves their housemade lentil burger.  Other sandwiches we've gotten here have just been 'okay'.    Vegans go nuts for this place, and they should.  Street parking is usually around, sometimes you're going to have to pay for it depending on the hour/day, so make sure you check the meters where you're at.

rzjvCaQbWxagQy4xahjAFQ.text: I never thought I would find much appeal eating in a "garage", but Double Wide Grill proved me wrong. This is probably one of the best places for vegetarians because almost every option they have can be turned vegetarian or vegan. I struggle a lot with finding restaurants where I can enjoy a good meal while satisfying my omnivore counterparts, but this place has it all.   I've been to DWG several times and their seitan dishes never fail. Everything from the pulled seitan sandwich to the wings are amazing! During my last visit, I had BBQ seitan as a protein add-on for my grilled vegetable & brie salad and it was phenomenal. The portions are always generous so you never leave hungry.   I highly recommend DWG if you're looking for a casual brunch, lunch or dinner in South Side. Service is always fast and friendly while the food is always delicious and filling.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled Vegetable &amp; Brie Salad with BBQ Seitan

SVpwAkmATLDuUsaYHkuxig.text: I had alot of trouble using the Groupon here. First they weren't going to let me use it because they failed to tell me that you can't use it on happy hour appetizer purchases, meanwhile I told the waitress we had a Groupon before we ordered.  Then they decided we were not able to use the groupon because the manager said they needed me to pull it up on my phone because they have to click used when you reedem it. (I have never had anywhere tell me that before and I have used many, many groupons). I had printed it out since Groupon states you may print the Groupon and use it and I was out of data. Well, apparently that rule does not apply here. On top of that, the Seitan was not good... at all. My burger was also terrible. The nachos were the only thing I would order again. So all in all we had a pricey and disappointing meal and a leftover Groupon I'm probably never going to use.

kAuFXY8P3IPhtNQMtI1PGw.text: I ate here again recently. WHY Devin WHY must you do this to yourself?  It was worse than I remember. The seitan is AWFUL. What did they do to it? I remember it being half palatable.  Anyway, everyone that works there seems to be in a funk and miserable. They just shuffle around like corpses. This is by no means a vegetarian/vegan friendly restaurant. You'd think they hate vegan/vegheads by the way the serve that slop and call it food. My lord!  I eat meat, but sometimes crave vegan options. This place is a no go.  Go somewhere else, actually... leave the south side immediately and head over the bridge to society and decent meals.  YEESH

mJdBcCvwSX8GMkvkc7g1hg.text: Went on a Sunday afternoon, only about 5 or 6 other tables occupied, took about 15 minutes to take our order. Wanted brisket but that isn't ready until 5:00 which is marked on the menu but then tried to pasta, waitress came back out and informed me they couldn't do pasta until 3:00 because they didn't have space to boil water. I ordered the pig aught, I asked for beans instead of cole slaw but thosewouldn't be ready until after 3:00 either. Onion rings were room temperature, the bacon that came with the pig aught were continental breakfast quality: paper thin and gummy.   Pros: ribs were very good and waitress was very friendly and accommodating given the restraints.  Cons: not nearly good enough in any way to warrant a return trip, especially not on the Southside

Ymc3zKH8OP9BjND8_c1NGw.text: Stopped by today for brunch. I haven't been to double wide in almost a year. This was my first brunch with them. I found their brunch menu large and full of options.. Same as their dinner.  I went with stuffed French toast (stuffed w. cream cheese) which came with a side of potatoes. My bf ordered the double wide Benedict. My French toast was ok, but idk it sounded better in the menu. The cream cheese was off. Idk if it was fat free or vegan or whatever. The French toast itself was great. The side of potatoes were lacking in quantity, but still were good. My bfs Benedict was (to his surprise, lol) served on cornbread. He substituted cheesy grits for his potatoes. He enjoyed it but said the eggs were cold. He's extremely picky on grits and didn't like it either (i tried it as well. Again, the taste was off) he said the meal would've been better if the eggs and corn bread were hot.  Service was good. Our server was new but still did a great job.  I've experienced double wides ribs and other comfort food dishes. The menu and food are good, as well as the service. We live nearby and come by seldom, but we still do visit. I just personally feel that its a little overrated and sometimes the food isn't as great as expected. today's meal proved the same. It is a cool spot though in the summer with the patio and dog patio. The food and drink menu are great.
