Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. stuffed French toast

0wA2z8qOuc5jV0Pe6J0lLA.text: This review is on the service (or lack there of) received Saturday. Double (why)ide on Earth would i ever come back? My boyfriend and I drove to the Southside after a long day of hiking, specifically for this establishment; we heard the food was good, though we've never been. We show up at 3:40 PM, in between lunch and dinner hours, not busy, no reason for the service we were dealt. We walk up to the host stand, wait around for a few minutes as 2 employees walk past- not a single word, nor smile, no "someone will be right with you". Someone finally comes along to seat us. Menus were filthy, seat had left over food on it, but it was okay we we're starving and excited anyways.   After looking over the menu, and seeing about 3 servers walk past, amongst other employees fiddling their thumbs, we looked at the clock and realized it was 4 pm. That it's been 20 minutes of absolutely NO service. No greeting, no drinks, not even water...0 acknowledgement whatsoever. We said what the heck? We decided to wait 5 more minutes, because we've both worked in the restaurant business before, we understand stuff happens. So 5 more minutes...Nothing. I saw another table seated near us get up and ask for the check because they never even got their drinks.. they were already sitting when we arrived 25 minutes ago. I really hate to give negative reviews but this was the poorest excuse of restaurant service I've ever experienced.   We went to Fat Heads instead, got seated right away and greeted/fed right away. Who knows how long we would have been sitting before even being greeted? Sad I didn't get to try your turkey burger, probably won't be back.

E9hkI6OsJTA65AsAatQX5Q.text: I've been going to Double Wide for the past 6 years or so. It's always been a place that's offered solid bar food, interesting atmosphere, and vegan options where I wouldn't have expected them. That said, I think I'm going to stop going there for a while.   My girlfriend and I stopped in today after she had noted the drop in quality over our past few visits. I hadn't noticed, so I wanted to test it out. She ordered the California Salad and I got the Breakfast Burger.   I ordered my burger cooked medium. When it came out, there wasn't a trace of pink inside the burger--completely well done. Although I hadn't noticed many significant flaws about the restaurant in the past, I've definitely been served up some overcooked burgers during the 6 years I've gone to Double Wide. I don't say this to nitpick my meal to death, but to make a larger point about Double Wide: for a place that advertises their grill so much they seem to have very little awareness of how to effectively use one.  My point here is simple: if your restaurant has the word "grill" in the title, you should know how to cook a burger.   My girlfriend's California Salad was fine, but uninspiring as a vegan option, and definitely overpriced. We paid almost $13 for it, but could have gotten the same ingredients at Hello Bistro for $3 cheaper. Double Wide used to be a great option for us because of the fact that it had vegan items on their menu. But as vegan diets have become more popular, and more options have emerged around the city, Double Wide's vegan selection just seems stale at this point. Their seitan is historically pretty good, but the rest of their assortments of salads and vegetable entrees are just sort of a snooze to pick from.  Then there's the little things. Double Wide is more-or-less a sports bar. When we went in, not a single TV was on. I ordered blue cheese with our seitan wings. We didn't receive it, but were still charged for it. I had to ask for lettuce, onion, and tomato where in the past, they've been offered to me.   Double Wide is a fine restaurant, but it's just growing stale. Over the past 6 years that I've been going there, I haven't seen any significant changes to their menu. And on top of that, leaving with 45+ fewer dollars in my pocket isn't very appealing when I can receive a meal that delivers more care and innovation at a multitude of other places around this ever-changing city.

q4ljg3066bvxI0zxoThXzw.text: When I said I wanted extra ranch with my Postmates order, these guys HOOKED IT UP. I could literally swim in the amount of ranch that they gave me... It's obnoxious and glorious. My seitan wings were delicious and filling- excellent hot sauce. Great portion size, 100% would be back.

G49ScUhbHGRBXL03DcnDUA.text: This is a classic American comfort food. I love the nachos. I like the two  deal where you can combine two for $25. Their beer is amazing. The decor is of an old garage. It's very unique and it's worth Eating Here especially with the  giant TVs when there is a game. I would recommend it for visitors and it's very stylish for Carson Street. It's good for families and pets.

sibxi8g2tcMD9f2c9SKMeA.text: Disappointed. I've been coming here for years and loved the coconut tofu and the coleslaw. Apparently recipes have changed for everything. And none of it was good. Seriously disappointing. The staff was nice enough to offer to comp the meal, but I'd much rather have enjoyed the meal.

-vDqkbujXlVQiHbqzbfsjA.text: 7Up pancakes review: light fluffy delicious. However, the pancakes come with no sides like whipped cream like the other pancake options do. I had to pay $1.5 for whipped cream (was on the check after) and another $1 to get canned fruit. So getting regular pancakes with your standard whipped cream cost $10. Pretty ridiculous considering. If you're not rolling with cash and don't mind paying a lot for pancakes, by all means get it because it is tasty.

-GEd0rE2joKyqRgttFAjYQ.text: I speak only for the vegan food, which is awesome! Don't pass up the 'wings!' Also, I ordered the spiciest bloody mary I've ever had... I couldn't drink it even when watered down with a tecate :( So one star off for that. Ease up on the chunks of peppercorn guys!

OrZSxsPSLsgjsF_m-ArJJQ.text: Super cool place when you walk in and see the vintage gas and oil signs.  Huge menu, very kid friendly, and laid-back atmosphere.  Our server, whose name escapes me, was working her first shift at the place.  I would have never guessed it.  She was really great.  Having a table of 9, with 4 kids, as your first table can't be easy.  She took it all in stride and we love her for that.  The food was above average.  Nothing real crazy special to set it apart from all the other places around, but everything came out hot and as ordered.  Try the "make your own TV dinner"!  A fun way to get a really good variety of items on one plate.  We will be back again!

PY9ALRcc_NiLm4NtOxKbww.text: Everything else I've had from here has been good. But don't bother on the jerk fish tacos

1FPTNghJX1hAIwcd78pNEw.text: If you're looking for healthy vegan options, stay home like a normal person.  If you want super tasty, dripping in bbq sauce, with several vegan options...run here.  The seitan is some of the best I've had pretty much anywhere, service is always most excellent, and obnoxious vegans such as myself super appreciate the handy little vegan icon next to the plethora of vegan choices.    The seitan cheesesteak is damn delicious, but it most certainly isn't a Philly cheesesteak.  It's a delightful bbq sandwich, but don't order it if you're looking for a Philly cheesesteak.    Stupid delicious, most excellent service, and more vegan options than you can shake a stick at.  If shaking a stick at something implied anything...whatever, just eat here.

0II2FY2nN2E5Zu_QTJ4YxA.text: This was my FAVORITE place to go to, until one night, service was terrible. When our waiter got there, after waiting for one for 15 minutes, she took our orders, as usual, and this is where it began. It took us a LOT more time than usual to get our drinks. What I also didn't like is that they seemed to be doing a FULL MAKEOVER of the building, so it was pretty hard to remember where was where. Still, the food tasted like food. Overall, I would probably go to a different location than this, even if there's a long drive.

BbiLKYgi6tp1lnEkY5gGbw.text: I've been to this location many times. Our server this day was very nice. She told us it was wing night and so I moved away from my usual vegan gyro and got the BBQ  Seiten wings. They were delicious and 50 cents a piece or about half off for 5.   It was my mom's birthday so we came because she had her birthday coupon. Make sure you sign up for their birthday club. You get essentially a free meal. Can't beat that.   The menu here is extensive and there is sure to be something that you will enjoy on the menu.   The decor is based off an old garage. So it gives it a gritty feel that for me almost ensures a good meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. BBQ Seitan wings and boneless wings.

Ai-XEVFKejM3IstwErT0GA.text: SO MANY VEGAN/VEGETARIAN OPTIONS!! I love this place so much because they have FULL PAGES dedicated to meatless food and a lot of it is soul food, which isn't easy to find for plant based eaters. I usually go on Wednesdays & get seitan wings. My favorite are the garlic parmesan wings, but I like the honey garlic ones too. I'm always weary about ordering anything with Portobello mushrooms because a lot of times they marinate them too long or something & they end up tasting like straight vinegar. It's just really nice to go to a homestyle restaurant & not have to get a simple salad or side dishes.

0VuJij2Hlagv-cqyWiamsg.text: One of the few places in south side that offers vegetarian or vegan options. Unfortunately those are always bland and mediocre at best. I've had their vegetarian chili, which was more of a bean soup with no flavor and no kick. Thank god it came with corn bread or I'd have starved.Their seitan wings are probably their best vegetarian option. Their potato tacos are also bland and flavorless. Vegetarian/vegan shouldn't mean flavorless. Decent service, although there's almost always a wait.

3KpXQ1mrwwObHVUutgR0cQ.text: Dbl Wide is a great hangout due to their food and drinks but also because they are in the heart of South Side. Been going there for years and I always have a great meal and enjoyable time.

AnKjM653ohpY0i_MC5fv4w.text: best Seitan wings in the world. I'm not even vegan and I couldn't tell the difference between the Seitan and real meat. texture is incredibly like meat and so is taste. highly recommend

W_SWyCCxpdFQjTXIVmoWfw.text: Seitan wings and junkyard nachos were pretty good. Service was great but somewhat slow for a non-busy night

gOXH_gySuIaZpnw4PcO2zw.text: Pretty cool place to get wood fired BBQ. A converted gas station that offers inside and outside seating. Crowd is a great mix of locals and those traveling to the South Side for the evening.  I recommend the beef brisket. The coleslaw is tops and the spicy BBQ sauce is excellent.  Good wait staff, but hit and miss on their knowledge of beers, which can be disappointing as they have a very nice selection.  Great casual place to eat lunch on the weekends or hit it up before walking the streets of SS.

vj-Fy3bcl8w5TxbrOBjsCA.text: Lots of veggie/meatless options. I really liked the seitan gyro. The veggie lentil burger was very substantial and thick, nothing like a frozen patty. The seitan wings are large squares with a grainy breading/coating. Not the best, but not bad either. Good beer selection. One of the largest outdoor patios in the city.

9VwJabs3ABQCATMluwvDPQ.text: I've been to the annual fried tofu eating contest that they have, it was fun to watch and in the end I was glad I didn't particpate.    I've also been for their tuesday all you can eat rib special.  I had a whole rack of ribs with their fries and it also came with corn bread.  Their ribs do melt in your mouth, I would say they're almost amazing.  My mouth is actually watering thinking about it.  and the special is only around 13 dollars which is a great deal for unlimited ribs.    I'd like to return to try their other dishes sometime, its just a very down to earth establishment if you could call a restaurant that.  Their kitchen is open late as well till 1am i believe, which is always a plus.

R_lxxVLAf4zw9buE06g0fw.text: We were visiting from Chicago and called ahead to see if they took reservations. We were told Sundays were slow so we headed on over.  The  first thing I noticed was the waitress and hostess dressed in very short shorts and skimpy tops..on to the service....very slow. We waited quite a long time for a waitress. We asked if the appetisers could please come before dinner. They came at the same time, after a long wait. I have to have gluten free and the one gluten free appetiser was stuffed mushroom. The cheese wasn't melted entirely and it was cold in the center.  Wings weren't anything special.  We had to wait a long time to get our check which was pretty pricey.  To be honest the staff are very low energy and don't seem to care about their work. Whomever is doing the hiring may wan to consider work ethic and intelligence rather than cup size.   Also, I am not feeling well and I think I may have been given gluten. After reading some other negative reviews for this restaurant I wonder if the owners read their Yelp reviews.

Qgad1GAM7TbL7LOoKROwRg.text: I was so excited to come here after reading the great reviews. Since we had both vegetarians and meatatarians the menu really looked great It was mostly a let down. The food was okay. A bit overpriced for what you actually got. I wanted to get my son tofu only to find out you can only get it covered in a bbq sauce apparently? I couldn't just order plain tofu. It was weird. I got the crab, black bean, and corn fritters and they were very bland. I couldn't taste any crab and seriously where were the seasonings? We did enjoy a chilli cheese fries vegetarian style. The veggie chilli was the highlight of the whole meal. Also, someone got their cherry coleslaw and really liked that. Other than that nothing impressive.  Also a previous reviewer had mentioned the scantily clad servers but I figured it couldn't be too bad since I hadn't seen it in other reviews, but I gotta say I wouldn't consider this a family restaurant. All the women were wearing low cut tanks with their bra straps and the bras themselves on some girls showing. Some were wearing shorts others tight jeans. Our server was very spacey and we kept having to repeat ourselves cause she just kept getting this dumb look on her face and not saying anything. The bathrooms were also super filthy. I don't see us coming back here.

l2c-gUDy-O4xpDO_cotISA.text: Okay--here I am nearly 5 years later back in the city.  I used to love this place and it has grown pretty well.  I like their vegan menu.  I like their beer.  The wait staff could be a bit more attentive, but overall I really like it there.

UGaZ-m1IrnZGv68OCv7A1Q.text: Sunday brunch. Hungover, sitting at the bar. I figured I'd trudge through the meal and then make my way back home to relax.   However, our bartender Lisa brightened the day. She herself was coming off a rough night as well, but had us laughing the entire time. She jokingly harassed the two of us for being camels and drinking all their water, but quickly wised up and gave us a pitcher of water. At one point, there were ice balls being made in the blender and being tossed around the bar.   For food I got a Carnivore Omelet, which was good, but nothing to rave about. Our experience was completely made by our bartender Lisa (and the 3 great Bloody Mary's she made each of us). We headed out refreshed and much happier than we went in.

4V_FaC6ij3i7BzR4jZBCzw.text: The BBQ Pulled Porky is absolutely delicious! The staff was personable, fun, and helpful in suggesting local favorites. We enjoyed looking at the auto memorabilia stashed creatively in the decor. Hope to return!

75J0kAqC40Z8xCozja2xeQ.text: I have been going to Double Wide Grill for many years, especially during the time I was living in South Side a few blocks from the restaurant. I would say about 50% of my experiences have been good. I decided it was finally time to write a review.  Double Wide Grill has a great atmosphere and  great selection of food. The restaurant is in a converted auto service station. They have a decent size dining room and offer a lot of outdoor seating when it is warm out. It is primarily a Barbecue joint that also has a large selection of sandwiches, burgers and vegan meals. The Barbecue is good. Probably a little too heavy on the pepper. I usually get ribs or brisket there. Both are good, but a little on the drier side than I would prefer. Mixed with sauce, the dryness isn't as noticeable. Their burgers aren't too bad. They also serve brunch on weekends. The brunch is good, but doesn't blow me away. Double Wide probably has the best barbecue in South Side, but certainly not the best in Pittsburgh. Double Wide also has a large selection of regular domestic beers and microbrews on tap. Their prices are reasonable considering you get a full plate of food.  My issues with Double Wide have primarily been with service and misleading advertising. There have been multiple times I have eaten at Double Wide when our server has only taken one person's drink order and leaves or just disappeared for long periods of time and didn't check on our table or offer us the check when the table was cleared. We used to leave long comments on receipts complaining about the servers, but stopped after we noticed they never would fire the ones which everyone had issues. My recent experience, and why I decided to write the review, was after trying to use a Groupon. Every year or so Double Wide Grill offers a Groupon to attract more business. The Groupon lists no exclusions other than not valid on alcohol and the other regular Groupon terms. I was very disappointed when they told me in the restaurant their daily specials such as all you can eat ribs and wing night are excluded from Groupon use. This is not listed on the Groupon anywhere. Double Wide insisted these daily specials count as 'other offers' part of the Groupon. They even told me multiple people had tried that night to use the Groupon on the daily specials. It is disappointing they use the Groupon to bring you in, knowing most people will try to use it on the days with a special, only to have to order something else.  I can't say I won't ever be back since I know friends will want to go there, and I know I am a sucker for all you can eat anything. However, I can say it will be a little while before this experience wears off and I return.

EQwX3vBg_BA6wgjsDpF4xA.text: I work on the South Side and I've been really curious about this place.  And I've had a BBQ craving lately.  So, despite the poor reviews about the service and food that my coworkers had given me, I decided to try it out.  I ordered a BBQ combo of brisket and ribs.  It was awful.  The brisket was chopped instead of sliced and it was lying in a pile under a quarter rack of ribs.  The brisket was dry as a desert with no sauce served at all, not even on the side.  And this dried up meat desperately needed sauce.  It had no flavor and no spice.  Icky!  The ribs looks good, but they were served as a quarter rack and the knife I had was just a dinner knife and would not cut through the ribs so I could separate them.  They had a little more flavor with some kind of slightly sweet sauce brushed on the outside.  But the best I could do was scrape a little meat off the bone. I took the ribs back to work and gave them to the office food scavenger.  If figured if he could find a way to cut them apart, more power to him.    The service was actually pretty good.  But that's not enough to get me back into this place.  I'm sure there's better BBQ somewhere in Pittsburgh.

6M0LICBAgikmWJzDflGz8A.text: Had the Caribbean coconut tofu...totally bland and unseasoned! I was really hoping for great vegetarian food and will probably not be back!

5N8q9ox4fUG2uutbXWcJpA.text: This place is disappointing. I've heard good things about brunch, but don't come for dinner. I had an appetizer. I sent it back because it was icebox cold, and it came back lukewarm. Definitely detracted from the experience. Beers for $5.75. I'm not coming back here.

HUZRVJX-3oRh7S9aft-M8g.text: Best place to eat in the southside. Pulled pork sandwiches and burgers were great! The place has a diner-type feel because it was a gas station turned into a restaurant. 35 cent boneless wings made for a nice appetizer. Highly recommend if you're looking for a nice place to eat in the southside

rbp5IVMPUmDttCvdgDL8-g.text: Stopped here for dinner Sunday. It's a gas station converted into a restaurant which was cool. There was also plenty of outside seating. We ordered the dry rubbed wings as an appetizer, and shared the full rack. The meat was tender and fell off the bone, but it was not the best ribs I've had. They were also sparse with sides. Also a full rack of ribs came with only four onion rings (at an additional charge) and a small piece of burnt corn bread.  Keep this as your 2nd choice.

-UYZDQpGwzYHD_PgxPBVag.text: So going back since this last review and things have turned around completely. The last few meals have been great, servers are nice and times have sped up. Maybe there's some new management but I can't complain. We go there a lot. One of the best places in the summer too!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sunday brunch with Bloody Mary

SxzlXKx0ofMneRYehLN2pg.text: Not bad!  Kind of a fun theme, lots of vegetarian options, and a good beer list.  I'm not a vegetarian, but opted for the potato tacos as an interesting choice.  All the fixings of a soft taco, only with mashed potatoes instead of meat.  Very tasty!  Friendly service.  The three stars is because I found it kind of gimmicky (like a Quaker Steak), and that really isn't my favorite atmosphere.

5Q_YmGTUDiMlvndBdP2tjw.text: We always enjoy what Double Wide has to offer.  Endless rib night, good beers, a section to sit with your dog...they have it all!  In the summer the outside seating is perfect for people watching while you dine and the inside is cozy when it's a tad too chilly to be in the elements.

A5n9SwzCyRvaBUr-Kzzwfg.text: Totally surprised by this restaurant. We had amazing service with Savanah, she was attentive and incredibly patient with my tired and hungry children. The vegan/vegetarian options are plentiful and I had a delicious vegetarian eggs Benedict with lentil sausage that was super tasty. Also tons of options for the meat eaters. Will definitely be back.

depDs4FW6AmGVdwHC7Erew.text: The chicken and pork was really dry, and I was charged full price at 7:02 for a Yeungling (because happy hour was over at 7), when I waited ten minutes for the bartender to show up at the bar.

y0HsbLkKD1oiRdghi9_OPw.text: Ok, I was at Vegan fest out of town and had Seitan wings from these guys and was hooked. Also, the rep at the event told us about the dog patio and we had to go see for ourselves.   I would say the dog patio is great if your dog isn't a total little jerk..we have a couple dogs that did ok but it IS a bit stressful. You also have to kind of serve yourself but it's worth it to keep the fur babies along. Everyone on the patio was super friendly too.   Great happy staff etc...  We went back to try out another meal inside at night but unfortunately it was a little sloppy/bleh. I think there are just too many items on the menu to keep them perfected.   It is a huge option for vegans though so we will not write it off, just hope that the quality improves because I could see us being regulars if it did.

tYjJl6I9FF2RZRpRu3ez1g.text: My boyfriend and I wanted to go out for dinner on Memorial Day and decided to take a drive to Southside to see what was open. After driving past tons of closed bars, we saw that Double Wide was open and decided to check it out. We weren't super impressed last time we visited, but figured we would give them another chance.  There was one hostess working and we were told it would be 10 minutes. I was super hungry and therefore didn't stray too far away from the hostess stand, in order to be able to best hear our name, as soon as our table was ready. Their system did not make sense to me at all. There were a decent amount of empty tables, but it appeared they didn't have enough bussers to clean them quick enough. Waiting 10 minutes is not a big deal at all- it is just frustrating, when there are open tables the entire time and no one there to clean them.   We were sat on the patio, which I was happy about (their patio is pretty awesome). Our server was friendly and attentive to our table the entire time. I decided on the California salad- which was described as a bed of romaine/iceberg mix with half an avocado, grilled portabellas, grapes, sunflower seeds, sprouts and grape tomatoes. The menu suggested their cilantro lime vinaigrette, so that is what I chose. It also came with one single piece of cornbread. My boyfriend ordered their Hawaiian burger- which appeared to be packed with flavor, according to the menu and photo. My salad ended up being made of entirely iceberg lettuce, which was really disappointing. The grilled portabellas were odd and were marinated in some type of balsamic, which really didn't compliment the cilantro lime vinaigrette. The best part of the salad was the grapes and the cornbread.. which isn't saying much. My boyfriend was disappointed in his burger as well. Although it was rather large, it was tasteless.   Although their location and patio is ideal for Southside, the food is tasteless and just overall disappointing.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. California salad

g3xZi9n_JNpJpuJV_0QCrg.text: LOVED Double Wide.  My grandfather passed away last April, but I know that as a car mechanic he would have loved this place, as it was a car garage turned restaurant. The atmosphere is fantastic, with great memorabilia on the walls, and even garage doors that open into the outdoor seating area when it's nice out!  The food was fantastic and the portions were great, in my opinion. Lots of food for a reasonable price, but not so much that I felt too full afterwards. I got the pulled pork (on one of their "trays" I believe) and it tasted great. Definitely a great place to come with family and friends. I really want to eat outside sometime when the weather is warmer.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Panorama of the inside of Double Wide Grill

LBRWR0S2xLM5qjEAtB1mfQ.text: I like coming to Double Wide on Tuesdays for all-you-can-eat pork ribs. It costs only $14.99 and comes with a side of fries. You can choose from the Carolina or Memphis sauce. Overall, tasty and a great value.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Round 3
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Round 2
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Round 1

p0AC6M1QVlwd3aja4HCZpg.text: Went on a Saturday around 1:15 PM.  Brunch menu was given to us.  We Since we already had breakfast, we asked for a lunch menu.  No problem -- got the lunch menu but was told certain things were not available yet (lunch doesn't start until 2:00 PM); i.e., brisket, and other items that still needed to roast.  Ok.  There were 4 of us.  One wanted chicken tenders but was told they are only served to children under 10!  Ok then.  Someone else ordered the buffalo chicken dip and chips.  Got about a handful of chips; and when asked for more was told they would be charged for another entire order.  Ok..............  Waitress was more than unemotional -- cold -- and unfriendly.  I would say, food is good; but it's best to go later in the day.

WJR26rKMqqeeTPjXwj-JUQ.text: Awesome Vegan options. 2 whole pages to choose from. Separate frier for fries. In an old Texaco station. Great scenery.

7MoG8IV2tt-SJinXI4S3mg.text: Very cool place with great beer selection. Our server was very friendly and prompt. I didn't love my sandwich but I didn't hate it. It just kinda was.  The fried rice balls were delicious, though!  I'd eat a bucket of those with some good beer any day!  Update: we've been here many times since moving to the neighborhood and I'm starting to wonder why we keep returning. The food is mediocre at best but the servers were always so friendly and quick it normally made up for it. This last time the service was awful and when the service is bad it makes you realize all of the things you've overlooked before.

W7JlMx6XH9ZD5nKeWn2f6w.text: If you order the AYCE BBQ ribs or just BBQ ribs in general ask for the tender pieces. We did the AYCE ribs, the first plates were good, the 2nd plates were hard, and the third was ooh so good and tender. I loved the good ribs and I've had a lot of them from all over and its also a very good deal.  They charge extra for sauce for the ribs however if they give you the tender pieces no extra sauce is needed.  I like this place lots of outdoor and indoor seating and they have a garage theme. It's was very busy when we were there but they have lots of room for everyone. They also have couches which if you don't mine eating on a couch is just like eating at home cause they have tv all over the place.  It's also the perfect place to watch the game.

tKwomOi2u0AvN3WPJ2TY0w.text: I have been meaning to try this restaurant on many occasions and I am very glad I finally did! It was a beautiful day so many people were eating outside and the "dog friendly" section was a delight to see! Our food was fantastic (the nachos are crazy good) and the service was excellent. It was so good that we went back the next day for brunch.  I am excited to have finally tried this gem and fully intend on going back on my next visit.

haT1CPgWMzl5jssOkHZC5Q.text: The toddler and I stopped here for lunch on a Monday. The decor immediately made the toddler happy with old trucks, car parts, fuel pumps and other garage knic knacs.  The host was not friendly and rushed to the table way ahead of us. He also gave me a drink menu which was weird considering I'm 38 weeks prego. He never spoke, even when I tried to engage. Hopefully it was a bad day for him and he wasn't meaning to be so rude. Our server rocked however. She was on top of everything. I had a bbq pulled seitain with cornbread. The sauce was sweet and spicy. The toddler had some Kraft Mac n cheese with some delicious fries. His meal also included a scoop of ice cream. Besides the Donnie Downer host, this place rocked!

NCfrNC0DtrAhl-dwVxpz-w.text: Double wide is a southside staple! I ate here when I first moved to the city in 2010 and I continue to come here regularly for happy hour and simmer day drinking. There is always available outdoor seating and there are healthy options on the menu so it's not just "bar food". Karaoke night is also a huge plus. That and the fact that people are allowed to bring their dogs to the outside patio.

6oBj2VBSxfAVSAs1ZfCPCg.text: I haven't eaten here in years. So on my Friday play day we stopped in for lunch. This menu is packed with all types of goodies they cover all bases from your carnivore to the vegetarian. It's also have some neat nostalgic items all over the place. Friday is my food cheat day so I couldn't wait to spend my calories on something crazy good. I ordered the turkey burger with fries my son ordered wings. My waitress's was nice and we didn't have to wait that long for our food. My burger was ok not memorable at all. This sucks because I'm wasting my calories on a mediocre meal.  overall the experience was average

-0GY7W_nLGuHy8CwdUG7tA.text: I came here a number of times years ago and recently returned for dinner on a Wednesday night. It seems that they have expanded the menu over the past few years and one good thing is that they have a TON of vegetarian/vegan options.   The atmosphere is nice. There is ample opportunity for good people watching and the outside area is shaded and breezy for when you want to sit outside on a hot day. They also have a separated dog patio which is a nice accommodation for those with dogs and for those who would rather not sit next to a dog while eating.   Our waitress was attentive but not overly personable -- which is totally fine by me. I had the hawaiian burger with fries. The food was fine but not memorable. The sandwiches and burgers seemed fairly priced but the entrees looked over priced to me.   I'd come back if someone invited me but probably wouldn't go out of my way.

dzrq6OD82u8unEuACeO5ew.text: 2nd Amendment (not 21st) bar. (Look them up.) Sat at the bar to find the woman next to me had a gun in her waistband. Fine. Whatever. But is taking a gun to a bar a good idea? I told the bartender. His response: "lol I know her she's a good friend. She won't hurt ya" These are the same owners who ran Rowdy Buck until its fatal shooting post-gazette.com/local/c... Did they learn nothing? If you or someone you love is shot at one of their establishments, you have a legitimate wrongful death case.

gFs4Q1epnaFaWFc6SuCzHA.text: Service was quite poor and food was expensive for brunch.  One person ordered an omelet and it was served as a scramble and served cold.  A kids meal was$5 for an"omlete" without any toast or side... Also served as scrabbled what.. That was another $1.50. it was served dry and our waitress disappeared after she served the food. No refill on coffee, no checking to see how anything was.  We had to ask for creamer after we flagged another server down.  After we realized the toast was dry, we again had to flag down another server because ours was no where to be found.  Food was decent, but too expensive. For two adults and one toddler we spent $40. There are too many other better places with better service and food to return here.

p9lgRaoTLasGOvG39Xg0aQ.text: We just had a drink there...a lucky soda, the local coke made with cane sugar, giving a unique flavor to our drink. We enjoyed it in their patio facing a beautiful mural. Our server was really nice. The overall experience was enjoyable

FpHeRQBDVnIxNjxr65H30A.text: Fast service    I was in town and decided on brunch.  The original pick had a hour and a half wait so double wide was the backup choice.  I was seated immediately and the waitress was really fast.  I went with the carnivore omelet and it seemed like it came out in 5 minutes.  Unfortunately the carnivore omelet was lacking in the meat department.  I expected a lot more meat toppings than what came on it.  The taste was okay.  It came with breakfast potatoes and they were enjoyable, not special however.

5E2rUpkexe_2MLjKAnvXqA.text: I had no idea what to expect, and was pleasantly surprised.  My Uncle and Aunt were in town, and he is decidedly a "Meat & Potatoes man" while my significant other is vegetarian... Double Wide is much more than just a compromise, they were both well satisfied.  The outdoor seating and atmosphere is great, especially if you get such beautiful weather as we did...  once you get used to the (sometimes ludicrous) rumble of Harleys as they leave on east carson.  I had a Border Patrol burger (avocado, peppers and cilantro) which was well grilled... nothing to go too crazy over but well done.  My significant other had a lentil burger version of the same and left very happy.  That said, who else in Pittsburgh serves SEITAN and TOFU and attracts bikers on harleys in the masses?  Granted, it was hard to tell if these were the authentic biker types or the Sewickley harley types but they weren't wearing helmets so I doubt they were from that uppity of a suburb.  I had my mind on a tasty burger but I can't wait to go back and try some of the vegan and vegetarian options (Seitan wings, seitan ribs, seitan pulled pork sandwich and salad and probably 3-4 other tofu/veggie options).  Oh, and prices were extremely reasonable.  Sandwiches and burgers were $5-8 with only things like steaks and ribs venturing into the teens.

lqUxJt3jUNiUHOsAEJZUBQ.text: Place is surprisingly good! At first glance it looked like a tourist-trap kind of place (think south of the border) but we tried it out and it was awesome. After realizing it wasn't a trap, the atmosphere was pretty cool - open air drinking.   The beer selection was good, but more importantly the grub was great barfood. We had the nachos which were delicious (spin on the simple nacho-cheese style) and the seitan nuggets which were AWESOME! I would definetly go back.

syJzGmuRtmZxdohM4pceCg.text: I had been hearing a lot about this place and was excited to finally try it out!  The service was not out-of-control great, but the food was, and it was an overall pleasant experience.  We went at about 9 pm on a Friday, and sat outside, which was great fun, and the BBQ was in full effect, the charcoal smelling awesome.  One thing that was a bummer was that we were excited to try the sweet-potato-and-carmelized-onion croquette appetizer on the menu, only to be told when ordering that they were out of sweet potatoes.  Bummer!  We settled for the onion rings, and they were great, a huge portion with some amazing sauce.  I got a burger with the fresh fries, a mountain of them, which were delicious.  I also tried a frozen mojito, which was something I had never tried, but was also tasty.  I like the atmosphere here and I will most definitely be back!

rVb9O8L0TALGuLK-FyBSOw.text: I visited the Double Wide for one reason only: the vegetarian seitan wings, and they didn't disappoint. The seitan isn't that rubbery stuff you are in danger of getting anytime you order seitan at a new restaurant. In fact, to my delight it is almost a seitan-tempeh hybrid with just a hint more texture that really serves its special purpose of being turned into wings. With three choices for sauce (BBQ, spicy, or honey garlic), you can bet I've been back for seconds, and I don't even live in Pennsylvania.   And how can you have wings without beer? They have a pretty respectable list and a patient staff who helped my wife and I get exactly what we were looking for on more than one visit. We even ventured into the food menu once and enjoyed almost everything we tried. If you're like me, the heavy-handed theme of the restaurant may be a bit of a turn off, but give it a chance. As it turns out, it is not one of those chains your parents dragged you to as a kid.

AHZs8YbUQ5tXdK_LOqIw9Q.text: My girlfriend and I were wondering around on the Southside while visiting Pittsburgh. I had heard that this place served BBQ seitan wings and was pretty excited to check this place out.  The decor is a kind of cheesy but retro in the same respect. I liked that they didn't clutter their wall too much like some restaurants. Our waitress came over to us and was sooo friendly but not in the annoying fake way. She was vegetarian and gave us the low down on what she really liked.  I ended up getting a Lentil Southwest burger with a side of mashed sweet potatoes and my girl got the BBQ tofu skewers with regular mashed potatoes. Everything was delicious and really hit the spot, especially after wondering around the city all day.  The waitress checked on us often and gave us some other restaurant suggestions while we were in town. I'm from Pgh but a lot has changed in the past four years. I can't wait to go back to this place.

xkmg9B_KQbgKtSkkfJG9Pw.text: This may have had the BEST onion rings I've ever eaten. Not heavily battered like most places and definitely not frozen. They were crispy and hot and I wish I had ordered two baskets for myself instead of sharing one.   The corn bread was delicious as well. You could tell it was made with actual corn and not just from a box.  My meal was just ok. I ordered the bbq brisket.  I wasn't feeling the bbq sauce (too sweet) and my meat was a little dry. All was forgiven though since they did provide me with those delicious onion rings.  I could sit here and drink beer after beer from their fairly extensive beer menu and just eat onion rings and corn bread. In fact if I'm ever back here, I might have to do just that.

9eWbH5mPzxU5VZRt1c6qNA.text: I can honestly sum up my experience at the Double Wide Grill as "not impressed".  I visited the place for a group get together.  Unfortunately, the "party room" they have is so small that the 20-30 of us were unable to really mingle much.  The company at my table was great, but other then that, there is nothing about the menu that makes me want to rush back to the Double Wide.  Now the rest of the restaurant with its inside and outside openness I have to admit is pretty cool - as an environment to eat in, sure why not. On the other hand, its not so appealing to me to sit outside on a corner lot directly across from a co-go to consume my food.  Now, I know it is a lot to handle a big group of people. However, I am pretty sure the coordinator of this event called in advance. There was only one waiter serving us - which is not an easy task. On the other hand, I ordered a diet coke at the same time the five people on my table requested refills.  They all got their beers, teas, water, whatever. Me - I had to request diet coke again when she came out to take our orders 15 minutes later.   Visiting on a Sunday, we had the brunch menu. I was disappointed that there was not as much lunch food offered as there was breakfast. It was one in the afternoon and I was well past wanting to eat french toast or eggs.  They have a small handful of burgers - where the primary variety is choose the meet and then choose the options. OK - fine - if I hadn't had hamburgers that were SO GOOD at my own house.  The only other option other then wings or soup was an avocado club sandwich. So I went with that. It sounds like it has potential in the menu. It was the closest to a turkey club (something I would figure would be standard on a brunch menu) I could get. The waitress came back later and asked me what I wanted as my side, I said fries. I also ordered up a bowl of chili - my favorite food of all time.  The avocado club came out first. Essentially what sounded good in the menu turned out to be two slices of toast with sliced avocado and a sprinkling of jalapenos. There was supposed to be some sort of pesto on this as well, but I sure as heck couldn't taste it or see it. In fact, the overwhelming thought I had was - wow, um, why not just give me a plate of avocado.  Instead of fries, they gave me a side of fruit salad. **Grumble** The fries served with the burgers looked good.  The chili, if you can call it that, came out about five minutes later. It had the consistency of a beef stew, and honestly taste wise was not very far off.  OK, I AM a chili snob, I know - but come on - it's chili. And if you are calling it Jail-house chili, it should have some sort of punch - some spiciness of some sort. But really, had I not "known" it was chili, I would have thought they served me stew. The only bonus, they had the right kind of beef in it - you know - stew beef - or chili beef when the seasoning says its chili. :) I had to ask for cheese to put on top, which I got the look of "huh cheese?" but got a small little serving of that. It would have been better served with a side of jalapenos and onions to mix in too - so I stole some jalapenos from my sandwich.  Oh, and all this ample blandness cost me $20 (food, beverage and tip).  The company was at least good - and maybe if I do go back with a small group/one other person - or for breakfast or dinner I will be happier - those eating breakfast foods seemed to enjoy it though the Canadian bacon was also canned.   But as brunch and big groups go, big thumbs down - it will take a lot to convince me that this place is worth more then just a unique environment.

8dTF5oaVMh3e-WB7PGelPQ.text: RUde, indifferent service to start with. Our drinks were loaded with sugar-GRENADINE SYRUP. I asked for an alteration. The nasty waitress said: He will make you another one but you wont get that one for free (i wasnt looking for FREE, i wanted a palatable one)  THe tv dinner items were stale, overcooked and tough. We summoned the manager who was confrontational. He said his brisket was award winning!!!  IT WAS TOUGH and dry..  He was very combative with us. We showed him the yucky old potatoes they srved us and he said " YOU WANT A FREE MEAL, THAT IS JUST WHAT YOU ARE GETTING AND COME BACK TO SEE US"

wWDlpSmGRk-V348dSpBVIg.text: This is a great place to grab a bite; particularly when you can sit outside.  The food would be best described, to me anyway, as an upscale bar menu.  The Vegitarian and Vegan items are a nice option as my daughter is a vegitarian and it allows us to all have good food in a great atmosphere.

WFLANLezVqACyBLGENX2VA.text: My girlfriend and I stopped for Sunday brunch on the way home to Ohio. We both had drinks- She had a Bloody Mary and I had the "Back in the Saddle" special (can of Tecate beer and a shot of Jose Cuervo for $5.50). Wish we could have stayed longer as they did have a plentiful drink menu with many fun drinks we would have like to tried. The atmosphere resembles an old-time gasoline shop, a little grungy, but very warm and welcoming.

5JzAGUrlhlkZwUtJmAi3Ng.text: I got a Billy bob burger and it was fantastic.  Everything was seasoned wonderfully and nothing was overdone.  My only complaint about it was that they did not ask me how I wanted my burger cooked but it came out good.  Fantastic fries too.  They also have an extensive vegetarian and vegan menu that all looked fairly good.

7NC-NkCrrFUuoKyyhCEeDg.text: I like everything about it. The food was good as well as the atmosphere. Located in the heart of South Side. On a nice evening you have the option of eating outside under an umbrella which is a great option.

E8RgGa38eImnDP7xNxDEJA.text: No, no, hell NO! I've given the Double Wide Grill two chances, and have been dissatisfied each time. High prices, plain food, slow service...the only thing nice was sitting outside. My smoothie was watery and my portion of food was smaller than expected. I won't be going back.

DxcwzyT8l-yEYgc7B8jk9Q.text: Probably one of the most disgusting places I have ever eaten!! The place was filthy and the terrible food was way overpriced! How does this place stay in business??

T0_wdwSumaog02KXBCGwdQ.text: Only been here twice so far but love it!   Funky vintage decor and vast vegetarian and vegan menu, what's not to like?

-NwXqGhSzCmyZgUQiAzIRw.text: A bit grim.   I've been here a bunch of times because it's a great outside spot. Generally, I'm just drinking with friends out on the picnic tables and everything is great, but I brought a visiting vegetarian friend here for the veg food on a recommendation, and we were completely bummed.   Seitan wings/chunks were DELICIOUS but served in an insultingly small portion for the price. Totally realize the labor involved (if they make it in house), but c'mon. It's friggin' wheat gluten. Felt like we were shouldering some Whole Foods tax.   Fries were great. No complaints at all.  And then...potato tacos induced sadness. Mushy and watery, like all punishments to vegetarians should be. We didn't come close to finishing, we didn't ask for a box. Server didn't ask why. Apathy ruled the day.  Maybe it's a complete douche move to go to BBQ place and bitch about its vegetarian grub, but if a business is nice enough to include non-dead animal options, they should be good, right? Or at least priced relative to the cost of ingredients?  At any rate, it's a place to go for beers in pleasant weather, for sure.

xHXwxMBre2r1Opaop0AvTg.text: The pros are the outdoor seating and the BBQ dishes. Other than that, the food is not good. The BBQ combo platters are really good and you get a lot of food. I have tried other dishes, a grilled chicken salad, and it pretty much consisted of bagged lettuce with five pieces of grilled chicken breast. Outdoor seating is nice, though.

HlygY4TJypucVBVRN0hSyQ.text: This place is clearly very popular, it was filled the entire time we were there with many people who appeared to be regulars.  We went there for the veggie options.  The seitan appetizer was really good, and a huge portion, but the rest of the meal was not so great. The service was kinda crazy.  Our waiter was nice, but pretty non-existent, and the rest of the staff seemed crazy and frazzled.

d01xBcZ8hQd1Rxfqlskkpw.text: This was a nice place to grab lunch. We sat outside on the patio, in what used to be a service bay. The atmosphere is pretty cool, if you're into "early gas station." I can work with it.   I wanted a Bloody Mary and it was pretty good. Not the best ever, but decent. My salad was honestly underwhelming...the goodies I ordered on top - avocado, steak, and cheese - were in very short supply, and since you pay extra for each, that didn't go over well with me. Vinaigrette dressing way really good, though.   I appreciate the attempt at vegetarian versions of traditional barbecue and appetizer options. I don't need them, but I think it's cool to offer these options for people who do.   This was the last place I ate in Pittsburgh and it left me with a good impression of the city's dining scene. At least it was a little different from the norm.

5stOA46QGJgeccGiGFawew.text: I've been to the Double-Wide twice for brunch now. Twice, they've mixed up the side dish for one of the plates at our table.   But their fun atmosphere and innovative breakfast items makes up for it. The huevos rancheros and the double wide benedict are both big winners - with special emphasis on the big. Their omelets are huge. Some of their items weren't as punchy with flavor as hoped, such as the breakfast burrito, but there are lots more items on the menu that I want to try.   As a vegetarian-friendly customer, I'm super-happy to see interesting veggie items like the seitan wings, lentil veggie burger, tofu scramble and avocado club.  Overall, the double wide is a good brunch location - laid back, no lines out the door, and good food. It's probably even better in the summer with their large outdoor patio area.

Q6oPEh9Gx83ztoJ7JahPkg.text: I heard about this place before and how it good it was especially from my vegan and vegetarian friends. The inside is definitely smaller than I imagined but then I remembered that it's crafted from a gas station and/or double-wide trailer. Our server was awesome and very knowledgeable about the menu; she brought a very warm vibe. I went here with the intention of not drinking but that quickly changed when I saw the alcohol menu and I ordered Nobody Puts Baby in a Corner. DELICIOUS! It's like a Cherry Tootsie Roll in drink form. My Blackened Shrimp Salad was excellent! Great flavor and an abundance of veggies. And then those sweet potato fries were pretty good as well. Not the best I've ever had but certainly good with the honey-cinnamon-like dipping sauce. My friends rave about the seitan wings so that's definitely on my "try" list when I come back, because there will definitely be a next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nobody Puts Baby in a Corner
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Blackened Shrimp Salad w/ Cilantro Lime Vinaigrette
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sweet Potato Fries

t62vDyHqD1h-yvJ2Hym9pQ.text: I refrained from posting until I went again. Same experience. I think there were two total tables filled and two at the bar. About 15 employees walking around doing nothing and ignoring all. One guy got up and left the bar area. It began to storm and I had to search for someone to shut the garage door we were next to. Then I had to ask 4 times to have it reopened after the storm was over. This was after I stared at the one employee who said "sure" and then sat down to play on his phone. I could go on but just not worth. Won't return anyways.

i_hbDJ_zOKVlWVvAB-5WHA.text: Came here to watch the Steelers game with a group of friends. They were able to seat us right away, at a table that was surrounded by tvs to easily see the game. The waitress came over right away to take our order. We ordered a few pitchers of beer and others ordered appetizers. I was surprised there weren't any drink specials going on during the game, but the prices were still reasonable. The waitress brought over new glasses immediately when someone new joined our table so they could drink from the beer pitchers. She was very attentive, but also did not come over too many times and distract us from the game. I didn't try any of the appetizers but my friends enjoyed what they ordered. Definitely recommend coming here with a group to watch the game.

DOGuw0Mxi0cYDvTup0VHBw.text: I have loved coming to this location for several years.  The food is always great and the atmosphere, especially the outdoor patio, is awesome.  I've even used the dog patio with my furry friend.    Today, I went with a friend for a late lunch.  Food was great, service was initially fine.  My friend asked for a side salad with dinner and was advised against it by our waiter , even though after ordering it he found it to be great.  Just a weird suggestion from the waiter.  When he ordered a half order if wings, he got a full...  and was charged full price despite the waiter acknowledging it.  The real problem, though, was that when I ordered a glass of water to switch from soda, my water came back to the table in the same glass my friends daqueri was poured and that my friend drank.  I didn't initially notice this and had started drinking when I tasted the daqueri.  I looked at the glass and it was still covered in the daqueri pulp/mix.  Worse, though, when I shared this with my waiter including the fact I'm a recovering alcoholic let alone the grossness - he said "I should have looked first."  Will not be returning.

3rZ1QN_N4bxlTPfZ9dD9Ow.text: A very good restaurant with an exceptional sense of humor. There's an inside joke about the redneck owners, but mostly it's about the good food and service.   I was surprised by the large number of vegetarian options, something unexpected for a BBQ joint.   The outside seating is wonderful, and it's great to hang out at the picnic tables.   I've been to brunch here, too, they have a creative brunch menu and it's reasonably priced. Check the website for specials.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Southwestern Grits
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Huevos rancheros

wn5cAthCt52j6IqJid1DTA.text: Had lunch here today. Since we are vegan they had a few items on the menu for us. We chose the Portabella Burger and the Philly Cheesesteak made from seitan.  Both came with fries. The Portabella Burger was exactly what you expect.  Nothing surprising that made the sandwich stand out. The Philly steak sandwich was great.  Nice tangy sauce and the ingredients were loaded on the bun. One thing I would have done differently is to slice the seitan in thinner slices.  The fries were tasty and crunchy and fresh tasting. The atmosphere was unique being it was formerly a mechanic garage. The prices were not bad.  Had a good size menu with several vegan and vegetarian options. We had a very friendly server who did his best to give us good service. The drawback to this restaurant is the street parking. It is paid parking.  Half the kiosk to pay don't work right. I suggest downloading the city parking app if you go.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Philly sriram cheesesteak sandwich and fries
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Portabella Burger and fries

VlT5_JN7IMVObqjdJxtj4A.text: I don't know why it's taken me years to review this place. Sadly it's one of those places I take for granted and need to stop doing it. I have never had a bad meal or bad service here. The food is pretty spot on. My boyfriend is a Texas native and he will tell you the chili is pretty darn close. Little meatier here but no complaints. His other favorites are the pulled pork sandwich, brisket sandwich and salmon salad. My faves are the nachos, flank steak salad and DW cheeseburger.  Also I love the outdoor patio seating and decor.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Marinated flank steak salad with bacon and fries.
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Texas-style chili.
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. DW cheeseburger and fries.

MaSpJw7ue62LlyGNe7NjPg.text: I've had pretty average experiences here. For a place that can call themselves a vegan-friendly joint, I was pretty disappointed.   The few times I've been, I keep hoping for the seitan wings to get better. They haven't. Two times I got violently ill from them, and I'm not new to BBQ sauce or seitan. After that, I stopped trying. I returned once more to meet friends and only ordered the Junkyard Nachos to prevent further damage to my stomach. The BBQ sauce was definitely delicious, so I give them some credit. The food is your typical fare of bar food and basic restaurant dishes. My carnivore friends rave about the food though, so if you aren't vegan/vegetarian, it's worth a shot!  Drink specials are not bad. I've returned simply to have a drink with friends, but likely won't have a full meal involving seitan again.

ATBf1ht1Mn0puOmJdQD15A.text: I recently became a Pescatarian so their aren't as many options as I had before  at certain restaurants I loved going to so it was refreshing to see that they had a whole menu dedicated to vegetarian/vegans/Pescatarians. This particular visit I tried the Seitan wings which taste wings, but on the other hand does taste a little "substitutish", but they are good. They are made out of a wheat protein and you can have any wing sauce that they have for their regular wings and the vegetarian wings are fried up and delicious. Also had a side salad with a cilantro lime vinaigrette thats really good too. My main dish I had the Jamaican Jerk pasta with added salmon. This is spicy but really good. it comes with a like creamy sauce with jerk spice. There are little onions, peas and peppers in it as well. Its a nice size portion.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

SvR9Ed_yfK-wQrnTzrw4Ew.text: This is the worst food I've ever had. No seriously, they screwed up scrambled eggs. The only thing good here is the water. And the service is non existent. Somehow even home fries were bad.

EMp3rbkcYPlT4ZLEUDuh0A.text: I was in town visiting family, my Aunt and Uncle recommended that we go to "Double Wide Grill.  I'm up for trying new places and supporting Mom & Pop Business Any day of the week.  It was pouring rain, so it made it a little difficult for out of town peeps to find parking close by, but we found street parking across the street.  The hostess sat my party of six asap, great setup of an old Automobile Garage repair shop, plenty of cool decorations, neon signs, oil cans, and automotive signs.  A friendly staff and our waitress was A+ We had One Burger, Two Big Salads, Two Boneless Wing orders, and Pasta. Everything was A+ !!

39ypIP3hBrIWs3neJVUHEA.text: Worst brunch I've ever had!! The eggs were all over-cooked, the potatoes were just boiled, and the cornbread was a dried out brick. Thanks for a great Mother's Day.

-P7eDoza9XYiL-UUBKEPyw.text: Waiting for ever to get water! Then 20 min. For our drink! The sever never came back to ask about food or if we needed another drink! We paid and left! Their loss, we had money to spend!

n1hduCWLCH1CkWWsqnmqhg.text: My wife and I regularly take our dog here to the outdoor patio area.  It is one of the very few places near the south hills where we can eat and have a drink with our dog.  They even have a separate dog menu.  They are very careful to avoid contact with the dogs and the area is set off by itself away from the rest of the customers.    The food can be hit or miss.  I have had their burgers, wings, sandwiches, and many of their appetizers.  However, few things have ever stood out.  The one appetizer I would highly recommend are their Reuben egg rolls.  Very unique dish that is filling and has a great taste.  Other than these however, nothing has ever been memorable.  The service is always extremely slow.  No matter how busy it is, it always seems that we can never get in and out the place in under an hour.  The staff are always very friendly I will say though.  Overall I love that you can take your dog here and that alone will keep me coming back.  However I would definitely like to see some better food options.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rueben egg rolls with thousand island
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken nachos

OtrNzx8ErS9GYCAjoozqVw.text: Order 5 meals from This place.  THEY ALL SUCKED.  Chicken was dry and tasteless.  We had to go get pizza because the food was that bad.  WILL NEVER ORDER FROM THEM AGAIN.

9m1E4T6Na4zYc4PumYyQbA.text: Used to love this place but after last night I won't be coming back anytime soon. My hubby and I got here around 7:30 and was told there was a 20 min wait even though there were lots of empty tables. After 25 min we decided just to sit at the bar and ordered food. After 45 min or so went by the bartender said our food would be here soon but we kept seeing people who ordered way after us get their food and by this time we were starving. So another 20 min or so goes by and another bartender says it should be soon so then another 10 min or so goes by and she goes back to kitchen and comes back saying they are out of mashed potatoes and cornbread and the kitchen is closing early. Wtf? Why didn't they just come out and say that before and we would have ordered something else. Makes no sense. Bartender was nice and gave us some free drinks but kitchen staff needs to get their act together. This used to be one of my favorite places in the Southside. So disappointing.

3I2uYEA-ZNHEXTSOTO4Hgg.text: Very cool atmosphere. The waitress was pleasant. The food was good. I ordered the seitan wings based on recommendation from the waitress (the menu was so big I had a hard time deciding).  Husband ordered the Hawaiian burger which he liked. Kids got chicken fingers and boneless wings. We didn't wait very long for food.

Sbad1GVrsBFMZ3cb0bAWXg.text: Waited 20 minutes for a waitress to take our drink order, we told her both our food and drink orders. She wrote nothing down. After she brought our drinks, never returned. Our food took hour if not longer m, all of which was cold. Nothing was prepared properly. We were kind asking multiple times (the host) for service and for things that were originally ordered. Short staffed or not, make sure our drinks are refilled and we are aware it may take awhile. Don't roll eyes when told our meals are not prepared how we asked!!! We have been here before this trip, but it was never this bad.

e3zGmLvJrbVAJQS0mq1IDA.text: I would give the food 5 stars and the service 3 so I decided 4 stars was fair. Given the fact that we sat as a table of 5 at 7pm on Friday night on the southside, I was expecting the kitchen to be backed up. But then again I got my food at 9pm. 2 HOURS LATER. That is just slightly crazy. Especially since the tables next to us were served a ton faster and left before we even got our food.  There was a bit of a mix up with the servers I think. There were two in the section we were seated in and nobody came over for about 45 minutes. We finally went up and asked the hostess and she sent one over to us.   We ordered two of the full orders of seitan wings with sweet bbq and garlic parm. I absolutely love these! So good and definitely shareable for a table. The bbq ones were my favorite. On the side of the garlic parm ones was a dish of the garlic parm sauce that you had to pour over, but a lot kf the garlic oil came out first, kinda drenching the wings. Spoons for that are recommended!  I ordered the shroom and swiss lentil burger with fries. The fries were SO good. Chewy and crunchy and perfectly shaped with no sogginess. The burger was really tasty, especially the mushrooms. Lots of flavor! It was huge and super messy but I loved it.  I would love to come again when it is less busy and try some more vegetarian menu items! Maybe one of the seitan sandwiches next.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Inside a veggyro.. not pretty but tasty anyway!
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shroom n swiss lentil burger! Red lighting

jFRr5DnpbXAf7MQ4bPBx-w.text: Was visiting a friend in town and they suggested this place. We parked a little far down for free street parking.  The pros of this place is definitely our sever being attentive as well as the variety of vegan options!  I ordered the BBQ brisket since it seemed like a bbq joint. The brisket was dry and the sauce helped but it couldn't mask all of the dryness.  The bbq sauce was freaking fantastic though! It had a great sweet tangy taste and the texture was more jammy, but definitely enjoyable!   The bread roll they used on my sandwich was also tasty. It was soft, chewy, and slightly sweet.

XS-2TVfxZRA9tZKBSpWHmg.text: Good food, horrible service. We got there at 5:15 on a Saturday. Our waitress was nice enough, but it took us one hour to get our entrees, which only consisted of a burger and a salad. The place not only about half full. The wings were some of the best I ever had. BBQ sauce was amazing. Sweet potato fries were great and has a tasty, sweet sauce.

4LdrQKwGpfUuAVXRrG_O0A.text: As a food critic from New York, I was excited to try some of the food my friends from Pittsburgh have been raving about. The first of many on my agenda was this place of business. Besides the fact that it took 23 minutes before a woman finally asked "If we've been helped yet", the service in general was shotty at best. I am from New York, so I am pretty desensitized to bad service, so that was not my issue. As someone whom consumes alcohol, maybe twice every 6 months, I can smell it from a mile away and it takes just a little, to make me feel hammered. I ordered a Pina Colada, with alcohol. My drink obviously had 0 alcohol in the beverage. I did not taste, smell nor feel a thing. When I NICELY asked the server about it, I was rebutted with an accusatory tone and a major attitude, with NO RESOLUTION. That ruined my entire meal. I was very nice about it, because I did not want to cause a scene, but I really wish I had not been so courteous to that uncouth maggot, you hire to serve hard working people, a meal they paid for. She did not deserve my respect, because she gave me, the patron, NONE. I have no clue how your food taste. My order was given to a buddy's 8 year old nephew. I'm sure his young palate enjoyed the ribs. I won't disclose the young serves name, because she clearly does not know any better and with that attitude, she'll need this gig for as long as she can keep it. She SUCKS and ruined my entire experience. I so regret being so nice. I will be back, but I'll be coming with buddies who have actual power in their pen, in this town. Thanks for the great introduction to Pittsburgh.

WtIeUP1rZmR_oicOCBKwaw.text: 3 of us ordered BBQ. Ate outside. Good service. Fun atmosphere. Food was solid. Beef brisket was good. Pulled pork too. Cole slaw had highest rating of anything on our plates. Corn bread was too much like coffee cake. Overall True to the genre but nothing really stood out.

eiYn1xNxS53Lngzy_JrpxQ.text: Stopped for dinner while visiting my friend in Pittsburgh. Mixed emotions about this place. One thing we agree on, they definitely need to hire more staff! Service was slow from the get go, took forever to place our order, get our order, get refills, etc. My husband and friend liked their dinner. I was unimpressed with mine. Nothing tasted very fresh. I was also amazed, for such a big menu, they were reluctant to make any changes to how I wanted my food customized. I've never encountered that before. I don't think I'd ever done here again honestly.

TmmtmyoRaTheYtAVzcV6ZQ.text: Vegan options are rad! Not your average sad veggie burger options. Service was great, beer selection is good! We will definitely come back.

EYypecRjo7mT_n5qfN_ewg.text: Torn  The staff, burger, brunch, and atmosphere is really great.  Unfortunately the BBQ they tout is absolutely horrible... The TV dinner gimmick is great, but the food arrived cold and the brisket was downright bland ...   If you want a great burger or brunch this is a great place and they even have a section for canine friends, but I can't stress how bad the BBQ is   I'll be back for lunch all the time... But dinner... Just avoid

klSmJQUFa4oC8IrxgbnaBg.text: To start off, I am a pescetarian who is a vegetarian who still eats fish. I love trying new vegetarian and vegan places. This place has amazing vegetarian options as well as meals for meat eaters too. The bean nacho appetizer is one of my favorites. The vegetarian gyro is also to die for. However, the vegetarian "wings" are weird. Also made with seitan, they are just meatless cubes that can be seasoned well. Overall an amazing place to experience.

eoe0Hn2U66kI0avPObVzDw.text: Decent food--they have a nice selection of vegetarian options.  A little pricey for what they serve though.

p8QfS0nriQdsV7tnOMdltQ.text: Do not expect to find decent beef bbq here.  Previous reviews led us to think there would be good beef bbq, which was on the menu and which we ordered.  The beef that came was like crockpot-cooked roast beef.  When we asked whether it was smoked, we were told it was "braised."  Look elsewhere for smoked bbq beef!  The service was competent and friendly, and the very informal atmosphere was nice.

3KHsXEWn55zRIaNYT4z7aA.text: My first visit to the Double Wide.  Simple Friday night - Steak, Pepper & Bacon Salad with a side of Sweet Potato Fries.  Two strikes on the salad:  Grasshopper pee on the lettuce (what we thought dead, wilted, brown leaves were when we were kids); and balsamic dressing that looks like brown gravy.  Um, yuk.  I will say that the steak, peppers and bacon were fine.  Sweet potato fries were angel-singing fabulous.  I requested bleu cheese, but the server suggested their sugar-cinammon dip and it was terrific.  She was so right.  Loved it.  The service was excellent: happy, helpful & quick.  I might go back for the outdoor opportunity, but otherwise there's just no draw.  Another thing that made me chuckle - they weren't really busy but there were two guys handling the greeting and seating chart.  It looked like they were studying for an exam.  ...maybe they were and I'm being harsh...

21v7eq1HAb7I4QOYQIJc1Q.text: I would have never gone here on my own because I'm a vegetarian and the name just doesn't sound like a place for me.  Boy, was I WRONG!  What a pleasant surprise!  We had a large group of 11 and there was plenty of room to relax.  The atmosphere was so comfortable and we didn't have problems talking down the table with each other.    Being a vegetarian, the menu was fantastic for me!  So many great things to try.  I can honestly say that I have never been out to eat at a restaurant that serves seitan gyros.  I was so excited that there were so many CHOICES FOR ME!    Adding this to our list of "go to" places.  PS Check for a Groupon!

XIDRPGgLqXxJ44k5uXIbdw.text: The food and service were just okay -- kind of meh. I ordered the vegetarian chili and I needed to ask for Tabasco sauce -- there was no spicing and the vegetables were somewhat raw. The wife ordered a sandwich and said it was fine. The kids had pizzas and again they were nothing to write home about. Not a great place especially when the service and food are sub par.

igZN_m65C7GOskcfGKZAHA.text: Just in Pittsburgh for about 24 hours for work. Helped vegan and decided to give this place a try. Main reason why we decided to try it was because it not only had vegan options for me, but also "normal" options for me meat eating boyfriend. We walked up and the place was PACKED, which only gave us a good sign that it was worth it. The wait was about 45-55 minutes, but the food came out so fast that it evened out. I got the vegan BBQ saitan bites and I should have gotten like 3 orders they were AMAZING and I was very happy with them. My boyfriend said his pulled pork sandwich was also very very good. If I'm ever back, this place is where I'm going!

5NtGdO-sNXC5U2gX6e4U-w.text: Only been here once, and I would have given it two stars if not to give it the benefit of the doubt that the restaurant was in recovery-mode from Saint Patrick's day weekend. We went on a Sunday night, and we had difficulty placing an order because they were out of a lot of menu items/beers.  The hot seitan wings were pretty good, I liked that they actually had some kick to them and enough sauce to make them satisfyingly moist. The whole order though was pretty pricey for the small portion size, especially compared to seitan wings offered elsewhere in Pittsburgh (OTB, Spak bros, etc), and the wing sizes were really mis-proportioned which made splitting the order as an appetizer awkward.  They were out of vegan rolls for burgers, but I was craving a one, so I ordered the vegan lentil burger anyway on the multigrain bread. When it arrived, it had no toppings (lettuce, tomato, onion, pickle) so I had to call back the waitress to ask for them and for some mustard. The lentil patty was good, but the meal tasted like a sandwich rather than a burger. The vegetable side of zucchini and squash was pretty watery and mild, though not terrible, I regretted not ordering a different side.  I'd be willing to give this place another try, since I've heard the veggyro and vegan fries are good!

ZBxX1U7-cVOegna0t-xKpA.text: Ordered their Monday special, chicken quesadilla which comes with a side salad for $10.99. VERY well done dish!  Compliments to the chef, I must admit I come here often because of meetings and never really know what to order because its all been "ok" but not "GOOD".  This is the first dish I have ordered that I felt was good enough to go out of my way to come back for!!!  Please put it on the regular menu!  The quesadilla had just the right amount of crispiness and was fully of flavor.  I had a side of BBQ sauce which made it just right for me.  Be warned, its a BIG portion which was awesome but it can be finished.  For two lighter eaters, could easily share it and still both be full.

5WihaBcH6lkZGBkRJCMbjA.text: Good bar for a lively crowd and a decent beer selection.  I didn't try the food, so I can only judge the place strictly on liquid refreshments and the bar area.   Friendly service and very accommodating...just wish they offered a beer special or two.  That said, it's a fun, colorful atmosphere with plenty of easily visible TVs to take in a sporting event.   I'll definitely return.  Until then...cheers!

Qady6ysXZ70jRlAEQgSGKA.text: I love the outdoor seating, and I especially like the brunches.  I also think their specials, such as their "all you can eat ribs," are a very good deal.  The food is pretty good, the people watching is excellent.  The Gingerbread Pancakes are excellent.  The service varies, but I generally get pretty good service at the Double Wide.  It's a fun place to go eat, almost everything is down home.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brunch - Gingerbread Pancakes
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brunch - Trucker&#39;s Breakfast

b2BDCvhkNW5XX2sD2PMknA.text: Yea. Had massive stomach pains at 2:30 AM after eating here.   I hate this place.  I seriously hate this place.  This place is what's wrong with the Pittsburgh dining scene.

tf799PJhpO8K8h3sDultcA.text: I usually go here for Sunday brunch after a weekend drinking. I tried on a Saturday night once but I was told there would be an hour wait, so we went next door instead. I never have a problem getting a table on Sunday though.  The food is great. I wish they'd give more than a spoonful of those seasoned diced potatoes though, they're so good, but you only get 6 to 7 pieces. I recommend the carnivore's omelette, though the steak and eggs is good too. The screwdrivers are always sting as well.  The decor is great too, and it's a great place to relax with a low noise level.... However! The reason I gave 3 stars? Every time they drop off the check you won't see the waiter again. Even after handing the check back and asking for a refill, you won't see the refill. In fact, asking the wait staff for anything is a task.

-f6NHyo9vnTTvCWOu1PRSQ.text: I am not really sure why this place has such high reviews.   So a few years ago we tried this place - it looks great from the outside and as we quickly discovered - terrible for the food. Fast forward to 2013 and my husband suggests we try it out again... I protest and he wins out. The food... again... not so awesome.   the good: the service is great. Our waitress was just the right amount of attentive, friendly and efficient. Lacey is why this review has two stars instead of one. I also liked how the kids menu offered a mix and match of items and included fresh, raw carrots in addition to the veggie of the day and the usual suspects of fries. My daughter had the carrots and the grilled cheese and then a cookie we decided to wrap up fro later... she was happy.   My husband was content his grilled cheese with bacon sandwich - with a side of fries.   The bad: I had the pulled pork sandwich with the lug nuts (upcharge) on the side. First, the sandwich was served open face with no sauce on the pork. There was a strange serving of something that looked suspiciously like duck sauce on the side and was very spicy... not something I would pair with pulled pork. I decided not to use it and took a bite of the naked pork - it had like zero seasoning on it. yuck. we asked for BBQ sauce which - when added -  improved the flavor but it was pretty meh.. I have made much better in a crockpot at home. Plus... mixed in with the tender bits were a number of pieces that were not braised enough - chewy and tough - sinewy even. I picked those pieces out since I decided to eat it with a knife and fork instead of as a sandwich.   Now the lug nuts looked interesting on the menu - garlic and herb potatoes... yeah, garlic - I can totally get behind that! um, the reality was what appeared to be deep fried chunks of potatoes that were fried in grease that does not taste like it was changed in quite some time. it had an off flavor to it and the garlic and herb sauce was terrible - strong flavor that ruined you for really any thing else. After a second bite with the sauce scraped off I asked for fries instead - again, Lacy was gracious and took care of me... the fries were ok - again, tasted like they were fried in old grease but it was tolerable.   I think this is it for me with the Double Wide Grill. I don't care how great it looks from the outside or how popular it seems to be. It really makes me question how discerning people can be to think it is great food and go back again and again. about 10 minutes after leaving heartburn set in and now a couple of hours later I still feel slightly sick to my stomach. No third chances... avoid at all costs. but should you decide to try it out - hopefully Lacy is your waitress.

8KWBExxAzzXkWZHDaqaCOQ.text: Who knew such a place that just screams "huge baskets of wings and double burgers" would be so vegetarian friendly?
