Around my 21st birthday I had a hard time finding a mojito, so we stopped in here and got appetizers. Junk yard nachos and crab, black bean, and corn fritters were fantastic. I also discovered that mojito's aren't as good as they sound, but atleast they used real mint leaves!

cjJMy72VOXxAl5YDzOEvEQ.text: The Double Wide Grill is a more interesting alternative than the other chain restaurants that are found on the eastern end of Carson St.  The old gas station ambiance is pretty fun as well.  The food seemed pretty mediocre to me, however the prices were quite reasonable.  I had the potato tacos which tasted like they were filled with overseasoned Potato Flakes like you'd get under turkey in a really bad cafeteria.  Maybe it was my fault for ordering such a weird dish in the first place.  The other plates served at my table seemed much better.  The service was quick and friendly.

UtAg5ha9hLlr_3OCwVRAIg.text: I have been twice.  Both times service was HORRIBLE (I was a server for years).  They were mean, inattentive, and didn't care that my chicken sandwich came out RAW!  The second time the server never checked on us and as soon as we were done eating brought us our checks.  We wanted more drinks and told her that.  She never came back with our order and when we asked her about it she said she was waiting for us to pay.  Doesn't make any sense.  I will never go back.

GX65VTuKQMLycRLXN6E9GA.text: Wow. I wanted to love this place, but I can't even say I liked it. The menu sounded awesome. BBQ for my hubby and some tofu action for me (I'm not a vegetarian; I just happen to like a lot of meatless dishes).  We stopped in for brunch and were disappointed left and right. The coffee was watered down and just not great at all. We ordered a grilled cheese with a side of bacon for our little nephew, and they gave us a grilled cheese with bacon on it AND on the side. Sadly, though, the grilled cheese was probably the best thing we ordered. Our meals were SO not ideal. I got the South of the Border Tofu Scramble Wrap, my husband got the Carnivore's omelet and my sister got the Breakfast Burrito. None of us were impressed. The portions were smaller than expected, the food was dry and lacked flavor, and somehow, our meals were lukewarm at best. I would hope this isn't the case, but it almost seemed like the burrito and wrap were made in advance and refrigerated, then microwaved once we ordered it. If I didn't have a Groupon to use here, I wouldn't be going back.

6Ou4cN22i4lMSJoxg_FpwQ.text: My boyfriend and I ate there last Friday night, around 8:30pm. After reading the reviews, wasn't expecting much from the waiters, but was expecting a good meal. We started out with the chicken egg rolls. I absolutely did not like them. Tasted like spicy mush inside of an egg roll shell. The sauce was the look and consistency of duck sauce, but pretty tasteless to me. My boyfriend really liked them, though.  I ordered the tilapia, cajun style, with broccoli and mashed potatoes. What I got was a small, over-cooked piece of fish and undercooked vegetables. The mashed potatoes were decent (how can you mess that up?).  I left feeling hungry and cheated. $15 for a piece of fish that was smaller than my palm? My boyfriend ordered a steak and veggies. The veggies were also undercooked, and the steak was gristly. The middle of his mashed potatoes were cold.  For a $50 meal, we were expecting a lot more. Definitely will not be back.

KoDLAd7bTnNSk67QZh96bQ.text: I went to DWG this past summer with my wife and two sons, we were visiting Pittsburgh and I knew of this spot thru previous internet research of the city. We went on a Sunday afternoon (around 5-6pm). Not being from Pittsburgh the area wasn't the most touristy but I've lived in bad neighborhoods so I was fine. We entered and were promptly seated. I ordered my older son a grilled cheese with fries and my younger one a peanut butter & jelly sandwich with fries. Me and my wife both ordered jailhouse TV dinners. Food arrived fairly quickly and the ribs were GREAT!, very meaty and saucy. But the highlight of the meal was those potato hubcaps, I would of been content with just eating a big plate of those. When I come back to the Burgh' I will definately get a few orders of those hubcap fries. In my TV dinner I did also have the coconut rum tilipia which was gross. The TV dinner is a huge meal, I actually left some food on my plate which I normally don't do b/c I am greedy but that is testament to how much food they give you. You get to pic item item from tray one and two and then 3 sides. The sandwiches my kids got were huge, they were kind of like texas toast in thickness. They were actually able to take half the meal home and eat it later. I will definately come back for lunch so that it is nice and sunny out and we can take our orders to go and enjoy them elsewhere in Pittsburgh as this is not a family restaurant as there was a lot of cursing and smoking going on at the bar which we were seated right across from

V7dZ4fF73opGL598FmgrNA.text: Vegetarian or not, you have to come here for the seitan wings. They're fantastic. My entire family (two young kids, included) loves them. The wait staff is also incredibly friendly.

9Rf4T2j585twuV8t5YW13A.text: Can't speak much to the food, but they pull off the classy hoosier feel pretty well. Drinks did seem a tad expensive for the venue, but the cornhole was a nice touch

2waMrSXuhMV0hsJlBb0nvQ.text: I'd been craving barbecue for weeks, so with a Groupon in tow, we headed out to Double Wide Grill on Saturday night to feed our bellies.  We got there around 7, and waited 10-15 minutes for a table.  It was nice weather, so we ambled up and down the block.  You can give the host your cell number so they call when your table is ready - it was very convenient and allowed us to take a walk instead of having to hover around the host stand.  We were seated inside at a booth, and we both got a kick out of the old-service-station decor.  Maybe "decor" isn't the right word, since this place actually WAS an old service station, it doesn't just look like one.  Several TVs were around the room, but the volume was quiet until the Penguins started playing.  They had a pretty cool selection of draft beer - my boyfriend was very impressed and got some unusual beer.  Can't remember what it was called but it was 9% alcohol, served in a smaller glass, and he enjoyed it immensely.  They were out of Blue Moon Pumpkin so I tried something from their Wheat section - I want to say it was Southampton something or other?  It was light and refreshing.  The boy got a full rack of ribs, and I got the brisket and pulled pork platter.  Both came with cornbread, slaw, a pickle, and fries - but I got their "hub cap potatoes" instead.  It was a TON of food!  We could not finish it between the two of us.  We took a whole half rack of ribs home because we were simply too stuffed to proceed.  Makes you wonder how the guy on "Man vs. Food" can do it.  So everything was pretty much "okay" in my book, although my boyfriend enjoyed everything a bit more than I did.  I found everything to be too salty - I was continually going to the coleslaw and my water glass to drown out the saltiness.  I wasn't a fan of the pulled pork - the barbecue sauce used was very vinegary and tangy in a somewhat unpleasant way. The brisket was better - juicy, and with a sauce that was more sweet.  Still, it didn't blow me away - pretty standard.  The ribs were just okay too, salty and without a lot of sauce.  The best part of ribs is licking sauce off your fingers, but there wasn't much to lick!  Also, the meat separated from the bones as soon as you pulled on them - the meat slipped off before we could even take a bite, so we didn't get the fun experience of holding up a meaty rib and nomming the meat off the bone.  We were left with just a plate of meat, which wasn't quite as fun to eat.  Cornbread was good, fries were addictive, and the "hubcap potatoes" were okay - nice garlic flavor.  Nothing was very hot (temperature), seemed like maybe the food had been sitting for a while.  Speaking of "a while," service is very slow like everyone else says.  Our waiter was certainly friendly and pleasant, but we waited a long time to be greeted, a long time for our beers, and a very long time for our food.  Sounds like that's just the way it is here.  I was feeling sort of "2 1/2 stars" about the whole thing, but my boyfriend was so enthusiastic about the meal that I'll go ahead and give it a 3.  If you're craving barbecue it's a fine place to go to take the edge off, but it isn't the real deal.

q5xVO59xaXlKhHC_uc0ihg.text: Just ate lunch for the first time at Double Wide. Had the pulled pork tacos and the double wide salad. The tacos were good, but I was expecting the pulled pork to have a sauce on them, maybe a BBQ? I liked the salad and the addition of sunflower seeds for crunch.  Waitress was friendly, and to finish we had the death by chocolate cake which was tasty, but really when does chocolate cake not taste good?  It'd be a fun place to have some beers and grab some appetizers. I'll be back.

CNlQsMU3bf7g4bbJ-uztzA.text: This was my third attempt at giving the Double Wide a chance.  Their food is overpriced, under seasoned and the service is spotty.  .  I ordered a chicken burrito (around $10). After waiting what seemed an unreasonably long time I received a shrimp burrito, but didn't realize it until after I had taken a bite.  I am allergic to shrimp.  I had to flag a member of the waitstaff down to let them know of their mistake, and then wait another half hour to get my chicken burrito.  Meanwhile, our regular waiter was nowhere to be seen.  The chicken burrito was probably one of the worst I've ever had. The quality of the ingredients seemed okay, it was just SO bland!  It consisted of chicken chunks with no seasoning, black beans, rice and cabbage shreds. That's it. It was served with a hand full of tri-colored tortilla chips and a "salsa" that was also under seasoned.  I ordered desert, an ice ream cookie sandwich. I was given 2 supermarket bakery-bought chocolate chip cookies with a scoop of ice cream between.  The only saving grace was the frozen mojito I ordered, which was VERY good.   as a whole my 3rd try was an INCREDIBLY disappointing experience, and I wont be back.  Oh-never did get an apology for the shrimp burrito AND now I have hives all over my face.

WdSejFfWiMVdEsPgc8QiTg.text: Great vegan options, however the service, while super friendly and lovely, is quite slow, and the food is amazing, however they're often out of quite a few things, so have a few ideas of what you want when it's time to place your order...

7st9aivk4oY1twhE4pifxA.text: My boyfriend and I were in Pittsburgh for the NHL Bridgestone Winter Classic.  On gameday, we drove to the Double Wide Grill for a late lunch before finding parking to get to the game.  My boyfriend is vegetarian and I am vegan, so I picked this spot because it has options for us.  It was a little tricky finding it--we were surprised to see 2341 before 2339, but once we found the right place, we walked in and were seated quickly. There is a separate vegetarian/vegan page on the menu, and items are clearly marked.  My boyfriend and I started with the seitan "wings" in the BBQ sauce, but they were really hunks of seitan, deliciously seasoned, and almost crispy.  For an entree, he got the Potato Tacos while I got the Tofu Skewers.  The skewers came out slathered in BBQ sauce with rice and a green bean melange.  Sadly the vegetable was forgettable, but the skewers and rice were utterly delicious.  I give them extra points for not putting broccoli, a vegetable I despise, on the skewers.  On my one visit, I found the service rather friendly (and we were wearing our Washington Capitals jerseys in Pittsburgh Penguins country), if a bit slow.  I will certainly recommend it to friends traveling to Pittsburgh and I will go back if I am ever in Pittsburgh again.

TcRQxlDpzdUctX6110BbzA.text: We wanted to like this place - the decor is cool, it's a comfortable atmosphere.  I came super hungry and was excited at the size of the portion.  Unfortunately, I got horrible food poisoning from this restaurant, as well as our house guest who ordered the same meal as I did.  We spent the night taking turns in the restroom.  I have never been so sick from a meal in my life.  As much as I had an okay expirience while I was there and I really liked the atmosphere, I don't think I could muster the ability to walk through their doors again out of fear.  :(

uEruF7Jysss4ZSi7WbRI_A.text: REALLY overrated. I've been there 4 or 5 times - the food is OK, a bit overpriced - but the service has always been terribly SLOW - especially when there's a group of more than 4 or 5 people.   I also don't really get off on sitting inside an old gas station - or - even worse - outside an old gas station.

srHETvc7Wg2j6saU4hIZwg.text: I stopped here on a whim for my burger and was decently surprised. I had one of their house made sodas and a burger and both were delightful. The service was alright, but the waitresses were dressed a little trashy for my taste. I think I've seen classier outfits at Hooters.

_lNqIA9miU63OT5jYVFhPQ.text: I was sold when I saw the Sunday Funday special, breakfast special that is.  A 12 oz. Tecate and a shot of Cuervo (if you're nice, they'll swap it for a Jamison!).  The atmosphere is pretty cool, I dug the authenticity of the garage.  However, I'm slightly confused by the name, sort of makes me think of a trailer, not a garage.  I get it either way, it just seemed odd.  I suggest heading in earlier (before 2 P.M.) on a Sunday for brunch.  It's probably a bit fresher.  I had the Double Wide Benedict.  It's a tasteful deviation of Eggs Benedict using cornbread instead of an English muffin and bacon instead of ham.  They also throw some fresh spinach under the poached eggs.  My whole meal was a little colder than I like, but still enjoyable.  When I go back, I'm definitely going earlier and trying a Bloody Mary.

g-FsenuWdwKLQ6ASBcVDNg.text: This is a pretty informal meeting space.  Excellent beer selection, usually good bartenders and waitstaff, but man when you get a bad one, it's going to be painful for everyone involved.  The food is actually pretty gross, and you will seriously be burping up your sins for the next 6 hours if you even look at a fucking hubcap fry.  But, when this place is not packed, it's really fun to just sit and relax.  Also, bonus for starting Karaoke on Saturdays, though judging by the crowd, that might not be around for very long.

HuO3IvYsWhRvHZBF1mFNaw.text: I only gave this two stars because of the decent vegetarian/vegan menu (I liked the seitan wings). I came back with my boyfriend and puppy because it was a beautiful day and we had known this restaurant for having a dog friendly patio (which we were looking forward to). As we approached the hostess stand I was immediately told to go to the new segregated dog friendly area of the patio which was sectioned off with a small wooden fence. This came as a surprise due to the fact that the reason we had previously liked this restaurant was for it's laid back dog-friendly atmosphere. As we approached a table we were disgusted by how filthy this area was- trash all over the ground, the tables hadn't been bussed... We sat and waited for a few minutes before a server yelled across the fence to tell us that menus and silverware were available on a plastic table for us to help ourselves to. The menus were small paper take-out quality and the silverware was in a tangled mess. We felt like we were uninvited guests at a trashy house party. Needless to say we left without notice. We ended up going to Aladdin's Eatery in Mt. Lebanon where we were promptly greeted by the manager with a bowl of water for our puppy.

2ev-Q2FUcKAsPuY8VtYlqA.text: Great place for loud, relaxed times.  Food is what you would expect from a converted garage, we love it - bring your dog.

aFHSYzS_fnxSWLRCstuh8A.text: I ate here a second time when I was in town. It's just so good! Those hubcap potatoes are amazing. I would eat those all the time if I lived in Pittsburgh. AND they have Lindemann's Lambic Framboise on tap!? $6 a glass, but still, that's awesome! Our waitress was one of the managers. What a trip! :)

Dz3HdfLCzZPcogLwnbNDrQ.text: What a place. It's definitely...double wide? Very large interior AND exterior, which feels almost impersonal, even though they tried to fill up the space with gas cans, tires, and other garage-y paraphernalia. Still feels like waiting in a plane hangar for fuel!  Now, I can't speak for the virtues of anything meaty here, since although I definitely had three different meals....they were all vegan! Seitan wings, coconut rum tofu, and garlic tofu. The seitan wings were pretty darling, definitely a great alternative. The garlic tofu was GARLICY, woo...but not much else! The coconut rum sauce was pretty brilliant....however, the amount ladled over the tofu was not enough to flavour it impressively. The caramelized onion cilantro rice was actually the highlight of the coconut rum platter, which included bland vegetables of the day and the aforementioned rice. Not sure if the prices matched the flavour, but the portions were pretty much perfect. I want to like this place, fo' realz; the menu in theory is wonderful...maybe next time it'll hit me right!

jTbQdTdeWdbTH8kRP9BI4g.text: The food is gimmicky and not that great. The beer selection is top notch and the atmosphere is pretty cool. In the warmer months, the patio outside is excellent. I would give it a much higher rating if they could get their food to be better. I usually eat somehwere else first now and grab a beer there.

AhydQlyTNw604wFZdAR5Gw.text: Very, very loud, large screen tvs (during final hockey game of olympics), less than subtle gas station theme, large, casual, good for kids. Atmosphere included - I kid you not - a large bald man lounging full length on a leather sofa in front of a television with an empty nacho plate in front of him - just like home! We sat in a comfortable booth.  The wings with signature hot sauce were very good without the breaded feeling that cheap wings have. The sauce was delicious - medium hot with butter and garlic notes. I'd like hotter and order "tearjerker" sauce on the side next time for dipping. Lots of creamy blue cheese and a few veggies. At $1 per wing these should be good.  I had turkey burger "rebel yell jalapeno" style, switched to cheddar instead of swiss. I thought I went with a healthier choice but probably not - greasy, very buttered roll, super thick almost compressed burger with odd sausage-like flavor, a few pickled and fresh jalapenos didn't qualify as "rebel yell" to me as I could have used hot sauce. Side dish of broccolini could have been skipped - over buttered, under salted, and server didn't bring utensils (my mouth was full when she checked on us and I gave up by the time she came again). Overall I'm sorry I ordered and ate most of it.  Others ordered the beef burger (extremely thick, oddly spiced), fries (described at fresh cut I expected them to look and taste more like real potatoes you know like the zoo - hmmm, maybe overcooked a bit, not very salty), brisket sandwich (meat good, bbq sauce very not nuanced).  Service was good, other than forgetting the utensils, everything was as it should be including requesting cheese switch and mustard on side.  Overall, I wouldn't return for the food. Maybe a wing or two with a beer.

K5xrXGbPtu6qkyDZCu4oHQ.text: The converted gas station makes for a cool, fun atmosphere and it was nice to have an al fresco brunch on a beautiful day.  But my breakfast burrito was pretty bland and the service was not that attentive.

jfs-BtQSMVkQVkMyRoBqJA.text: This place has great burgers and salads. I especially enjoy that you can get a burger with a side of vegetables - a rarity in this town. The only downer? The new remodel that changed the interior from a cozy, quirky place to an ugly sports bar complete with way too many big screen tv's.

Lq0tqUXrA-RcVEdybnSqlQ.text: Located in a renovated repair shop, the Double Wide is chock full of character. There was a very nice verity of clearly marked vegetarian options to choose from which is always a plus. The BBQ Pulled Seitan was a great introduction to seitan (a meat substitute) if you've never had it before. I'd be tempted to come back just to sample more of the unique menu options. Unfortunately my wife's first choice from the menu was unavailable and the coconut tofu didn't quite hit the spot. Also, our server was a bit overloaded when we visited, but tried to be helpful in making recommendations. On the whole it was a fun place to visit & even though our visit wasn't perfect I would definitely recommend trying this place out, at least for the experience.

f6_OFU8cWiUyuPyo0q71sQ.text: We eat here everytime we are visiting our daughter.  The breakfast are great.  Think traditional with a twist.  I enjoy their eggs benefits but today I am getting their truckers breakfast.  It a great place with great ambiance.  When you are in the south side you got to try this place.

ClEgTJT9q63Jt-9oecVr1Q.text: Lots of outdoor seating and huge portions of BBQ!  I would recommend the reuben egg rolls with the thousand island dip. These we're surprisingly good and its not too heavy of an appetizer. You'll have plenty of room for your entree!  Go for their tv dinner combos and you'll have plenty of food and a good variety! I especially liked their cornbread! Yum!  Be careful as usually the weekend crowd rolls through and depletes their beer selection so you should try getting here later in the week. There were a couple of beers I wanted to try but they were all out on a Monday.   I would come back here for their bbq and drinks! Just was annoyed by all the bugs while I was sitting outside.

s387fjz1JVEqOvuUPmXCsA.text: I want to love this place, I really do, and I usually don't give bad reviews. With that being said, however, our visit to double wide was not a returning worthy one.  First things first: Service= terrible. I work in a coffee shop and never should you ever let your customers just sit there for ten minutes without even asking if they want water...especially if it's slow! One of the waitresses walked past us four times, got the people in front and behind is, and didn't even say hello to us or be right with you. Service like this is really unacceptable. I would understand if it were busy, but the fact is that it wasn't.   Food: now the only reason I would ever return is the food. It's so good...and that's what makes me want to love the place. We both had seitan wings which were cooked to perfection and tasted wonderful. We also ordered a basket of fries, not worth it. They charge you 4 dollars for literally one potato worth of fries...and they weren't even good looking fries. They were soggy and cold.   So just beware going here. Good food. Bad service.

R-63CCopDkrBrpm0Gsr9Uw.text: I was here when the owner of the establishment showed up.  I got better service then.   Not a tribute to what usually happens.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

9TF5UEaSBH9aPeTk5SwFmw.text: Loved the frozen mojito and the frozen margarita as well. Special Philly cheesesteak with nacho cheese was pretty damn good too. Great seating on a sunny day and a wide variety of selections on the menu. Plenty of veggie and vegan options as well. Nice that it's a little farther down the line on Carson than some of the other busy restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. A former mechanics garage turned into a pretty massive dining experience

-GGkz6FxfvPiLfwrFrPZUA.text: I did not enjoy my visit to Double Wide Grill.  They have a dog patio which seems like a good idea in theory.  I brought my gigantic 7 lb dog who i kept in my lap the whole time because this place was packed with dogs that people were not paying attention to. Also, if you have to sit in the dog section, expect the worst dining experience of your life. You are treated like you have the plague.  No one cleans the tables between customers, there is garbage on the ground everywhere.  You have to eat off Styrofoam plates and use disposable cutlery.    The icing on the cake... the waiter cannot come into the seating area so you have to go up and wait until they come back out or hope to be able to catch them as you run up there bounding over dogs.You also have to get your food when it comes out.    BUT they do not bring your food out in any particular order.  I was there with my friend and his entree came before our appetizer did. Then my dinner came out dead last after he was done eating and pretty much ready to go.  The food sounded good, but I honestly cannot say anything stood out. it was all kind of "meh".  I have been to many dog friendly eateries and this one may be dog friendly, but it certainly isn't people friendly. I probably won't ever come here again.

DY_MUOUcn6r4mEcsEPax6Q.text: Really nice and a GREAT option.   Really funky and crest menu which will bring a smile to your face HOWEVER when the food shows up you will be really pleased with the presentation, creativity, quality and taste!!!   Home run.   Great vibe overall.   Would ABSOLUTELY GIVE IT A TRY.

4L_s9koWcBnzyoYTBDe1gg.text: I don't think I would have stopped at the Doublewide if I didn't have a $10 off coupon from restaurant.com but I'm glad that I did after a walk on the southside my wife and I was starving and decided to give the Doublewide a chance not want to risk a lot of money we ordered the large salad and the ribs brisket and pulled pork combo being from the south I know what good barbecue is and we were not disappointed the ribs were fall off the bone good sauce was excellent everything was prepared perfectly. We already made plans to stop back next Tuesday for all you can eat ribs and I plan on putting them out of business by eating every rib bone they have. And we have antistate service

Ix1KX0Rs2C42I3X4GdM2Fg.text: The separate vegetarian and vegan menu is awesome. I have tried almost everything vegan and it is delicious. I am obsessed with the lentil burger. The service is amazing and I am never waiting long for my food even during the busiest hours. Must try!!!

RxRREXyB_VYFdVQ0SWUqeg.text: Our Birthday lunch will be remembered for the long wait to get seated and the twice as long wait (1hr) to get our order and it was not all brought to the table at one time. The first served were done eating by the time the last 2 people in our party were served. Poor management. We had to ask for drink refills while we waited. Maybe they need to hire more waitresses/waiters. We couldn't understand why tables seated after us were served and gone by the time we got our meals. The burgers were okay but the French fries were soggy.

Pt3zdaeCTHT5WXsgL6KL_A.text: No option for 0 stars, but the grits made me comfortable with 1 star. Here is the bullet points of our visit:  1- 15 minutes, no greeting. 2- waiter had the personality of a chalk board 3- 30 minutes for food 4- EVERYTHING was cold 5- the worst eggs Benedict presentation in history 6- more sauce, less paprika 7- no empathy 8- second round of eggs Benedict was terrible too 9- ran out of home fries, and without warning everyone got fries.  What a terrible experience. Just terrible. We both said on the way home "we should of just got whoppers".

xNpLc6MC0jyhPvSD523dWQ.text: Ugh.  I shouldn't have gone again, but I was was drawn in by the allure of a nice patio.  Never again.  I sat down outside and waited.  Three servers walked in my general vicinity but did not acknowledge my presence, as each likely thought it was the other's table.  I snagged drink menus off another table, then after 10 minutes of nothing my drinking partner went to the bar to order.  It took her almost 10 minutes to order at the bar, as one server was complaining to the bartender about one of her tables, very openly, and the bartender couldn't or wouldn't concentrate.  We finished our drinks at the table, and after 40 minutes, NOT ONE SERVER STOPPED BY TO SEE HOW WE WERE DOING.   It's a shame that they have such a bad staff, and it's not just me...check out other reviews as well as FourSquare Tips...they're just atrocious.     This place has the most frustrating, worst service in Pittsburgh.  I'm never going back.

fAnGXRlohJ0xL_CRH9RVTA.text: DWG frustration.   Again...went to the Double Wide Grill on 4/11/15 around 6:45 PM. There were seven (7!) tables open in the bar area alone (seats at the bar were 100% occupied but all the booths and small tables were vacant) and at least 1/3 of the tables outside were vacant...and on a nice evening, too (clear skies and slightly chilly in low 60s as the sun was setting). Went in to get a table and was told it'd be 30 minutes.   Yes...that's right, 30 minutes to get a table!! It's frickin Saturday evening...seat people. Either DWG cannot appropriately staff this restaurant or they have too many tables for their capacity. Either way, poor management.   I won't visit this place again even though I like the food and staff. If I have to wait 30 minutes for an available table (of many tables already available), I'll go somewhere else where I feel wanted.   Too frustrating.

rVBgFl8f5bIws_7rRpOJ0w.text: I have never had a bad experience at Double Wide. This place really shines in the summer, as there is outdoor seating with a great atmosphere. I've been here for brunch as well as lunch/dinner.  Recommendations:   Brunch -- DOUBLE WIDE BENEDICT. Quite possibly one of my favorite brunch dishes ever. Sweet, savory, DELICIOUS! A must try!  Lunch/ Dinner -- BBQ Pulled Porky - A great pulled pork sandwich, melt in your mouth good!  I've always thought that the prices here are a little high, but the food is good so if you have some extra cash to shell out, put this on your list of things to visit in the southside

85j4MrTntMVk7jRUDp_gog.text: I want to like this restaurant and I keep going back bc I keep thinking its going to get better and it just never does.  The atmosphere is fun and the outdoor seating is great.  The atmosphere is the only reason to go here.  Well, their beer list is pretty good too.  That's why they get 2 stars.  Also, they do have a lot of vegetarian and vegan options so if you've got a veg friend and they want some mediocre food, take them here.  Do not get hte cilantro lime dressing unless you want to have wretched breath all night.  I've always had good service here.  I know a lot of people say they've had some problems but the service has always been great.  Considering the amount of really beligerent drunks this place gets, they staff is always nice!

NLwRaX7O1Q7d7VBSpnJRlA.text: This place rocks!  The food is great, and the beer selection is very good.  It tends to get a little pricey, and given its South Side location it's not uncommon to have a bunch of somewhat rowdy college kids here and there.  Double Wide is great for groups with a wide range of dietary preferences, including vegan food and traditional (i.e. meat) BBQ.  There's something for everyone here!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Merry beermas!

WxeD2-KBC17j_nYNS4Jrtw.text: No complaints. Delicious vegan food, huge menu with great variety. Fun atmosphere and fast friendly service. Two thumbs up!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Devoured the vegan stroganoff!

VMRLwcpcRKbP4zDlsTwuxQ.text: Decent restaurant. However, the last time I went I did not receive my full order and they tried to make me happy by giving me a "discount" of $1.35. Additionally, the food I received was very mediocre.

mfpXE8emPBnA93CyB4A06w.text: Greta spot to check out if you're a fan of BBQ but also if you're looking for some alternative eats and are trying to dip your toe into throwing more veggies in the repertoire. They make the transition from meat to non-meat pretty seamless, and they have a kickass beer selection.

jVxbgjCzD5qGMIEP_dQhKw.text: I've had lunch here several times and was pretty impressed. I was there for dinner last night and ended up leaving after sitting for 2 hours and never getting service. I had to practically tackle the bar tender to get an iced tea. A little more organized table management needs to be incorporated. I was the only one who sat for a long time without service. I saw another guy chase a server down to get food after sitting for 40 minutes.  Good food, terrible service.

hCyiRj4q5MQm5nfsbGJjVQ.text: Best vegan food ever! The place was converted from  a service/gas station into a trendy restaurant. Cool vibe with covered outdoor seating as well as indoor (obviously). Our water Tim was great and very knowledgeable on the best vegan options.  Sorry I don't have food pics, ate it too fast. We had the seitan wings and the lentil aloha burger. WOW both were incredible!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

EzJoaCLlaBhqL8VQ7jQglQ.text: It's cool they have the dog area, but I just waited 1 hour to be told they messed up my order.  And came back to ask me what my order was.  Sitting an hour with puppy waiting and nothing going on, no food for her.  She is eating sticks.  Wtf.

yXm52U2OZTbAeRYZ63B9Kg.text: You'd think this would be a spot primarily for carnivores and you'd be right. However, their selection of vegan/vegetarian choices is shockingly wide. Great choices!   Sadly, service wasn't great. Only a couple customers at the bar, we waited to be seated but eventually seated ourselves because there were no staff to be found. Had to go to the bar to ask for menus, salad came out with no dressing, no salt and pepper on the table...just a series of annoying little stuff like that. Annoying as in you have to ask staff for these things but they disappear and can't be found for a long time.   Guessing that's why it was empty before and during the Steelers game which is a shame, this place used to always be packed. Here's to hoping that a few tweaks can be made because the food was great and the location makes parking much easier than some other South Side locations.

C2NKgCADqxsTKEwHgFo_Kw.text: Awesome wings , excellent fish sandwiches and fries.  Reasonably priced good beer and dog friendly outside area.  They also have karaoke night, and live music  on weekends (not all the time) frequently pet friendly or Focused events!    Tell the mayor PITTSBURGH should have more pet friendly venues!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

QcxaBbYDJaZXBBuleIHY0A.text: Decent food with some vegan food. The atmosphere is cool. Nice bar area too. The service  was slow though.

ouBvZD0GRYsjVt2bHVqe5A.text: Awesome service. Despite getting my grandma's order wrong, they got her food out within minutes of realizing their mistake. Plus the Pittsburgh scrambler was delicious!

2jP3aHlEmN5U6C6QWkEUBA.text: The only reason I'm giving 3 stars is because the food is always good and they have a dog patio. Other than that everything else is about one, maybe two stars. Only go here if you have over an hour to spend here. Every single time I've gone the service has sucked. The servers are always overwhelmed. Multiple times I've asked for things like ketchup, drink refills and even a beef patty for my dog that just never come. I usually have to get up and grab ketchup from someone else's table. All of these things have happened at least the past 4 times I've been there. There are only two people there that seem like they can actually handle it. They either need to staff more servers or hire better ones. I'm not sure why the services is so bad EVERY single time. And being that I am a server myself, this review is saying a lot. If the vegan food wasn't so good I would never go back.

G-kx5NCiiMgJ-NXRzPWHwA.text: Good food and outdoor dining area. 1/2 slab of ribs was great as was the cole slaw. Good beer selection with microbrews available. They had a section of the outdoor seating area reserved for diners with dogs, but unfortunately a big fight broke out between two of the canines which was a bit upsetting for everyone.

TSG_qgLMytjiv9xrxL2feA.text: First off I would like to say I am sad I have to give this place a 3 star review. The server was great at his job and was very accommodating. The menu is enormous, really it's far to big for the cook/s to have he time to prepaid everything fresh. I ordered the smoked ribs. The ribs were pretty over cocked, and were lacking in a smoky taste or really any taste. However they were ribs and even not great ribs are still good. The corn bread was great and the coleslaw was not great. All in all I will not be returning to the double wide grill nor would I recommend it to anyone.  I feel that the best thing the double wide grill could do for itself is simplify its menu, and give the cooks a chance to do their job.

bDNJNZUn53tUE1nvnbt0VQ.text: Let's see, 10min to be seated even with tons of open tables, ordered the rice balls and boneless wings and 40min later my bud just got his coke and still no food.    Understaffed and they just don't care about good service.  Other than that my Mtn bike ride was epic!

nE0l3LKoDUXlvwiQiQhVfw.text: Quick Review: Good food with surprisingly accessible menu (vegan, vegetarian, etc...) and great bar.   More Detail:  When I first tried Double Wide (probably 2009) I hated it. I thought the food was average at best and the service not great.   But after a long hiatus I tried it again and was pleasantly surprised (this was 2016). Now it's a favorite for our family.   I love the pulled pork and ribs, while my wife adores the brisket. I have also had their salads, burgers and sandwiches- all good. If you are indecisive try the TV dinner (build your own combo). All of the portions are huge (which is appropriate consid some meals are close to $20).  I find the appetizers to be hit or miss. Tonight we tried the buffalo dip (too much Bleu cheese for my taste). But I've enjoyed the nachos and wings previously.   The kids meals are a great deal. Drink, meal, side and dessert for $6? I like that!   Give it a shot for solid bbq and veggie/vegan options.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The &#34;Pig &#39;Aught&#34;.
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buffalo Dip.  (Blech! Bleu cheese)

JoPSb7WxT5kmhd0QBD3Jmg.text: They praised the ribs. So I tried. Worst rough crap ever. First and last time. I don't think they were cooked at all. This place is going downhill.

mWVUC0uQANVuv5tM-8UErg.text: They got very questionable staff at their Southside location.   The new dude that walks people to their table doesn't say anything to you and plops your menus on the table. Me and my bf (who is black also) went on a Sunday morning in April (after most students left) and most of the bar area was free but we were sat in the overflow indoor area...I've been there multiple times at busier times and gotten the bar area, window seats even, with my Italian friend. It wasn't until our bill racked up to about $50 did we get more attention. I loved this place but I really didn't appreciate the way we were greeted and seated.   Why seat 2 people at a 4-person table in the empty overflow indoor area away from the entrance when the priority bar area, which had seated customers and people coming in being seated there, had plenty seats available?   I worked restaurants before. All you have to do is offer the table and bus it if need be. It was a Sunday morning. Not busy at all.  And yes, we still tipped because we knew it wasn't our server's fault for the terrible seating in the back. It felt very racist. Haven't been there since.

xxxUgTDYO4uzTQQp9I8huQ.text: So it's not really fair to give them a 1 because we never got to eat there.....but I'm unimpressed.  Made a special trip there earlier today to eat outside at a place that welcomes pets. Got there and found that the "non dog" areas had umbrellas for shade and people waiting on the tables. Dog section had no shade and no one taking orders.  We got our menus and stood at the kiosk like the sign directed....15 minutes later as we're leaving someone finally came around...no thanks.

pU8fST5j18K75rhLfjOWLA.text: Really cool open-air spot (when the weather's nice enough). Built inside an old mechanic/garage, and if somehow you missed that from the outside, the decor inside makes the ties to automotive work impossible to miss (like the old truck suspended above the bar).  Good beer selection, and one of the absolute best vegan/vegetarian menus I've seen (note: I'm not vegan/vegetarian, but have enough friends who are that I try and keep an eye out for these things). Most places it feels like those options are tacked on as an afterthought, or that you're asking for something special with a list of substitutions to get a decent veggie option, but Double Wide has whole sections of the menu dedicated to it. On top of that, there's plenty of great non-veggie options as well so more carnivorous guests won't feel like they're stuck at some all-veggie place.

cz3xyxYooYWA94XEhNhUWA.text: We come here way often! The food is delish,  the team divine! Many options that don't include meat! Our server today, Desiree, was exceptionally patient and helpful, guiding us through the newer menu! The price is always right especially with coupons Groupons and  discounted gift cards from Costco!! Nice to have somewhere local to stop in for something healthy (or not - depending on mood) whenever the feeling strikes!!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

q5gle574_H9IN3T-Le10nQ.text: Good food and cool atmosphere, plus pupper friendly with their outdoor dog patio. The food was good and you won't get board waiting because they have, that's right, corn-hole and giant beer pong.

oj_MdNA14X8g3EOwZmpFLA.text: After two trips here in less than two weeks I'm highly disappointed based off my dining experience. The first time I come here with my girlfriend we ordered the vegan wings I got bbq and she the chipotle flavor. The wings came out cold, soggy and hardly covered with sauce on both of ours. Next we had side salads or house salads I can't remember exactly but they didn't seem fresh at all and the cornbread it came with tasted as if it's been sitting out and was steal. Next time I returned I brought a friend to show him all the vegan options offered. ((I didn't wanna let one bad time ruin it for me because I've been here once in the past and it was good. Honestly some of the best vegan wings I've had but I'm not sure after my last trip.)) So we go to order he likes what he sees we order sweet chili Wings to split then once we go to order our main course meal he mentioned having a soy allergy and everything is fried in soybean oil. And now the wings come out so I felt awkward being the only one eating cause they could have canceled the order and yet again there cold, soggy and hardly covered in sauce. So then turns out he can't really eat anything off the menu and the server is coming back and forth from the kitchen and finally someone came out to talk and the whole time that person stood next to us and talked to the server and the server repeated the same thing to us. The server said that was the chef so I'm just confused why she didn't talk directly to us. Next my friend ended up just getting grilled vegetables on a vegan bun. Like how sad is that that we came here to have a good business meeting dinner and he can't eat any thing he wanted cause the menu puts soy in almost everything or it's fried in it. so I had the vegan cheesesteak it looked so sad it hardly had any "meat" on it mostly all peppers and onions and sauce. It just disappointed me how bad the food and service has been and how I ended up spending over 35 bucks on nothing my last trip when all we had was a order of wings for happy hour grilled veggies and a vegan cheesesteak with two waters. I just don't think I'll be returning here again. I don't know if it's new cooks or new recipes or new ways of doing things or if the heat lights in the kitchen are terrible cause the foods cold but it's very off putting.

Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

hJz92PZO2PGczMe6qHVSlg.text: For a Friday night drink and snack, this place cannot be beat. Located inside of and on the driveway of an old gas station, this bar and restaurant offers a unique setting in a cool part of town. The staff are friendly and have a great sense of humor and they aren't afraid to engage in conversations with patrons.  The biggest thing this place has going for it is the happy hour. I was able to get two beers and some food for under $10! I don't know how this place stays in business with prices so low. They have an extensive beer and alcohol menu and I was very impressed with the meatless food menu. Most dive bars wouldn't go out of their way to cater to those with weird dietary choices but this place does and they deserve credit for that. I would highly recommend the satay hot wings.  Overall, I was very impressed with this bar and restaurant. If for no other reason, grab a quick beer to check out the wacky decor. I would highly recommend this place while on Pittsburgh's south side.

8VhfYh9RZCozbxLjNWxIAg.text: Only been here once before, and can't think of why everything was delicious burgers , Cuban sandwich and chicken salad . We will be back

ZSxVqtn6_lZWOkFSZ698yw.text: What a blessed weekend of wrong-turns this was! A birthday dinner with my parents and sister was due to close out the weekend... youtube.com/watch?v=gTCi... Once again, I was having difficulty choosing a restaurant. Dad doesn't like to go out to eat and insisted on getting takeout from a place relatively close to home. After mulling it over all day, I chose Double Wide Grill for 3 reasons 1) It's controversial, and I just hadda see what the hub-bub was about. 2) I'd been craving BBQ, and it became too late to order from Yinzburgh, my original choice, and Bloomfield would have been too far; Dad didn't wanna cross the Monongahela. Riding with Dad to and from DWG was harrowing, particularly when we got onto the PJ McArdle Roadway... youtube.com/watch?v=zUID... DWG's rustic trailer park motif was in full effect, so much so that I forgot I was within the city limits as I awaited the large sack of food... youtube.com/watch?v=0J3F... Yet the clientage was diverse. Tattooed punksters dined and drank alongside elderly folk and families. It was surprisingly quiet despite Carson Street's usual... youtube.com/watch?v=_adq... A burly, bald fella of my father's age with a Roaring 20's moustache and arms like an ironworker rang me up and sent me on my way... youtube.com/watch?v=Xns8... Before long 'twas... youtube.com/watch?v=MMM0... I started out with a cup of their mess hall-greasy chili, and based on my picture, you can see the oil rising to the top. Despite that fattiness of the broth, this chili was chock full of supple pork, onions, and other vegetables, and beans were at a minimum. This is the manner of chili one would expect at a place called the Double Wide Grill, and for the most part, I found it to be a richly flavorful pot of... youtube.com/watch?v=maMC... My dinner consisted of a beef brisket sandwich and something DWG calls "lug nuts"... youtube.com/watch?v=glIE... If homefries knocked up tater tots, you'd get this tuber bastard child, a shotgun weddin' happenin' beforehand no doubt. And I relished these golden, crispy, starchy spud nuggets. Also flaxen 'n flaky was Mum's dessert-ish cornbread that I was half-tempted to bury in whipped cream, vanilla ice cream, and strawberries after sampling. youtube.com/watch?v=ZMdU... Bessie's Best Bar-B-Q Brisket was a dream, and I wanted to take her for a cruise in a... youtube.com/watch?v=Jl3R... The brisket itself was steakhouse-prime. Juicy and thickly-cut, I drizzled the sugary liquid smoke of DWG's Memphis Sauce underneath Bessie's hot-buttered onion roll... youtube.com/watch?v=Qfnm... She was such the epitome of Southern goodness, I was doing the... youtube.com/watch?v=AYIq... Also filched from Mum was a few spoonfuls of her Creamy Cherry Cole Slaw that was as tasty, tangy, and toothsome as any I've ever had, the novel inclusion of cherries only furthering the picnic/cookout theme in the face of February's icy blues... youtube.com/watch?v=o7vF... Dad allowed me a bite of his St. Louis Ribs. Wood-grilled, dry-rubbed, cooked low 'n slow, and slathered-then-cauterized with a zesty Carolina sauce, one has to wonder if any of the depressed BBQ devotees in the area have honestly given DWG's pig a try... youtube.com/watch?v=KIXE... Frankly, it has me... youtube.com/watch?v=Ieel... The bones almost slid out of the meat itself which was so tender, my late grandfather could have eaten these sans dentures! Regardless, this yankee thought they were damn fine. I could also say the same about the pulled pork my mother allowed to me to inspect with my teeth and palate. I'll probably be told that I need to visit the South someday, which I'd like to do, and I doubt I'd be disappointed, but damn it if we don't have some very good BBQ up North, DWG serving as a fine example... youtube.com/watch?v=Y4pO... If Kinky Friedman were to be reincarnated as an appetizer, he'd be the Reuben Egg Rolls. Like Gullifty's Crispy Reuben, this is a fun, cracklin', and delectable deep-fried take on an urban deli standard with its insulated, steamed corned beef, Swiss cheese, and sauerkraut almost evaporating on your tongue. Tell ya what, parboiled fat does somethin' to a Reuben, especially when its served with a dynamite chipotle-infused ranch dressing... youtube.com/watch?v=iKv_... I dunno gang, I see no reason why I shouldn't give Double Wide Grill a 5. The grub was mouthwatering, the ambience and decor is a blast, the service was smooth, and they have a vegan menu, shattering stereotypes by injecting Bohemia with a beneficial dose of... youtube.com/watch?v=3Ohk...
