Ax4KkOPUiq24MDxUK6M9SQ.text: Something for everyone!  Vegan to Carnivores. Great food and drink options with friendly service.

PBf3mZGGzjcQtfXxtST9cQ.text: Always good food and great service here! We love the seitan wings and the pulled seitan sandwich. The vegetarian TV dinner never disappoints and the beer choices are the best! I did a flight of beers the last time we were here. Unlike your local brew pubs, you can sample from 40 or more fun choices of brew. We have been enjoying their menu since they opened. They consistently deliver fun, creative food and drink.

fJu-XWO9kWfpQ6I5AzysZw.text: This place is kinda becoming a make-shift reunion spot with my friends every time I visit Pittsburgh. It satisfies (well, more than satisfies) everyone from the hardcore carnivores, broccoli chomping vegetarians, grass fed bisons and vegans such as myself.  I got the "Vegyro" (sounds so sexual) the last time I stopped in topped off with some tangy Margaritas... really good! Our waitress was cool as hell!  (Can't remember her name :/ but... it was Friday night, March 22, 2013 about 7:30pm, back corner booth. 5 adults and one bad-ass baby boy!)  Ehem... management,.. she should be commended / given a monetary prize if you can figure out who it was.  The whole back side of the menu is for vegans... this place is in "french-fries-and-fried-eggs-on-everything-pierogi-happy" Pittsburgh?!   Terrific beer selections, really friendly staff, and a comfortable atmosphere in my favorite section of town, South Side.  Why 4/5 stars? I'm strictly basing it on deliciousness I've had every time I've been in there. Not over the top "You SOOO need to go!", but definitely recommended.

KjsYQCCWjmqgPB7fkRptgA.text: I really like the double wide. That being said, it doesn't get 5 starts, because I have had some bad experiences there (plural). Their veg menu is awesome. The veg faux chicken wings are to-die-for! Most everything I have tried there was good, and their brunch has some interesting and delish veg options.   That being said, I have had Turrible T-u-r-r-i-b-l-e service there more than once, and from different waiter/waitresses. They don't really seem to care if you need anything or want anything, and even when you ask, sometimes you don't get. I have also had food come out two shades gray of luke warm and then come back definitely microwaved, yet still delish...  Overall, if you have time to wait and tons of patience (or are drunk) go there, they have good food and beer. If you are in a bad mood or rushed, skip it.

qpAURwkkr4-d-iVEtUmntw.text: Had the tv dinner and loved it. Tried the coconut rum tilapia and it was on point. I will have to go back for the brisket after 5pm since they slow roast it all day. I enjoyed the alcohol beverages and the service was great. Costco has gift cards so you can get more bang for your buck. I saw mixed reviews on this place but I'm glad I tried it. I really enjoyed it and look forward to returning soon.

YKoaEzdCamsmyg4YhmC-Bw.text: The worst experience ever.   Ended up with food poisoning.     Dirty place.    Go next store to Applebee's    This isn't the first time someone got sick there either.

dT7ILsO3mnHT-M2YsluozA.text: Service was HORRIBLE on a Friday night. Waited over an hour for our food and it came out cold and looked very unappetizing. When we asked the waitress what happened she was very dismissive and rude. Fortunately the manager was really nice and took care of the check. This is the second time I've dealt with bad service here and I won't be going back. Too pricey for what you get.

JAdL47HwVOrZ6_w7UPm4zg.text: I've been here 2 times now and really haven't been impressed with this place at all. I tried really hard to like it since it's my friend's favorite restaurant, but just haven't enjoyed any of the food. I tried a fish dish here the first time (wish I could remember exactly what it was) and the most recent trip I had the BBQ pulled pork sandwich which was decent but definitely not impressive. If it were up to me I wouldn't choose to go back, but my friends love it.  Why they love it - a couple reasons, it does have a good vegan/vegetarian menu (clearly I don't fall in that category based on my menu choices above) but they said its really good for vegans/vegetarians. Also, they have the outside patio which is nice for dogs!  Overall it's a good atmosphere, but I just don't like the food.

bwhUnem4jMXWcT_t7aQ8NA.text: This place is a hit or miss with the food. I've stopped coming here because you just never really know if it will be amazing or terrible.

nB15Ufv0a3BAJK7qbzThYg.text: The food here is ok, nothing stellar. On my last visit we ordered wings and while the sauce was great, the wings themselves were VERY dry. All in all, it's ok bar food. Be warned though, if you are going for karaoke, it NEVER starts on time and there are guaranteed to be some technical issues along the way. I gave the review a three though because the karaoke is (of course) outsourced and not directly the restaurant...but I don't know how they haven't changed vendors for karaoke night yet...

o-7sY73OLbH_rLXD9_koMA.text: I've been in here quite a few times and I really do enjoy this spot.  I've had a couple things that were so-so, but the things that are great are reaallly great! They've got some of the best nachos I've ever had; the cheese has a good kick to it and the chicken I add is always hot.  I also like the build your own tv dinner.  I get mashed potatoes, fruit, and the ribs [whomever I'm with picks the other stuff].  Soo good! The ribs are always tender and moist with a good amount of bbq sauce.  I'm typically a carnivore but my vegetarian and vegan friends swear by their vegan menu!  As for drinking, I typically get the Blue's Bathtub Tea which I believe is like a long island but with raspberry things instead of tea. Delicious!  Booze is a pretty reasonable price and they've got a lengthy list of beers on tap and bottle.  Everyone has their off nights, but most of the time the service is spot on, friendly and attentive.   Overall, I would recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Best. Nachos.  Ever.
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Portion sizes are perfect!

BOqNMOqESuLWIKrwd3ZRxQ.text: Double Wide always seems like a good option but I've never had it where everything was as good as I hoped it would be. My most recent experience there was after an exhausting bike trip and me and a few girlfriends stopped to fuel up. I ordered a shrimp salad that was awesome. The shrimp was blackened and cooked perfectly. The corn and avocado were great and the dressing was tasty. This was the first time I was excited about something I have ordered from Double Wide. Unfortunately, we had met one of the husbands who brought a dog. Double Wide has a dog area, which is wonderful, but I just don't understand the service. You are supposed to walk up to a counter area and order, which is fine, but it's almost impossible to get someone's attention to order.  I will probably go again but i will sit somewhere  where the waitress actually comes up to the table.

khCL4RhkZLdgFnla_CMvvQ.text: This place has really gone down hill. We are Never going back. If you want to enjoy you night out with a good meal go somewhere that cares about their customers. Service is awful! Second time of bad service there will not be a third

3oENP70jbe-UsQjoedtIRQ.text: A couple of things I liked right away: Outdoor seating, open-air bar, automobile-related decor, huge TVs with sports, and getting seating as soon as we walked in. Also, as soon as I picked up the menu, I noticed that, in addition to the huge variety of regular diner/pub fare, DWG also has options for kid's, gluten-free, vegan, and vegetarian. Pretty impressive.  I started with an order of the Tijuana Rice Balls (Arborio rice, sun-dried tomatoes, black beans, melted cheddar cheese, chili pepper seasoning; Panko breaded and deep fried; Served with chipotle ranch). Although they were some of my favorite ingredients, they were also fairly bland on the seasoning and a little greasy. The dipping sauce was decent.  For my entree, I had a pulled pork, bacon, black beans, and pineapple salsa wrap. The Carolina vinegar-based BBQ sauce was tangy - and the pork was moist - but, on the whole, I didn't think the burrito was that special.  Unfortunately, our service was really slow (though friendly); and, I thought the bill was a bit much for the quality of food. Also, on a side note, my son's chicken tenders were little more than soggy breading and frozen chicken - and his fruit was old melon and pineapple...not really the kind of fruit most kids enjoy.  Overall, I'd say if you're stuck in the South Side with your kids or a large group, then you might consider the DWG. Otherwise, I don't think it's worth the visit.

shVIauRkw2jMb-UQRrdy6A.text: Incredible. Plenty of choices for vegans and vegetarians. Even choices for carnivores. I had the veggie Philly cheesesteak sandwich. Great and filling. They even have a separate fryer just for vegans. Service? Never had better. A must when visiting Pittsburgh, only wish there was one in a Southern California.

UHUCjleTGf27a7UA2qhfbw.text: The lentil burger was bland and didn't come with any toppings. Usually, a burger would come with lettuce, tomato, some kind of ketchup mustard or sauce...not this one. The vegan wings were square chunks of seitan that had a great taste but not for the price especially since seitan is literally flour and water. Overpriced and underwhelming.

JIc_Y-qFQMNhQ619sV-Q2Q.text: While visiting my brother up in Pittsburgh, we needed a good after-workout meal. He is pretty carnivorous and I'm vegan. A little bit of scrolling around on Yelp, I found the DWG, which wasn't far from my brothers apartment. The menu looked very accommodating for both of us.  I am very pleased we gave this place a try. There were so many good options for both of us. I got the seitan wing-bits and the vegan gyro. The house hot sauce is very good. A little bit of heat with a little vinegary zing. The gyro was loaded with all kinds of good stuff. My brother also said his meal was very good. They had a nice big beer menu too, with a lot of brews I recognize and even some I didn't. Though, since we just got done exercising, drinking wasn't on the agenda.  The waiter was plenty nice and attentive. Though, being as it was only about 15 degrees out, the place was kind of empty. The interior design is pretty cool, kind of a throw back to classic cars and gas stations.  If I lived in Pittsburgh I would visit place often. They pretty much have something for everyone here.

f8faHC9zp3D41ZMi0FRQJg.text: Food , service , bartenders and drink .. all 3rd level

DaLIsDPEi4jchmeaERgd7g.text: It is hard for me to rate a place that I frequent simply because I live right by it, so I am trying to look at this from the perspective of me not living so close.    I like the general atmosphere especially the patio which  is always awesome on a beautiful day... however, I do not know about the service.  I always feel like I am putting my server or bartender out when I am asking for something.  Why be in the service industry if you do not want to be even slightly attentive to your tables?  I can understand if they are short staffed, but it never seems that way.  If you are in a hurry, I do not suggest coming here when they are remotely busy as even something simple can take quite awhile.    The food is average... nothing to write home about, but not bad either.  Good beer selection and some unique good drinks too.

HFqdj-cMAshAhUL1uFQyuQ.text: Let me start off my saying that this place is just plain cool. My friend and I were in Pittsburgh for work, and wanted dinner. We set out waking down Carson Street unsure where we would dine. Our eyes were drawn to this restaurant in a converted gas station. While it is not longer a place to get gas, it is a great place to have a meal. We are outside, and the outside space is a great place to watch the world go by. Service was prompt and out server was able to answer every question we had about the menu. She really made us feel very welcome. I opted for chicken, coleslaw and sweet potato fries. Everything was very very good. As someone who travels a lot, I am especially to sensitive to how welcoming restaurants are, and this place definitely welcomes its guests. Thank you for a great meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Hy7ZQ1CvCViGDPgCgHGoKg.text: The stars I gave are for the seitan wings alone. You really can't beat them! I used to love coming to Double Wide Grill. However, I was super disappointed on my most recent visit when I saw that their once-very-extensive menu had changed to a simple one pager, and that a lot of my boyfriend and I's favorite menu items were no longer there.  The two things about Double Wide that made it unique in my opinion were the cheddar grits side, and the create your own TV dinners. Neither of those are on the regular menu anymore! Cheddar grits are only available for brunch now, and replacing the create your own TV dinner option is a few preset TV dinner entrees with, of course, no substitutions. It was really upsetting to see that the only vegetarian TV dinner was very obviously made with the cheapest side options (fries, broccoli) instead of the more unique options that you used to be able to choose from.  We were disappointed with the menu changes and expressed that a bit to our waitress, nothing over-the-top or dramatic. But she very noticeably ignored us for the rest of our meal, only checking on us once after we flagged her down, while she made sure to check on the table next to us multiple times. The disappointing menu changes and poor service makes me sad to say that this isn't the Double Wide that I once adored for their vegetarian and vegan options, and I'm not sure if I'm going to be back.

GcW9iME2K4uG-LXXKFnVog.text: A couple of my friends and I stopped in here for a break during one of our weekend bike rides. It's really accommodating for bikers, with a bike rack outside, and a whole bike maintenance station!  There are a bunch of tables outside. You can bring your dogs out on the patio and they have water bowls readily available for your pet. We chose to sit inside though because we wanted a break from the heat.  It wasn't crowded inside (or outside for that matter), so we were seated right away. Our server was extremely friendly and attentive. Our waters never got more than half empty before she filled them back up.  Our food was delicious. I got the Cali-forn-i-a salad with lemon cilantro dressing. It was perfect for a summer afternoon. Everything was really fresh and the dressing wasn't too sweet. I would come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bike maintenance station
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cali-forn-i-a salad

maL1z5CFzsdUiN5QUa96Ig.text: Mixed bag here with Double Wide grill. They have a big menu with BBQ options, appies, vegetarian, and sandwiches. We got an order of boneless wings which were nice and crispy, tender on the inside, and came with good buffalo sauce. We also got a pulled pork platter. The pork was not super flavorful, but the fries were great (skin still on) and it came with a nice serving of cole slaw.  They also have a large drink menu with many beers on tap. My girlfriend got a good sour beer.  Some other reviews on here have mentioned the service and I also found it slow. We went on a Saturday night but it wasn't too crowded. Still our server had a bit of an annoyed attitude and our food took nearly a half hour to come out. Not great.  They have a nice large patio area which can open up to the inside seating area when the weather is nice. I could see that being a good setting for happy hour and/or just a nice outdoor meal. I went during a July heat wave so the patio was pretty empty.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Boneless wings with Buffalo sauce
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pulled pork platter

oKQ-oWr8dKNMP8l-fLfKDw.text: Passed this restaurant a million time and never thought about trying it until wifey looked them up on yelp and wanted to give them a try. I was pleasantly surprised!! The food and service were pretty good. We will definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

0TUCL26nVOPGavPyv57jMg.text: The Double Wide Grill is always a good stop when you're in South Side. This restaurant is very fun in the summer as it provides a lot of outdoor seating and is dog friendly! The wait staff is always speedy and attentive, the food is delicious and reasonably priced, and the atmosphere is inviting. This is a great stop for friends or families of all ages.   I ordered the beyond burger with sweet potato fries and a side of vegan cheese dip. It was a perfect portion. I love how friendly this restaurant is for dietary restrictions. Additionally, I joined their birthday list. This means, on your birthday, you get up to $15 towards any entree. Great deal!! Aside from all of the food, Double Wide Grill also has an extensive drink menu worth trying out. I absolutely recommend this place to anybody!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beyond Burger with Sweet Potato Fries and Vegan Cheese

kIplbI18cX5OdGHwypfubw.text: I was neither terribly impressed nor overly disappointed by Double Wide. I'd consider it a solid option to get food which is neither mediocre nor outstanding.  Perhaps the most annoying aspect of my visit was learning that certain menu items - namely the brisket and Cuban sandwiches - are not available until 5 & 2 pm respectively. The explanation I was given was that those items "take, like, y'know, all day to prepare". Cool. Really wish the menu available through Maps had noted that as I'd gotten to the restaurant around 1:50 pm and had specifically chosen it after running a quick search for convenient barbecue spots.  Allow me to be clear: I don't think Double Wide qualifies as a barbecue joint; certainly at least not a quality one. The menu is varied and quite inclusive of vegetarian options, but considerably lite on barbecue options. I've learned my lesson on that score and certainly won't be take to sate my brisket fix.  Service wasn't great - took my asking multiple times to receive a glass of water - but also wasn't horrid - I received exactly what I'd ordered, and was checked on a few times.  Overall, Double Wide is...an option. It won't wow you, but it also shouldn't wooow you.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

EH3-Jys0EytH0OvLBwilIQ.text: I just recently ate here with my boyfriend and I ordered something different this time I went, I ordered the smothered chicken and it was so good I'm glad I decided to try something new. They have so many options on their menu it was hard to decide what to order. We had excellent service, this is a great bar when there is nice weather out and you can even bring your dog!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

KkND2qWeVnZE-lETG1GaPQ.text: This was my first time at Double Wide since becoming a vegan and I cannot wait to go back! I got the vegan gyro and it did not disappoint! The portion size was right on and the fries were incredible.   We went for lunch on a lovely Friday afternoon. The outside was steady but not overly busy or crowded. I tried to see how many servers there were, as ours was forgetful and not very attentive. There were at least 2 other servers. He may have had tables inside, idk? But, not bad enough for me to not want to go back!

Q0eCjtiDdC9QxL0oDfPIqw.text: A decent spot in the South Side. The big draw for me to this place is their outdoor seating, they have tons of it though the patio space is kind of a cluttered mess and Carson Street can be chaotic to sit next to. I went here for the tail end of happy hour (5-7) but was disappointed that they only offer it at the bar, I hate when places do that. The service was okay, our waitress was very patient with the toddler that was with our group. They had a carseat holder for the 4-month-old with us which was very much appreciated. They have a large menu and prices are reasonable if not a little on the higher side for what you get. I had the BBQ Pulled Porky sandwich though turned it into a wrap. It was fine, the sauce was the best part. Overall, I'd say it's worth a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. BBQ Pulled Porky

i67HkOmNyexBvdbSHYseGA.text: They have a special frying area for the vegetarian food so yay! Tried the waiter suggested vegetarian burger with sweet potato fries and some grilled vegetables on the side, sat out on a warm breezy oct afternoon and it was just lovely. It was such a perfect Saturday lunch. Just a word of warning - go with a big appetitie :) The burger was tasty, looks something like Jumbo mac but  bigger!  With so many eating options on the E Carson street, this definitely deserves one visit or more...

nuvfaIgzdk0_abmtjz8Jrw.text: They recently changed their dog patio to a random uneven cement sidewalk with about 5 tables on top of one another. We tried to take our dog last week but we were literally on top of the family next to us and had to leave. I have always been a fan of double wide but we only came here with our dog and that is no longer an option. I unfortunately  no longer see us coming back :(

-K3_re2abSIiDlZDsxDKug.text: What a cool spot!  Appears to have been a service station at one point but has been renovated nicely.  Has a great patio with the garage doors that lead into the dining room.  Big bar area as well.  Our server was sweet and helped us choose from their massive menu.  We arrived on a Saturday morning about 11:15 and were immediately seated.  We had the choice of their brunch or lunch menu, but were looking for breakfast.  I had an Irish coffee, which was strong as hell (happy girl) while my husband and friend had beer.  I had the Trucker breakfast with over easy eggs, seriously good bacon, potatoes and corn bread.  Husband had the  Two 2 To Too with eggs, canadian bacon, pancakes (with sugar free syrup) and rye toast.  Our friend had the eggs benedict, which looked fantastic!  All of their items are inexpensive yet large portions.  So sad we live out of town as I'd dine here a LOT!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cool ceiling
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

T0PWeGwtdlQWkbo5MJS7Vw.text: Maaaan . I ordered the Vegan Seitan Cheesesteak, which was in reality bbq seitan, grilled peppers/onions , and vegan mayo . ( the server said she keeps telling them they need to change the description) All that aside , it was delicious . Too bad I'm from out of town , because I'd definitely eat here again . ( I will if I ever return to the area ) Loved the decor too!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegan Seitan Cheesesteak

Gs-pqPSpvsLv_oEfzbC8jg.text: Not one to leave negative reviews, but this is well deserved. Actual terrible service and wait time... server had to return twice to let us know ordered menu items weren't available. After third attempt, we had to put order in to go and three tables seated after us had received food and eaten before ours was brought out. Waited 45 minutes, haven't even tried the food yet but even if it's amazing, wont be convincing enough to return.

KVNZY2AwD0MBqwvI1zz5Kg.text: This is really a 1/2 star, but couldn't choose it. The only good thing is that it was dog friendly, kinda of. I've worked as a waiter before so I always give places the benefit of the doubt when it comes to service. This place took over an hour to receive our food. I feel like the only reason we got our food was because I asked for the check and it to go because it was taking too long. Food quality was sub par and    my date and I were checked on like every 20 mins. It was just lame af.

OXjs2JfaXlbIDApN8-REmw.text: My review is mainly for our bartender we had on Sunday afternoon on 3/10/19, I wish I remembered her name. All I can recall is her long braids and super cute smile. She was super friendly and really felt like I was at a friends house due to her service. I've never came here just for the bar until today where it was one of the only open on this end of Carson on Sunday afternoon. Her attentiveness and friendliness made the day drinking just perfect. Good beers on tap and nice rather empty bar - great time to come.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

2_GGv-keLCNReC8fQ5-7xA.text: Came here for the vegan options.  Had the vegan wings which were so so.   The veggie burger was also average.  There is lots of outdoor seating which is nice on a summer day.  Good selection of beers.  We sat at the dog section which is separate from the rest of the restaurant. There is no table service, you have to go pick up your food when you sit in the pet friendly area.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

fjNdfjDmbI5NohgZCSq3Bg.text: I really loved this place! Two friends and I stopped in on a Saturday afternoon on a beautiful day and had a great time! They've got a large outdoor seating area that is dog friendly, and are designed to look like an old auto garage (which was very neat). They have an excellent beer list and extensive menu which has quite a lot of vegetarian and vegan options. I opted for the Aloha Burger (vegan sandwich with a lentil patty that was so good I can't stop talking about it, pineapple, arugula, and their Texas bbq sauce) served with excellent fries. My roommate went for the Reuben sandwich and said it was one of the best he'd ever had. It was really a fun stop and I definitely recommend.

r7A8gtmm1oD7e4zqjp8HlQ.text: The food here is simply delicious... If they have it in stock. I visited on a Sunday and after my waitress told me my first two intems were sold out, I started to wonder. The saving grace was the quality of the food. The ribs are very delicious!   I went back another time for brunch and I was super impressed! It wasn't what I thought it would be. Great brunch menu items. The French toast is amazing. It came with 3 large slices and a side of cheesy grits.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. French toast for brunch with a side of cheesey grits

FPa-hDcj4vymN__C-963BQ.text: I've been to the Double Wide Grill several times and have had mixed experiences, however, I went this past Saturday with my parents and it was a home run.  We started with the crab black bean fritters - very tasty appetizer.   The draft selection was decent with a good list of seasonal craft brews.  For dinner, I had the meatloaf special with a side of mashed potatoes and a fantastic large piece of broccoli cooked to perfection.  My mom had the brie and portabella mushroom and my dad opted from the pulled pork sandwich.  No complaint from either of them. Service was fast and attentive.  We were there at an off time - around 4:30 PM on a Saturday so it wasn't crowded, however, the staff was all great.

g6CY1MqmbMz0qYtED_ISVQ.text: Excellent food and attentive service!  First time here but I will be back.  Tried the wings, the ribs, the pulled pork - all excellent, especially the ribs! They fall off the bone, not fatty, tender, flavorful!! I LOVE the Carolina BBQ sauce!!! The sides were great too.  I had the creamy cherry cole slaw, cheesy grits, sweet potato fries and yummy cornbread - all delicious.  It is a fun automotive theme atmosphere.   We came here with about 20 people and they did a great job for us!  Thanks guys!!

ITHVNkZkIDFEPYwIWqLTmQ.text: I like to talk about an appetizer that is sheer ingenious and so delicious! A Reuben Roll! When I saw this on the Menu! I was so curious! When it came out I was like..... Great choice! You have to try this! It's enough for a meal if you  include some fries!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Reuben Roll with a side of dressing! PERFECT!

3bwxy6nbSVh6Eny6HDKJrQ.text: We had a great time. Although it was a big menu, it offered a fantastic selection of food and beer for whatever mood you were in. The bar staff was friendly and helpful and we enjoyed ourselves for a quick bite and brew. A definite fun spot and we loved the three legged dog t-shirts!

gPKnfrWnnLr4VgG_Rn_diQ.text: Neat little niche kinda place. Parking sucks but it's Pittsburgh. Nachos were good but the Chili that stated no beans was more like a stew. Kinda disappointed :(

hjc24bwJU6ELXLGvoU_T2Q.text: The barbecue and grilled foods is great. I would avoid most appetizers except for the wings. Overall the food is good but sometimes the service isn't the greatest when it's busy.

25tir_KLzJ83JGxSGCjHSw.text: Just a shout out to Double Wide for having such a fantastic vegetarian selection.  People, it's a barbecue joint--if they can make a whole page of vegetarian choices, how is it that I go to top-scale restaurants and they only have a token vegetarian risotto (if even that)?    Food, service, location--all great.  Thank you, Double Wide Grill!

d39XnzmIjwwp9nKUMuXmcg.text: Came here late on a Thursday night, and our server was SO attentive (granted we were the only party there). Only beer on tap and food from the deep frier were available - but um, what else would I want late at night in South Side?? So bring it on!  We got hot and also barbecue seitan "wings" with blue cheese dressing, and loads of raw veggies. The seitan plates were pretty small, but clearly delicious, because we devoured all of it. Even the obligatory celery sticks.  They have a pretty solid beer menu, and the wait staff wear the most charming grease-monkey one-piece suits. It sounds like I'll have to return in summer to get some of that outdoor seating.

z6w-DxUDU3X14C59gmFyYA.text: The Double Wide Grill is the place to get decent food and a couple drinks. They have a huge outdoor patio and they even have a part that you can bring your dog. They have tons of drinks available and offer the redneck refrigerator which is a cooler for your table filled with ice cold beer.

gJpnFrY1EhEe6iTu4ZHXrw.text: I like the concept of a garage-turned restaurant, I like the ample outdoor seating, I like that there is an area that I can take my dog to chill with us while we dine. I've just never really been thrilled by the food.  Most recently, we had burgers that were all over-cooked, dry, and a little difficult to finish.  The fries were ok, but nothing special.  Similar feedback for my hubby's buffalo chicken salad.   If I find myself there again...lets face it, I probably will as its a cool spot to hang out...I think I will opt for the vegan/vegetarian choices, which always get good reviews, to see if these are more pleasing to the palate.

DqAlv-M-s_mq3bJYOkxm-w.text: The only reason this place gets a star is because I liked their sauces.   This place seemed really dirty. There was a section to bring your dogs. Thanks for the ticks.   THE SERVICE SUCKS! We were there for 25 minutes before getting our drinks. Then after we sat down, another couple was seated and ordered after us and got their appetizer and meal before we got our appetizer. The waitress seemed to be zeroed out, so that's what she got on the tip section of the check, a big ZERO. Just because your waiting on me doesn't mean I have to tip you. Tipping comes from being satisfied with your experience. Sorry but I'm not sorry. Definitely won't be back. Seemed kinda trashy.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

SdS142UaONUNC7sxznvo0Q.text: I am giving this place 5 stars for a few reasons: excellent service, fun atmosphere, and good bar/pub food. We had my boyfriend's 40th birthday party here on karaoke night (great party idea!)...I was able to reserve a spot for 25 in the karaoke room and put up decorations, they even played happy birthday on the big screen. The manger Justin was super accommodating and our waiter Alec was perfect, he really made the night!! This place is a super fun night out, highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Table for 25!

RnzaqD9nivuMgjiu-cH8HA.text: I met a friend and her family for lunch at Double Wide. They got their first and decided to sit outside. . It was almost 90 degrees. Our waitress was great and kept refilling our drinks. I kept it simple and ordered a cheeseburger and a cup of fruit. I ordered the burger medium. When my burger cam there was a very thin line of pink and it was only a degree or two from being well done. If you've read my reviews you know my belief is basic menu items should be cooked perfectly. That's the foundation of every plate you make. I was very bummed that my burger was overcooked. It is rare that I send food back. I usually just cross it off my list of places to go. Consider this one 'd off.

xCdJzfEcaK81vrZfurFJZA.text: This was the first real meal sit down meal on our recent trip to Pittsburgh. We were thrilled to discover that Double Wide Grill had lots of vegetarian/vegan options and was just a short walk from the Holiday Inn Express we were staying at.  Double Wide Grill is a fun diner style restaurant with a car/gas station theme. There was a beer chandelier directly above our table. I didn't get a photo of the outside of the restaurant, but it had a nice outdoor area where dogs can hang out too!  We ordered a full order of the seitan wings ($9.79) with Cletus' signature hot sauce. It also came with ranch dressing and some veggies. This was quality seitan. Very tender. We gobbled it up really quickly. I'm not one to shy away from junk food, especially when I'm on vacation.   We also shared the BBQ Pulled Seitan ($9.29), which was delicious! The multi grain vegan bread was perfect with the seitan. It wasn't stringy like pulled pork, but was sliced into thin, tender strips and had a good texture. Good stuff.  For beer, I got the Thirsty Dog Old Leghumper. It was a tasty American Porter that paired well with all the seitan, but let's be honest, I clearly ordered it just so I could say that I've had a beer called Leghumper!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. BBQ pulled seitan sandwich
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Seitan wings with Cletus&#39; signature hot sauce

Ae-2W12SFrOXkr0dnYh_JA.text: Great causal place for vegetarians and vegans.   Veggygyro was tasty with right amount of spice.   Coleslaw with cherries was different and very good,   Fabulous staff especially Kea (Kia?).  Attentive. Made sure all orders were right.  Very personable and knowledgeable about the foods.   Efficient, pleasant service.   Good choices of beers.

CW6Km2hJ_18x7-Oog9do5Q.text: I've been here for the regular lunch/dinner menu and it's been good every time. The brunch, however, is out if this world. I've been meaning to try it for awhile, but an about-to-expire Groupon finally got me there early on a Sunday. I've heard great things about the brunch but was also told he can get busy and crowded so I made sure to be there when they opened at 10am. Definitely worth the wait.   It was a tough decision, but I rightly chose the beef chili omelet. It will definitely get me back. The menu has tons of options, including several vegetarian choices.  Service was also good and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beef Chili Omelet

8ujRhVa056RkjiZfq-e17A.text: I love this place. The atmosphere is pretty cool, kinda has a old car garage look and they turned it into a restaurant. The outside patio is nice too. Plenty of seating and they even have a dog patio which I think is amazing. Don't worry it is another section outside in case you don't want someones dog around your food.   Each time I have been there I had the Tijuana balls. They are amazing I love them. I also had grilled veggies appetizer. It was good, big slices of veggies but that's not an issue for me. My first time there I had the pulled pork sandwich and have to say I was not a fan of the BBQ sauce. To me it only tasted like vinegar.  The drink selection was also great I was impressed. There are pictures of each drink which is something I really enjoyed, as I am a visual person.  Overall I had a good experience and would definitely go back.

dkTF6qV3yia3c6tY5GSyKw.text: This is another place I'm not quite sure how I went so long without reviewing. I always enjoy a trip to Double Wide when the weather is nice. Sitting outside on their patio drinking a Corona almost makes me feel like I'm at the beach. Whether you have a big group, or your only getting dinner or drinks for two, there's a seat for you on the patio.   Double Wide's menu has a huge selection. And don't be turned off by the fact they specialize in BBQ if you're vegetarian. There's a full two pages of vegetarian option on the menu. Despite all these options though, many times when I'm there, I always end up turning back to my favorite meal, the Porky Pineapple Burrito. I love love love their pulled pork. If you do get a BBQ'd item, it's good to know that they serve their BBQ sauce on the side. I think this is nice because some people like their meat lightly sauced while others like a lot of sauce. But if you're expecting it to be all in one it can be a little different.  The service is friendly There have been times I've waited a little longer than normal for food, but when I'm sitting outside enjoy whatever I'm drinking I really don't mind so much. Certainly one of my go-to's on the Southside!

MEr6Z9hoo4o3N_GAJQpKGQ.text: I really want to like this place since it's around the corner from my house and I love BBQ. But I have never I repeat never had a good meal here and the service is chronically slow.   Only thing they have going is an excellent patio that fills up fast when the weather is right

G5zIK_1TE7YHQOTNAaep2Q.text: They have a pretty nice menu. You can get something for everyone which is huge plus! They also have a fairly good kids menu compared to other places and give children more options than french fries and chicken fingers.  Every time we come here are food is served fairly quickly. I usually get the pulled pork platter and their bbq sauces are AWESOME, it's probably why I rated this place so high, just on the sheer deliciousness of those sauce alone. They go great with french fries or one of the meat selections (pulled pork, ribs, brisket, etc.  I love that fact that they have a doggie patio for the pet parents. I don't have a pet but it's nice to know thats one of the few restaurants who offer that option in the summer.   The drink selections are also nice. We have opposite taste buds, I like my drinks more on the refreshing side, light, lots of fruits and berries, smooth, etc,  He likes his beverages strong, dark, with very rich flavor, etc, and we are always able to find a good drink to fit us both.   It is slightly overpriced, nothing too outrageous. I think the last time we went here we spent over $60 for 2 adults and one child. I say "slightly" because you do have to factor in the amount for 2 beers and a mixed drink.   Overall this place is pretty good. They get the stars mainly for the bbq sauce selection, the tender perfectly cooked brisket, and the optional outdoor seating in the summer months where you have the option to bring your pet.

1KDR4e5RRxJngkQbQq6bIA.text: I would give this place 5 stars, but their soda is weird and some off brand that tastes like crap and the hostess with the bad perm and blue eyeshadow is incredibly rude. So sorry to disrupt your important text conversation and make it so that you actually had to seat someone. That being said, the food is amazing. The seitan wings are the best that I've ever had, the potato tacos are delicious and the BBQ pulled seitan is soooo good. I will definitely be back the next time that I am in town!

QGvPqBq5csfWkyhA6QkUqA.text: The ONLY reason they are getting more than 1 star is for their brunch...  Otherwise, their dinner menu and service are mediocre if not completely unsatisfactory.    Needless to say, there are 2 reasons to go to the Double Wide Grill:   1. Brunch: Their breakfast is well worth the lack of service   2. Vegetarians: If you need to satisfy a vegetarian palette, there are many options and a lot of them are even good.

aR4NFC2mm9e3Nl9_yPF9DQ.text: DONT GET THE RIBEYE.  Decided to try the special which has been posted on the outside of the restaurant for several  weeks which was the 12oz ribeye steak.  I don't think I've had anything  as bad steakwise since ponderosa closed.  The texture of the meat was spongy and there was so much gristle it was difficult to cut.  The only discernable flavor was a slight smokey taste.  It was truly terrible.

YkoaCcXWlFJfTLJkM0QjTw.text: Amazing seitan wings!  Doublewide is a fun party restaurant with great variety of gourmet food rich in flavor.  It's so nice to see so many clearly labeled vegetarian and vegan options on their menu.  Everything we ate exceeded our expectations.  The only disappointments were the absence of vegan desserts, and the noise level of the restaurant was very loud in the main garage.  The bar section was actually much quieter. But being a party restaurant that's exceptionally fun themed, one shouldn't expect this type of place to be quiet.

byS8FI0OaxXl9nZLUtrZ4A.text: Been to Double Wide a few times.  Had the ribs; so over cooked that the bones were falling apart when you ate them.    The second time, had the brisket; dry and tough.  My partner had the chicken; dry.    The FOOD IS REALLY BAD *****  service and atmosphere ok.

wubBJ0fwHVX3_ztLPnc1FA.text: Solid, greasy, comfort food whether you come here for lunch, dinner or breakfast. Lots of their menu items can be or are vegetarian or vegan. Big drink menu including some frozen concoctions such as blended mojitos and mudslides.  Huge TVs and lots of them, so I can imagine this place will be great to watch a game at. We'll see how they look during NBA playoffs!

gpqRajBTi2gkUK_RQyFZ3Q.text: One of my favs in general but did you know they will cater their deliciousness for meetings/lunches? They brought awesomely yummy boxed lunch in a snowstorm for our training. The all vegan fare we got for this meeting surprised even the biggest carnivore with how good it was. Def use them again!

dXhkBV4e1-NsyKrivz0Svw.text: We went on Saturday night to satiate my craving for good karaoke.   For food I ordered the "TV dinner" which is a huge metal tray of two entrees and three sides. I tried the pulled pork, half rack of ribs, cornbread, mashed potatoes, rice, and veggie of the day. The ribs were falling off the bone and tender, but could have used extra sauce. The pulled pork was dry and really needed extra sauce, and the texture seemed off. The sides were all pretty much awful. You could tell they make a big batch in the morning and it sits there all day. In addition they were all vastly underseasoned. My husband had the black and blue burger, which strangely enough he said was OVERseasoned. So the food was pretty much disappointing, but you do get a lot for the price, and I'll give them the benefit of the doubt since they stop serving food at 11pm and we came at about 10:40. Next time we will try eating there earlier.   The service was fine; the waitress checked on us frequently and promptly. They do have a good beer list and the beer prices are okay, although the mixed drink prices are a teensy bit high for my tastes (although probably comparatively low for some South Side venues). The restrooms were cleaned and fully stocked, which is a plus for such a busy bar. Speaking of busy, the place was packed when we came, and they do boast an awesome patio that probably more than doubles their seating capacity.  The karaoke was AWESOME. It really saved this place from getting a two star review. They had a great, lively crowd doing some really zany and entertaining performances. The host has the best karaoke setup I've seen: live video background of you singing, playback clips of your performance, and a VERY up to date computerized catalog. If anything, I'll be back for his karaoke! We'll give the food a second shot another day.

zroBJC72wATDRkBS4TGeeA.text: My wife, son, and I decided to stop at the Double Wide yesterday after a nice long walk on the Heritage Trail.  We've been to the Double Wide more than a few times and our experiences there have always been positive.    We asked to sit inside so we could cool off after a long walk in the sun.  We were seated in the open-air dining room, which was fine since it afforded a little shade.  The amount of flies were freaking my toddler out a little, but some flies are to be expected in an open-air dining room.  Our server was initially prompt and friendly.  She arrived with two waters and even a water for our son in a kids cup, which we appreciated.  My wife ordered a cheeseburger, and I was in a mood for a Pittsburgh salad so I ordered the Double Wide Salad with grilled chicken and fries.  We ordered chicken fingers and a fruit cup for our son.  The food arrived quickly, but this is when things started to go downhill.  My wife's burger would be classified as "Pittsburgh rare" even though she didn't even order it medium rare.  It was so undercooked that some of the edge areas were still red.  My salad came without fries, and my son's chicken fingers without dipping sauce (which my wife subsequently ordered from the food runners).  No big deal, I thought.  I'll just trade meals with my wife and eat the rare burger (I couldn't).  10 minutes or so went by before our server checked on the food.  By that time, I had given up on the fries and my wife had only taken one bite from the burger (I also took a bite when I thought I might eat it).  My son's dipping sauce also never arrived.  My wife politely returned the burger and the server noted that she could "probably" get it removed from the bill.  No apology or offer of some kind of replacement.  My wife and I have both spent a significant amount of time in the service industry, and were ready to write the experience off as an isolated bad day.  When the bill arrived, we were relieved to see that the burger had been removed.  However, there was a $.50 charge for the ranch dressing that never came, and another $1.50 for the fries that never arrived.  We weren't about to hassle the server over $2, so I paid the bill and we left.  In the end, we spent $40 (with the tip) for what amounted to be chicken fingers, a cup of fruit, a grilled chicken salad, an iced tea ($2.50), and a Bloody Mary (which was great).  Reflecting back on the experience on the way home, we decided we would not be returning.    We'll miss the Double Wide, but there are too many great places to eat in Pittsburgh now to risk a repeat experience.

YsUGRjPmCw0faObhTSUdmg.text: Now I know why... why I wouldn't stand in a doorway waiting to be acknowledged Why I wouldn't sit at a table...surrounded by tables...set with napkins Waiting for a menu...for a look from the waitstaff... oh wait we don't have. To sit through the torture!!! Of believing you serve food past 9 pm like your website directs!! Of hoping for service that I am more than happy to pay for... But oh well..I guess four parties of less than four can b hard when You're twirling your hair... Thanks for the worst service and u didn't even know I wanted food...no attempt in 20 minutes ...to even bring us a beer... Now I know ...why its way more rewarding to go 50 ft and eat half price apps with awesome sevice...talking the I've-been-out-to Eat-at-least-once-before kind of at functional food carriage with charisma...as if the library has always been an eatery.

Yb7OW0qN2NxIYYaWTE0ffQ.text: Used to live across the street from this joint, although the atmosphere is enticing, the food is lacking, so we were never regulars.  Now that we've moved to Bloomfield, I still venture over for karaoke night, which is very fun!  It is hit or miss, depending on the crowd you will sing 30 songs a night or be lucky to get 1 in.  The KJ has the best system jn town ( download his app!).  Love it when he sings!!

iheT7EFK9KfEp899PJ9x2A.text: I don't know how many times I passed by this place before realizing it was actually an eatery and not some old shut-down gas station.  I am glad that I finally found it, though.  My only issue on this trip was that I had Sophie with me.  Oh well, into the jacket she went, and into the restaurant we went.    Amazingly tchotchky interior, but amazingly appropriate for the location, the history, and surprisingly not overdone.  Not a lot of other customers, but we were in at around 3pm -- a time when most other people are not eating.  Looking through the menu, I was surprised to find "Tear Jerker" flavor for the hot wings.  My first thought was, "BAH!  People in Pittsburgh don't know what piquant is and that is what I will be getting."  I then ruffled through the rest of the menu and we ordered the following items:  5 regular wings 5 tearjerker wings split pea soup with ham potato soup DW Cheeseburger (plain/medium) with fries Pepsi (x2)  I am uncertain about the full gamut of the menu, but they appeared to be fairly hospitable to those that were looking for gluten-free food as well as having many vegetarian and vegan options that were clearly marked on the menu.    Our soups and drinks came out right after we ordered.  I didn't like the Split Pea soup.  It was grainy and tasted like it had just come out of a package.  I had a few bites and then just set it to the side.  I used my soda to wash the flavor from my mouth.  I didn't even bother to try the potato soup.  Not to long after I aborted soup consumption, the wings arrived.  My nose immediately caught the fragrance.  Oh...the smell was good.   My friend made it clear that I was not to have any of the regular since he was not going to eat any of the tear jerkers.  After having finished my scoffing at him, I went right for my wings.  The flavor was good.  They didn't burn.  I knew it; I continued on eating them leisurely while drinking my soda.  On the third wing, my nose, eyes and mouth burst into flames.  I couldn't believe it.  My complacency had caused me to be unprepared for the piquancy.  The delayed ignition only hurt my pride a little compared to my friend laughing at my running nose and the tears coming out of my eyes.  As I finished the fourth wing, the hamburger arrived.  I abandoned my last wing while I cut the burger in half.  It appeared to be more a medium-well than a medium temperature; this is a heads up to order a temperature lower.  The flavor was good and the meat wasn't overly dry.  I will order a medium-rare next time so that I get the proper temperature.  When I finished the burger, I ate the last wing.  I will return here.  There is no question about it.  I enjoyed the flavor of the wings, but next time I will not be unprepared.

_7r1gvIOW8W3Hf0BeYXQCw.text: Delicious vegan dishes! Fun decor, but pretty noisy. Would be nearly perfect if they had vegan desserts too.

u0nEsKU0ZHP0X2MiJ8z6AQ.text: Was wandering around the South Side and decided to give this place a try.  I ordered the "hot" seitan wings, and they were very good but a bit spendy at $8.99 for 6 chunks of vegan protein and some soggy carrots.  There is a full bar here with a good selection of craft beer.  Bonus points for the dog-friendly patio.  I may come back with my pup for "wing" night wednesdays in the summer!

NyZefxs9T3SqjvrA6xoHPQ.text: The Doublewide embodies a lot of conflicting emotions for me.   PRO: I believe they have the greatest seitan wings & pulled seitan sandwiches in town - this can go a long way for a vegetarian.  CON: I am decidedly uncomfortable with their version of "Southern garage" culture. Section 8 meals? Oh god. I'm actually from a place with Southern "hick" mechanics, and it is a little excruciating to see realities be turned into themes.   PRO: Their beer draft lift is exciting, with a nice balance between old friends and new adventures.  CON: The brunch is gross. Veggie menu options are slim and everything we ordered was just gross. Brunch is very important to me, almost sacred.   The service is almost always fantastic, though, the servers are quick and knowledgeable. The food is solid & portions are manageable yet filling, but the seitan wings are a-mazing. I think the price point is a little high, but I guess it's alright to indulge in dressed-up down-home faves occasionally. The chairs and tables are big & sturdy, and the decor is some creative mash-up of a service station and a shiny corporate restaurant.   Good place to take a date: It's not so loud you can't talk, and I've never been gay-bashed there or anything.

_hIfbF9UebYqBAazgT4Pyw.text: I've been here three times and have been impressed each time. As others have remarked, the Seitan wings are out of this world. We split the sauces - barbeque and hot - both really extraordinary and the texture of the Seitan is, well, like meat. The onion rings are also amazing. They got the breading just right - it sticks to the onion so you don't end up pulling the onion out of the breading by accident. The rings come with a really tasty  chipotle ranch sauce with a lot of flavor and a little kick.  And then there's the beer. They rotate their selection frequently so you never know what you're going to get. That ends up being half the fun. The staff have been reliable at providing advice in this realm. But with a name like Uppity Jag Off IPA, ya have to try it, right? I loved it. Not too hoppy as IPA's go....very tasty with the added benefit that it's difficult to forget the name.  Great place!

5tLhG-gcCznh-EinBxko8A.text: Double Wide Grill has a pretty laid back, chill atmosphere. I had Sunday brunch here and was pretty satisfied with my meal. I ordered the Double Wide Benedict and devoured it quickly, mostly because I was starving at the time. The order was nothing spectacular, but it was a solid plate. The poached eggs were nicely done, and the hollandaise was good. They have a regular Eggs Benedict, but the Double Wide is unique because it is on corn bread rather than the English muffin. The salty sweet combo made it different and rather enjoyable.   If you're looking for some outdoor dining, they have a nice area outside, which they call their patio - good for daytime brunch in the sun, or getting some fresh air with your beer during happy hour.   Also look for their specials - ribs night and happy hour/night specials. I haven't been here for drinks yet, but they do have a nice draft selection. I'll be sure to check it out soon!

lX_QIdwQwThTi62nro65FA.text: I came here with the hopes of having some quality BBQ. I was disappointed from the moment they brought out the food. We ordered a sampler that came with ribs, pork, and brisket. The pork tasted of nothing but vinegar. The brisket was tough and chewy. The ribs were not satisfying. Couldn't even finish this very expensive meal. Will never be returning.

Nl2nmLbn5KLYwtipnrxD0Q.text: Good beer selection, great people watching, best patio on the Southside easily.  Food could use some improvement, service can be nightmarish, prices are very high for what you get, and there is a real lack of decent specials. They have some good ones but they are very short - 9pm-11pm for food (and only if you eat in the bar side) - and I'm not even sure if they do drink specials.   This place has so much potential. I am really hoping for some improvement in these categories. Even with those negatives, this place is still worthwhile for the attractive crowd - especially on a bright sunny day on the patio.

UdNFy8CB-yDgKi5nxxVlwA.text: Double Wide Grill is one of those places you go to when you just want to have a fun, enjoyable meal.   And for those of you from Chicago, I don't mean the "fun-crammed-down-your-throat-with-a-toilet-plunger" atmosphere of Ed Debevics.  It's a place to simply go an enjoy yourself.  So I was out with my girl posse on Friday night.  We were going to the movies nearby at South Side Works, so we wanted a place nearby to have a casual meal.  We started our meal with some wood grilled veggies, which were delicious.  They have an interesting concept here called "TV Dinner On Trays" in which you can build your own platter by choosing 1 "On Tray" and 3 sides for $15.99.  Marla tried that and wimped out 1/2 way through it, so she took some home.  Sherry tried the barbecue chicken ranch salad.  Maryann went for the wood-grilled chicken burrito.  And then there was Susan.  Sometimes Susan gets really hungry.  Sometimes Susan wants just a plain ole good cheeseburger.  And there's only one type of meat that Susan acknowledges as a burger--beef!  No turkeyburgers, no ostrich burgers, and certainly no veggie burgers will do.  Besides, veggies are a side dish, not a main dish.  Oh, and Susan's cheeseburger?  Yummy medium well with grilled onions.

5hBsIwafv13_dpKzWiPMzw.text: Crazy friendly service, TONS of outdoor seating and the BEST breakfast burrito. WHOA. Everything good.

vqfr_NyL5z7L0uemNc5S3A.text: On our way out of town we stopped by Doublewide to check out their brunch. I can sum up our experience in one word- "overrated". This place wasn't terrible and the service was pretty good but I can't say the food was that delicious or memorable. It was quite pricey for the amount you received and when the food doesn't taste that good it is hard to justify a $40 breakfast for 2.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bloody Mary

AepQZ8u-fEjhJazzjE_ZDg.text: When I lived in Pittsburgh, I ate here quite a few times.  On a recent visit back to the 'burgh, I met up with some friends to recollect and enjoy some vegetarian-friendly fare.  The Double Wide has a cool vibe because of the refurbished garage/gas station environment.  The memorabilia and decor capitalize on the history, so there's plenty of old gas-station signs, old oil cans, old hubcaps (...you get the idea) to look at.  The menu also playfully embraces the location's history, with plenty of old-time diner options, BBQ, and burgers.  The twist, of course, is that there are plenty of options for vegetarians and vegans.  Tofu and seitan abound.  The outdoor seating provides the perfect vantage point for people-watching and for observing all the craziness and/or quirkiness of Carson Street.   While this is all fine and good, there's really nothing spectacular about the food or service.  The greeters and waitress weren't particularly cheery, and the food is a bit underwhelming.  I suppose if I was a vegetarian, I'd be much more delighted.  Still, it's an okay place to check out, especially if you're visiting the South Side.  Try to get a table outdoors when the weather's nice (and when Pittsburgh experiences a rare sunny day).

xZXvgsekZ6l9B-Ad_CbtYw.text: Really nice atmosphere and friendly staff. Had the coconut chicken and fresh veggies. The chicken was grilled perfectly and the coconut sauce was light and not at all overpowering. I'd like to try the BBQ next time as I think this is their real specially. Overall a fun place with good food.

bvhMVibr7EYz1UMEnhAYHQ.text: Hmmm OK, I've been wanting to try their brunch for a very long time..so perhaps I built up my expectations...I'll start with that....  I started off with a bellini, and was very confused when it came out with a red color to it and a cherry at the bottom. It seemed like a rose/fruit wine, not peach puree and sparkling wine. I was willing to look past it and enjoy the brunch with a friend that I had not seen in awhile, except one of the waitresses kept yelling all over the restaurant to the rest of the staff. She was not yelling in a mean way, but in a conversation way, but she was the ONLY one yelling, why not walk up to the people...she made the whole restaurant comfortable with her very loud talking.   Now on to my, Double Wide Benedict. I had such high expectations for this..but after the first bite I knew I made the wrong choice. The corn bread, bacon and eggs complimented each other so well, but as soon as the spinach came into play it went downhill fast. It just didn't taste great all together, unfortunately IMO.   All around the food was good, and my friend and I had fun, but I now know not to order when I go back. :)

HrHtuySheD5Gu7Iwl_ajLQ.text: Honestly the worst service I have had in Pittsburgh. Some McDonald's are better. No greeting, no water, then no refills. The food was cold and so uninteresting.

QFZ-9n8v-u0OR0YSrtk1cQ.text: Old Review: ***** This place has been my favorite for a while now, but when they teamed up with Elysian Brewery (based in Seattle,) my top nearly blew. Always a good time with good people here; great selection of beer and the seitan wings are the best item on the menu! Other positive aspects of this place: Bloody Mary's, Happy Hour prices and grilled veggies. Just don't try to get a job here: The manager will make you wait for two hours and then tell you to come back another time.....  New Review: * Grouchy staff + barely edible food... At least they still have delicious seitan wings!

8V7TRbftgcyzobXuzHEP_g.text: Took my kids, parents and in-laws to Double Wide for lunch yesterday.  My brother and his girlfriend eat there quite frequently and have tried most of the menu (giving it all thumbs up).  My father and I went with the Pulled Porky sandwiches; my mom got the burrito; and my brother and his girlfriend went with Salads (darn them and their healthiness)... I LOVED the BBQ and the sauce-on-side was lovely as well.  It doesn't look like typical BBQ sauce, but it rivals it in my opinion.  Even my father (73 and a persnickety eater) loved the BBQ and sauce.  Put on the sauce in moderation, however, as it does have some 'kick'.  A good place for family eating - as the kids were kept entertained by the atmosphere and decorating; and the adults were kept entertained by the people-watching, exceptionally friendly service-staff, and good conversation.  Keep up the good work and looking forward to coming back to relax on the patio for a lazy Saturday afternoon.

EvepnwetAqz4pHnKmD9AVw.text: Oh, this place could be so so very good but really doesn't quite make it.  On the plus side is the large vegetarian selection.  The execution could be better as the meal that I ordered was a bit over done and the meal my sweetie ordered was a bit under done.    I got a grilled portabello reuben sandwich and the mushroom was oddly overcooked.  Also the sauce was sort of off.  I can't put my finger on it exactly but it didn't have zest perhaps?  Also the fries were a bit soggy...  My sweetie got the grilled veggie burrito and her veggies were under done (well a bit raw).  Nice sauce though.  Service is prompt and friendly but a bit distracted.  The outdoor seating is nice though.

pbam7B4hs7Qt5Z_JBlosgA.text: Good beer, burgers, and BBQ. The menu is pretty ambitious at first glance; they have like 4 different "whole meal" options, but I would recommend the TV Dinner option. Your choice of two mains, three sides, and cornbread. I've had all the BBQ and it's all good. The sweet potato fries are great too: they come out crispy and not too soggy. The reuben egg rolls are another good unique Pittsburgh item. I'd go back to this place.

LmwJXmU76410BUEcEGuLTw.text: I have been to the Double Wide a few times.  It really is hot or miss.  I have loved the ribs at times and sometimes deemed them barely adequate.  Their wings are solid.  Peanut butter pie is also tasty.  They have a descent beer selection.  They are a textbook 3 star.

W-29fVHLGSCXDI2p19OyGg.text: When the weather's nice and I visit the bros in PGH, Double Wide is my bar of choice. It's a great place to just kick back and relax, sit outside, play some cornhole, and enjoy some adult beverages.   The food was very forgettable but that's really not why you we went there. We actually ended up ordering a pizza to be delivered there and they let us eat it which I thought was pretty cool.   And there are a lot of dollar drink specials on the SS but this is not one of them. Over the course of a day I think I spent the equivalent of an actual double wide but I had such a good time there that I didn't really mind.   With some upcoming events in the Burgh this summer I'm sure we'll be hitting up the Double Wide for the clean Burgh air and some Iron Citys'.

w6XydJYddrKA3L58IHmcTg.text: While in general I am not the biggest fan of the venues in the South Side this one is a nice spot to hang out and have some drinks and a grab.  There is a lot of outdoor sitting, which makes it ideal for the summer time.  The service was fast and helpful. The drinks were solid and the food even better! Two of us order the pulled pork sandwich and it was as good as it gets, while their vegetarian selection is huge and great (based on the vegetarians of our group).  All in all, I think it is worth a try if you have not visited the place and I am sure you will like it.  Only negative point, is that they could use some more care in the facility - it looks dirty and old (which of course does not necessarily mean that it is, but it could use some more care).

eFA0Ll_ZSqWQ4S4PZ-0s-A.text: This place really hits the mark   Nice ambiance.   Wonderful selection of beers on tap.  Above all, the food is delicious:   The ribs are super tender and fall off the bones.  The pulled pork is juicy. Great sauces.  Crispy grilled brussel sprouts (awesome veggie of the day).   All around great experience.

kfDRAofuV_dj5SdYxJdZpQ.text: Will not be going back. Too expensive and had cold unseasoned pull pork. Wish there was actually a good barbecue around here.

mjFolEf_kEhxQdAZEJH1gg.text: Double Wide Grill is the kind of place you want to be good, but never is. The only reason I am giving them two stars is because I have had experiences where the food was good (Brunch, Seitan Wings, various awesome vegetarian items that are available), however, more than often to the food is not great. I love the huge out door seating and the fact that there are so many great healthy but still enticing options to choose from on the menu, yet I only really enjoy the food probably half the time.  One thing you can count on being awful is the service. Waiting forever for a table, getting to a table and waiting forever to have someone come serve you, bad attitudes and bad service are all regular occurrences at Double Wide. I think I am a pretty low maintenance customer, and I certainly can be patient and understanding. Yet I have given Double Wide so many chances and am usually disappointed or offended. I would much rather go to OTB or Library, which both have way better food and are a block away.

68FOyVIb9QkUIKQ4OwcMpw.text: What can I say that hasn't already been said? I seriously don't know why I keep going back here. I want to rave about the food because their menu is interesting, but everything I've ever had has just been okay. The servers have always come off as somewhat rude. On numerous occasions, I've had to wait when there are plenty of open tables as they are always understaffed. As everyone has already pointed out, their outdoor seating is great, but if you come at a busy time, be prepared to wait for it.  Their prices aren't outrageously bad, but you can get much, much better for your money elsewhere in Southside. Bottom line, unless you're from out of town and want this experience, go somewhere else.

iUlYrWt9Yt62NR13d--eNg.text: Fun place for a group.  Stopped to watch some football and fill the belly. Couldn't wait to get the Brisket Sandwich.  Oh, not available till after 4...eh on a weekend with people watching football...how come so late.    Asked if any beer specials.  No!  How come, everyone else on Carson St. have beer specials during the game...just left a place with a special.  Proceed to order and when we were almost done the waitress said do you want that or the all U can eat, it is less $'s and more to eat.  If you have it a special, why not tell us before we order?  Anyway, the ribs and nachos and corn bread were enjoyable.

23bamQViRnVmlc7Cyn9jvA.text: Working in the Southside I get to frequent a lot of these establishments for lunch, so I do understand that the Double Wide caters more to the dinner and drinking crowd, at least I'm assuming this because the smell of beer still resonates when I eat there for lunch.    If you want to have lunch in the Southside and you want to sit outside there aren't many options, so Double Wide might be your only choice.  If so stick to the salads as they are above average.  Everything I've ever tried apart from salads though has been a disappointment, and salads aren't what I'm normally trying to order (even though it probably should be).  If you sit inside though you will be greeted with a nice smell of stale beer that seems to have infested every inch of the place.  It's a shame too, because I do enjoy the layout and atmosphere.  If they just focused a little more on the quality and taste of the food I think this place would be amazing.    My recommendation is to avoid unless you really want to sit outside.

OPzznOuoP-76CUBnxsbQRA.text: Ok people, how is it that the last time I visited here was nearly four years ago and I forgot about it?  But subconsciously I somehow remembered what I ordered.  How?  Is?  That?  Possible?  I don't know what it is about a burger that has an egg and bacon on it that attracts me like bees to pollen (no, it's not bees to the honey, but that is another rant for another time).  I'm thinking that it's the appeal of breakfast, but the satisfaction of dinner that does it.  To say that this burger is big does not do it justice, to describe this you should use gut-buster.  This amount of food that you are holding in your two hands is enough to send you into a food coma.  Two thick slices of toasted to perfection Texas toast try their best to keep your hands grease free for as long as they can, but in all honesty, you should just accept the fact that there is no way you are getting out of there without using a stack of napkins.  The burger patty itself is cooked to your liking with the right amount of spices.  The egg is your basic fired egg, nothing special about it, but somehow definitely belongs on this burger.  The bacon people, my god, what is our obsession with bacon, I'm not complaining, but why in the world does it makes EVERYTHING better!  This bacon just crumbled once it hit the tongue.  Crumbled into salty goodness that makes your heart smile.  Yes it was that good!  It took me so long to eat this monster that I was lucky that my friend had gotten one of their TV dinners.  The side was nothing more that fresh cut fries.  I'm not going to go much into that as if you read my previous review how upset I was at that change.  Our server needed a little work.  Very monotone and kind of reminded me of Sam the Eagle from the Muppets.  All in all, it was a good experience.  Hopefully one I won't forget the next time around.
