28v3l1EmPUKOQsoDVHRtoQ.text: Food was okay.   The famous ribs were hard and dry.  The corn bread was a small hunk of drywall.  It's sad because I typically go once or twice a month and it has steadily declined.  I can't say we had the worst server ever, but she was pretty close.  If she cared about the customer half as much as she cared about  talking to the other servers ...  She'd be much better off.  Lastly, the $18 - 8oz Sirloin was a half step up from Pondarosa.  Probably won't be back for a while and will probably tell everybody I know.

jwpIGtOK4ZBizWUsacSEOA.text: Well. I realized that I am LONG overdue for my first-ever review update, and what better place than Double Wide, a place that I went from loathing to loving. (Okay, not *loathing* so much as *being kind of weirded out by and disappointed in*. But definitely to *loving*!)  Every year, I help run the Pittsburgh chapter of National Novel Writing Month. We are an unruly bunch of writers, some of us meat eaters, some vegan, some of us gluten free, and all of us really really hungry before the month begins in November. So, we gather at the end of each October to get together and eat and chat before the stress of the month turns us into a bunch of crazy sleepless writers.  Our old spot was no longer working out, so a friend recommended we try Double Wide a few years back. I was skeptical - my initial visit in 2011 was less than enthralling - but I agreed to try. A small group of us went in for brunch to eat and chat with the staff about hosting our event.   I have never once regretted our decision to start using Double Wide as our Kick-Off Party headquarters, and we have been back three years in a row now.  Our group ranges from 25-40 people, and each year, the staff has handled us with ease. Lots of menu options to choose from? No problem. Separate checks? They don't bat an eye. Special menu items for our friends with dietary restrictions? They are ON IT.  I really can't say enough good things about the staff. They are just fantastic, from the management, to the servers, to the chefs who put out all sorts of tasty snacks.  Seeing as how I can't teleport back to my experience in 2011 and check myself, I'm going to assume that we just visited on an off-night, because it's been nothing but awesome on our last several visits to Double Wide.  #1. The salads are huge and terrific and come with CORNBREAD. A+++++  #2. In the summer, you can come mid-bike ride on the GAP and they don't care if you are smelly as heck!  #3. YOUR DOG CAN COME HAVE DINNER WITH YOU IN THE SUMMER. (Haven't tried this one out yet, but the first nice day of 2017, Miss Layla Grace is hitting up the Double Wide patio!)  #4. Drinks are cheap and yummy.  #5. Seriously the service is the best. Every server is amazing.  #6. They are not scared off by your massively large unruly group, and they are easy to get in touch with, easy to schedule, and they follow up and everything is heaven for scheduling.  #7. They will refill your water ten billion times during dinner, and I know this seems like a minor detail, but it is actually very important. Because, you know, hydration for your health and all that. ::love::  So yes. I'm still not huge on the trailer park decor, but WHATEVER I'm a convert and I love this place. Thank you, Double Wide, for welcoming me back after a not-very-impressed first visit and showing me that there is beauty in the South Side after dark. :)

2kk9C7kKLtxmr9s0iXPkTA.text: We lived about three blocks from this adorable spot. I loved walking past an inhaling the rich BBQ smoke every time. And while the decor was funky, fun and the ideal patio drinking location, I had to give it -2 stars for the consistently inconsistent food from the kitchen.  Don't get me wrong, the food was fun and appealed to all palates and dietary needs. My boyfriend and I could tear up some serious Junk Yard Nachos and my gaw, their Chicken Bonanza should be illegal for how tasty it is.   I just hope they've changed the recipe for their turkey burger. I am extremely sensitive to the food service industry. I worked my way through high school and college in almost all job descriptions at restaurants. I've never sent food back. Ever. But the turkey patty was not the ground turkey style you'd typically expect. It was cold, minced turkey mush and it looked like it wasn't cooked through. If it were beef, I probably would have been fine, but because turkey can cause more foodborne illnesses, I got nervous. The server was apologetic, but explained that their patties are different. I wish the menu indicated that.  We never made it for brunch, but I have no doubt its awesome. This is a fabulous spot in the spring to sit outside or inside for Karaoke in the fall. Solid spot. If you're on East Carson Street, give it a go.

dFAE4QNAsaPHAHQx_HqBQA.text: Went there for dinner for the vegetarian options. They messed up 3 out of 4 of the dinners ordered, including switching for meat on a vegetarian order. Absolutely disgusted. Would never eat there again.

jQzuvQhpFgFX9IblAW_GFw.text: I lovvve Double Wide but I just ordered seitan wings through post mates and in the order I politely asked for a side of ranch with the wings. Which it always comes with either ranch or blue cheese and celery/carrot slices. This is what I received. Two pieces of celery and no ranch. Not only are they supposed to come with the order, I specified which sauce I'd like. I know they saw the note because the order called for 1/2 and 1/2 --- something totally normal when you order in person. I know it's just ranch and vegetables but it completes the appetizer :(

9eZ2xGBtgkpyC2jGQgK_3g.text: I absolutely adore this place I love all the clearly marked vegan/vegetarian options on the menu. I had both the vegan Gyro and the Vegan cheese steak sandwich and both were great! Very tasteful and delicious. Our service was great both times we were there this week and their blended margarita was bomb.com 10 outa 10, would recommend

Yv4m5QWTRODsqFHOIz8BAg.text: Meh is the only way I can think of to describe our experience for lunch today. The experience started off just fine by getting seated right away with our server stopping by an appropriate time following. Waited a little bit for our server to return to take out order, no worries though because it's a nice day and we were enjoying the patio. It all started to go down hill from there. We ended up waiting 30-40 minutes for a salad and a burger. Two tables next to us that ordered after us received there food and were almost finished by the time we actually received ours. Our server checked in with neighboring tables but never ours, not even to apologize for how long it was taking for our food and that it would be out shortly (even if it wasn't). Then once our food finally came, our server never stopped by to make sure everything was ok. The food was mediocre at best. We were then brought the wrong check. Overall this place isn't the worst place I've been to, but won't waste my money again. Especially since Pittsburgh has so many other great options. I wouldn't recommend this place.  In regards to the food. My salad was enormous(which isn't necessarily a bad thing) but had way too much of each topping on it, could barely taste the kale and spinach. This might be for some people but not me...less is more when it comes to salad toppings. Especially when you advertise local produce...I actually want to taste it. The cornbread was over cooked and dry. The burger was also just ok, if it truly is grass fed beef, it shouldn't need as much add in seasoning as it had. Again, this place is just ok. When you have a menu as big as theirs, you can't expect the food to be that great.  My advice would be to retrain your servers and cut the menu in half. Focus on making things really good instead of just making a bunch of things just meh.

tSLwPWNFTULoGH2Qgdxq0g.text: This place is atrocious!  AVOID!  Visited on Feb 7, 2018 for lunch. The place was completely empty except for us for about 15 minutes. One other family arrived and believe it or not, they sat them in the booth right next to us!!! The entire place was EMPTY! WTF???  We immediately felt uncomfortable and discussed moving as soon as we received our food. It was too late, though, the mood was killed and we just wanted to leave, but we'd already ordered.   I ordered the Philly Cheesesteak Soup and an order of two pieces of cornbread. Would have been nice for the waitress to tell me the soup came with cornbread so I didn't order the extra I didn't need. The soup was essentially partially coagulated fat with a few pieces of jalapeno added in. Since when do Philly Cheesesteaks have jalapenos???  I promptly regurgitated the slightly spicy gelatinous goo before even making it home. In fact, after about three spoonfuls, I almost redecorated the patio.   One person ordered the chicken nuggets and a basket of fries. The nuggets were over cooked and dry and the fries looked like they'd been sealed in a plastic container after frying making them wet and soggy.   Last meal we ordered was a sandwich that came piled with a stack of raw, cold jalapenos hidden under a layer of translucent cheese that looked like it had been melted three days ago.   Just don't do it. AVOID!

i_3JCdgJoiC_ygjH3-YQqA.text: Extremely disappointed and unimpressed. My boyfriend and I were visiting our friends in Pittsburgh last weekend and we were really excited to try this place, due to their many options for herbivores. We ordered delivery and discovered the restaurant was out of the ingredients needed for our desired order...whatever, it happens. What really annoyed us was the quality of the food or lack thereof. The seitan "wings" were both tiny and so salty that we ended up just throwing them out. (Apparently, DWG equates "Cajun" with "nauseating/dehydrating dose of Lawry's Seasoned Salt.")  We also ordered the lentil Nekkid Burgers. These are, evidently, just a patty and a bun, hence their name. Unfortunately, no amount of condiments compensated for the simplicity of these pathetically dry, cold patties. These too, were thrown into the trash. Bottom line: I literally haven't written a review in years but severe disappointment prompts one to warn others.

pJA0BBVoYxK_kdy5g_z2Hw.text: I really like the outdoor atmosphere in the summertime and the amount of vegan and vegetarian options they have. I got seitan wings and fries which were very good, however everything was a little too spicy for me. All of the wing sauces were spicy, even the bbq sauce and vegan tzatziki. I don't typically like even the slightest bit of spice, so it was hard for me to enjoy my meal. Other than that though, I came here for my birthday and it was a very nice time. I look forward to trying all of the other vegan options.

8GC7yhE098vs6C4vlTwGxw.text: First and last time here! Do not come here unless you want a bad experience.The quality of food here is not worth the price at all! Not only did I have to wait thirty minutes for my food to arrive, but when it did they were absolutely cold! Then when we did complain (note we didn't make it a big issue) the manager seemed to have an attitude towards the fact we wanted them heated or made brand new. She walked away during mid conversation and didn't even hear what else we had to say. Why am I paying for food I'm not even enjoying? When they finally gave us new food it wasn't even that hot and barely had any sauce. I asked for sauce on the side,and again didn't get that for another long time. The kicker is the BEST part, the remaining food I had after I barely ate they said they couldn't give me a box to go because "it's against the rules"! WHAT A FUCKING JOKE. Paying for something I can't even take with me. The server continued to avoid us the rest of the night not once did we have a refill or even have the question asked. Will not be recommending this restaurant to anyone.

pGkc-p_8a_7eM0RLmp2JPg.text: Well.....     there was high points and low points.    The meat served here is excellent.    Brisket, chicken, chorizo were all good and the sauces had a good amount of heat.     Fresh salad and food cornbread (which I generally don't like).....   but their sides kind of suck. 5TWT6gf6vg4C1fuiq6Vwag.text: My dad and I stopped in here on a Tuesday night for dinner a few weeks ago, and we both felt this place was just ok.  There was nothing wrong with the food when we ate it, but it was about $50 for two of us with a tip.  Too steep for non-memorable food.  I ordered a shrimp burrito ($12) that was ok.  The amount of shrimp was decent for the price, but it was just beans, rice, and shrimp.  My dad ordered a burger that was also fine.  We then ordered 2 slices of cake.  A chocolate cake, that was supposed to be super chocolate-y, was flavorless.  The red velvet was slightly better, but at $6.95/slice, neither was worth it.  My dad ordered a beer that was ok, but overall, most of the food was something you could make at home.  I wouldn't come back here except for the Vegan options, which bumps this place up to a 3 star rating.

For brunch I had an omelette with brie cheese and potatoes on the side. I've had their turkey sandwich once. Nothing has been very impressive. I honestly don't plan on returning.

gmfgYan5NnfdpKt4CF3kbQ.text: Food is excellent with great flavor.  Drink was good, was a little sweet and could have used better mixing.  Took the waitress FOREVER to get our order, meanwhile some dude (maybe the manager?) randomly saunters around the restaurant doing absolutely nothing.  Not only was it unhelpful, he also looked ridiculous.  If you're short-staffed, why not help out a little bit?  I see from other reviews, this happens to be a well-established pattern at DWG. t7pSnHu7uxAFVHBJZPSHVQ.text: Attn. Dog owners:  I will start by saying that this place advertises as a dog friendly restaurant and at one part it is, but most definitely they are not friendly to a dog owners. Myself and my GF came in today with our medium size dog  for lunch. They have nice fenced in outside seating for customers with dogs. we took seat in the middle of the fenced in dining away from the rest of the guests. The server plopped our menus to a table that was close to the fence and let us know that he is not going to walk around and that we need to move or grab all our order from that table. We moved to that table. Our dog got a bowl of water and a server brought us small plastic cups of water and disappeared for 10 minutes without asking if we wanted anything else to drink. He then came back ready to take our order. we ordered our meal along with another drinks. ( also they did not have the  entry that was on the menu waiter never apologized and just rudely said: "we don't have this today") Our drinks also came in in a small plastic cups. my girlfriends cranberry juice had two ice cubs floating in which melted in a second. The drink was still warm. I then noticed that everyone else had tall glass cups and I called the server and requested some extra ice for the drink and asked why our service is different from others. I was told that this is a law and they can only serve us with plastic cups and paper plates. Our meal later came in Paper plates also. I enquired why it is this way and was told that if we dropped and brake our glass drinks the dogs would cut their paws.  The server left. then my girlfriend who ordered shrimps with vegetables looks at me and is like where is silverware. do we have to eat our food like dogs without spoon or fork? I waited for a bit while our food was getting cold and then  had to flag down another server and ask for forks and also catchup and napkins. No one ever apologized to us. They never replaced my girlfriends warm drink and only brought a jug full of ice. That was the most horrible dining experience that I had. I am not coming back and will make sure I share this review everywhere I can. Horrible and rude Stuff.

sWjtFiW1bCA09vEGA180Sw.text: Loved the Salmon Avocado BLT wrap and sweet potato fries. Quick service! Unique car garage atmosphere.

W4fzq_zd2tDqZxrn4A0-HA.text: Dear lord why are you punishing me at food places lately?!  Do I not serve you well!?  Do I not praise everything and appreciate all the amazing food places you've sent me!?  Why God, why now are you punishing me with some of the worst meals I ever had the last few weeks!?  I had a choice, go to the tried and trusted P.F. Changs for dinner or open my mouth and say "hey let's try somewhere we never been"!  I just knew the Double Wide Grill would be awesome cause there's always people outside dining and it's been here awhile but I'm starting to think people just put up with crappy food cause they're afraid to say how they really feel for fear of everyone saying they're difficult or picky but I refuse to spend any dollar amount on crap food or keep my mouth shut about it because in the end, crap food wastes your time, your money, your patience, your enthusiasm and if it really sucks, makes for an awful bathroom experience.  This place has GRILL in the name so ya know, get a burger!  I was gonna get their brisket but the waitress informed me they were out of it.  Ok, burger it is.  ... .... ..... This cook had to be high or drunk cause only a high or drunk person would send this food out...  Before I even discuss this, Texas Toast is THICK cut bread right?  I mean any time I've ever ordered it or seen it, it's ALWAYS been big thick bread.  Well take a look at my bread in my picture, does that look like Texas toast or wonder bread, I say wonder bread.  Again I said NO PINK, not burnt black just no pink was my only request, same as my partners request.  They came out moo'ing of course.  BLACK on the outside and PINK on the inside.  Since when has making a burger with no pink but not burnt been such a hard thing to find!?    The fries felt like they came out of the trash bin, cold and grease smothered.  My "Texas Toast" bread was mush (see video) and the mashed potatos I ordered were cold and really just tasted like garlic and nothing else.  The Bloody Mary I ordered while I waited was a cup of horseradish and tasted like sink water.    The manager came out to try to remedy the issue and he gave us a $10 gift card and asked if we would come back which was nice but it still didn't counter balance his constant attempt at justifying why the food sucked.  Just say "this looks like shit, this is a bad representation of us and when/if you come back I'll make right", Don't go on and on about "well I mean maybe cause, and well it is close to close and this is like this cause, and this and that" just say it sucks and move on!  What is it with managers lately trying to sneakily blame the customer or make them seem like they lack an understanding of good food???  It pisses you off more than the food being bad!  Which brings me to my next point, I don't care if it's 5 minutes before close, a hour before close or first thing when you open up, the experience should be consistent across the board!  My waitress seemed cool, but she seemed just there to get a check, not sell me on what is awesome about the place.  She actually recommended places to go other than there!!!  Ya know, the first impression is everything, so when I go places I've never been I specifically say to our waitress/waiter "I've never been here before, what do you suggest, I want to experience what this place is about" (EVERY TIME it's a new place) and when they look at me like "uhhhhhhhhhhh" lol, um ok cool, let me figure this out!  Where's the training and ENTHUSIASM for where you work?    My partner did say she thought the cranberry cole slaw was good so I guess there is some silver lining to the story, even if it is still pink in the middle.

Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

TMzvBLygbWjHIIhwL5E8bA.text: I love the food here. Brisket and ribs are great BBQ sauce has the perfect spicey sweetness to it. Only reason I haven't gave it 5 stars is because it took an hour to get our food and another 30 mins for the check. I always tip 25% plus because I worked in that buisness a lot. But not checking on a table to tell them why your food is taking so long is not good service.

xPpUMGXoGtuZISNwJzRbhQ.text: The best bbq I have ever had in a restaurant, hands down. And this includes the Carolinas. I have been to alot of places folks rave about bbq, but Double Wide has a great menu for vegans and meatlovers alike! So it is perfect for a mixed crowd. The atmosphere is fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

nr1pU-3W0ilrSmr3nHoOxA.text: I came in here with my boyfriend during the Pinburgh tournament. We sat at the bar. It was relatively busy (dinner rush).  Our bartender, Lisa, is why I'm giving 5 stars. In spite of how busy it was, she repeatedly made it a point to let us know that she hadn't forgotten us. She served our drinks and food in a timely fashion, but was so mindful of our presence, and apologetic for what she felt was a long wait. In addition to that, once things calmed down a bit, she was very personable and went the extra mile to engage us in conversation.  The rest of the staff was also extraordinarily friendly!  Huge selection of food for fair prices, and the Chardonnay was satisfying. Crisp, with a nice bite.  I got the nachos, which were abundant and contained loads of fresh toppings. My boyfriend got a burger, which he describes as "no frills, straightforward, exactly what I expected".  I would come here again, because the food was of sizeable portions and tasty, and because the service felt personalized and friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nachos

RBIvDhcjnJ57YqxC0f0-aQ.text: Love, love , LOVE the lentil burger! I suggest that you get with a mayo or some other sauce and tomato and lettuce however as it has a tendency to be a bit dry,especially if you plan on taking some home for leftovers. Another 4-5 star choice is the vegetarian chili. I immediately ordered it with sour cream and cheddar cheese and it was delicious (only because I have a very delicate stomach for spicy foods). My goal in life is to hunt down these recipes! The fries are delicious, I always ask for them to be done well done, it's a habit of mine every where I go, especially at Eat 'n Park (my pet peeve there) and they do not disappoint.

3XKplBgV6aEsMcMF40sCiA.text: Double Wide, you've impressed me. You've been around for years, a South Side staple that appeals to a wide audience, and I always rave about your frozen mojitos. Now, I get to sing your praises for your IMMENSE vegan/vegetarian food offerings.  First of all, the Double Wide has an enormous menu to begin with, and they offer two full pages of veg options. Every item is clearly marked whether it's vegan or vegetarian, and there is just SO MUCH. Most veg-friendly restaurants in the city offer a few options, but it's nothing like what Double Wide has got going on.  Second, the seitan wings. Oh god, yes. THESE are the best wings in the city and as close to the real thing as you can get. What sets their wings apart is the crispiness and the delicious sauces. My only very small complaint is I would love to see a vegan blue cheese or ranch dressing to accompany these delicious bundles. I've also had the seitan gyro twice, and it never disappoints.  Double Wide boasts a huge draft list, offers growlers and pints to go (it's called a meowler, how cute is that?), and still serves the best frozen drink in town. And they have a dog-friendly patio section, what more could you ask for?

1ch7PR5_kdvvQiDYMG2Hdw.text: Doublewide is double good. Again and again. Tonight was all vegan.   Started with the wings. Dinner was the California salad, beef stroganoff, and the seitan gyro. All were amazing. The stroganoff was voted best vegan in Pittsburgh. No surprise, it was! Ok now the 'meh'...they've added an almost vegan (honey) dessert called the Goo Ball. Don't do it, yet. It's too dry, not remotely gooey. Boring.  But we don't judge by the Goo Ball! Love Double Wide and can't wait to go back in a few days!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Seitan Gyro
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beef Stroganoff #1
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. California salad.

0xAaC18skXmiXznlaAgfVg.text: This place has a good vibe and a large outside seating area.  Our server was really nice and service was fast. The problem is with the food. The server told us the veggie of the day was broccoli and carrots that were cooked in wine and very flavorful. They were not that at all. Very bland and soggy. The rest of the food our table had was not that good either. Pulled pork was dry and flavorless. The onion rings and wings were good at least.

anuMd__aH-BQwxiDvqc9hw.text: A bbq steakhouse with a menu for vegetarians that goes beyond boring salads! Of course I had to try it. The decor's interesting, friendly and casual. I can see this place being fun on a summer afternoon. I only focused on their vegetarian menu because I don't eat meat and I was absolutely lost for choice which NEVER happens..and at a bbq place too! I settled with the seitan wings and their new aloha burger with a pineapple salsa sauce which was excellent! The meatless stroganoff was ok.. tasty, just not what I was expecting. The portion sizes are large. I have to go back to try their cheeseburger and cheesesteak and veggyros!! OMG! Everything I wanted to eat but couldn't! Needless to say I'm going back. Also, it helps that they make super stiff cocktails (nothing fancy, think sweet and potent!) and politely put up with my requests of "a little less this" and "can I add that" to my cocktail gives them an extra star!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The meatless stroganoff
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Aloha burger with pineapple salsa. I don&#39;t usually like pineapples in my food but this was a win!
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Seitan wings! Yummm.. and their giant super stiff (don&#39;t say I didn&#39;t warn you) cocktails!

WTxtdFAc__HGs55OCzsLxQ.text: If you're in the mood for spicy BBQ, this is your place.  The decor is more of a gas station (which was different but not necessarily a bad thing) with outdoor and indoor seating available.  The staff was very pleasant oir waitress was extremely honest when asked her feelings about certain items on the menu, which can be slightly overwhelming with the vast number of options.  The raspberry iced tea was tasty and there was a good variety of alcoholic beverages available.  I ordered the chicken, shroom & swiss and it was very good.  Two other options I was hoping for (salmon and turkey burger) were not available.  My wife got the brisket, which came with a dipping sauce that had a kick.  Without the sauce it was on the dryer side and was nothing spectacular.  We also ordered nachos with only cheese as an appetizer.  Some of the chips tasted burnt and the dish was rather dry, even with the cheese on top of it.  If we are in the area again, we would probably visit this place another time.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Our receipt to prove we were paying customers
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brisket sandwich
Photo of Double Wide Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shroom &amp; swiss chicken sandwich with rice

bB50Hu9rx-sIhLQoiHu80A.text: This was the first time I have ever had seitan wings. What a great substitute!!   The coconut tofu was very bland and the rice and veggies were soaked in oil so I didn't try them.  Service was very slow and forgot things like water and refills were rare.  Vegetarian menu was very impressive.

jTKpe9qo_N_Se6irXti3rw.text: Totally not what I expected. The seitan wings were amazingly good, and the bloody mary was just the right amount of spicy.   I ordered the Trucker Breakfast with the vegetarian sausage -- which was a slight mistake. The toast and eggs and potatoes were great, but the veggie sausage was off. It may have been the cooking oil as it had the odd aftertaste that comes with old oil.  I liked my pancakes as well. Although I wish the butter offered was real, or at least fresher. I think restaurants really miss the mark when they offer butter or creamer in peel-off containers.   Overall however, very good. I'd like to try some other things when I'm back.

FZMy687AfpB8soer_OzhuQ.text: Great atmosphere, lots of vegetarian and vegan options! Clean facilities and the dog patio is adorable! The veggyro was delicious and 100% vegan!

pmNDi0we0V1ZiMwLddVTWg.text: Good drink selection with some interesting cocktails and was pretty empty when I was there in the afternoon. I didn't try any food but it looked pretty good.

RBKdVS3sIfm0QVq7CXhYOg.text: My husband and I, and our dog were eagerly looking forward to dining at the Double Wide.  We had read about the great food, and respected the owner's efforts to allow dogs on the patio.  However, on a recent Saturday afternoon, we were greatly disappointed, primarily, but not solely due to the poor service.  After finding a table, we sat waiting for approximately 20 minutes, until I decided to ask the hostess for assistance.    En route, a server asked me if I was seated in the corner; and beckoned me to the counter (we had read a review a while back, and recalled that the servers were not permitted on the "dog" patio, but didn't know what we were expected to do).   He told me to grab a menu, and walked away.  A while later, he stood at the counter, yelled over, and said that he had forgotten to explain the specifics, namely, we place our order at the counter, and get our own utensils, water, etc.---which was fine, had he done so when we got there, minus the rude demeanor.    As for the food, it was disappointing that only the brunch menu was availlable, but we managed to find a few items, which were just ok.  I'm guessing that dishes, glassware, etc. are not allowed because of the dogs, but food served on a paper plate without a side dish or even a garnish was very unappealing.  Our breakfast burrito was also cold, and for almost $10, should have come with something other than sauce.  Cocktails were also a joke.  I guess beer is the thing here, but we ordered mixed drinks and mimosas, which came in plastic cups barely larger than a dixie cup, and were definitely overpriced.  We are generally pretty easygoing, and don't tend to complain, but I have to agree with another reviewer that you feel like you have the plague in the dog area.  The waiter seemed put out that he had to deal with us, and at one point, another server ran in and grabbed some items left behind, and ran out, as though she might catch something.   The final straw occured while I was waiting to pay the bill; our waiter presented a couple of large dog bones to the customers' dog right next to me, but didn't offer our pup a thing...I guess she didn't rate either!!  Definitely won't be back.

AzGYpb_T7X94XewOeMZUIQ.text: Meh.  Cute unpretentious menu and concept.  Friendly staff.  Outdoor seating.  Generous portions.  Excellent beer selection, with everything separated into helpful categories like "Hoppy Beers" and "Stout Beers".  Their fluffy corn bread side tastes like happiness.  So with so much to recommend it, why only 3 out of 5 stars?  Because this restaurant has everything going for it but the food.  My ribs and pulled pork were dry and tasteless.  The coleslaw, mashed potatoes and fries were bland.  Nothing was terrible, but it tasted like it had been left out under heat lamps in a cafeteria, definitely nothing worth going out of your way for.  That said, if you come here on a sunny day, order some drinks and a side of their corn bread (truly some of the best I've ever had) you will have a great time.  But with better alternatives so nearby, the Double Wide would not be my first choice for a meal.  For a more inspired dining experience, go a few blocks further down the south side and hit Fatheads.  Fatheads also offers a casual style, great beer selection, some outdoor seating and huge indulgent portions but with freshly prepared flavor explosions that will blow your mind!

NIBf1jPImcBH0_vkGUNtTw.text: Fun times in the South Side!  I decided to have a get together here for a birthday.  I called ahead to see if they take reservation...they don't, not even for a party of over 20.  I called once and the hostess said that someone would call me back.  They didn't.  I attempted to call again and they just said they don't take reservations.  I think this is a mistake on their part.  If you have more than 20 people you essentially need one server dedicated to your table.  I don't think they can properly plan for the evening.    Moving on...I arrived early, 5:30 ish to drop off balloons and determine if they would be able to accomodate us.  The hostess looks me dead in the face and asked if I had a reservation or if I called ahead!!  WTF!!  Seriously!!  I looked at her and said did you jsut ask me what I think you asked me?  She repeated herself and I laughed.  I mentioned I tried to call several times and was told they don't take reservations.  LOL!!  I mentioned that we would be back in about an hour and that guests would start arriving around 7:30pm.  They kept trying to seat me inside but I kept mentioning that we chose to go to this restaurant because you could sit outside!    They truly have a great outside seating area and it is right on East Carson street!    They added some tables to an area and provided us with great service.  I honestly couldn't have been happier with our waiter, MIKE!!  Super nice guy with a great attitidee.  He was very accomodating.  He remembered what everyone was drinking even as we moved around our little area.  I can't say enough great things about the service we received from him.  I gave them 3 stars because they don't take reservations and make it difficult to accomodate large groups.  They also give you alot of hassle and don't seem to want to be real accomodating.

NGZJ8IWLX930t03uscHrLA.text: I wish I had gotten to eat here, but my friends and I went for post-happy-hour, pre-serious-college-drinker hours.   A perfect place for a drink on the rambling patio/porch/outdoor area with the doors open and the warm breeze wafting around.    Highly recommend for drinks.  Can't comment on the food.  A total shitshow when the kids come out for the drinking, but that's when it's time for this old lady to go home.

4NCtN9lJ408VDYMBWwhnog.text: Excellent food. Atmosphere is that of a garage. We went expecting more of a diner. It is closer to gormet. Parking can be a problem.

NoMGkIchCr9a3mggs5HSsQ.text: One of the few places in Pittsburgh where vegetarians and vegans aren't an afterthought. Look at the back of the menu for lots of great veggie and vegan options. And, they are especially tasty, not your run of the mill grilled veggies.  We tried the seitan wings, which were very good. Hubby had the grilled portobello reuben, which he thought was quite good. I had the grilled tofu with chimichurri sauce. Both were tasty options that we can't get elsewhere.  Very laid back atmosphere, probably great for groups, but also for those with children. We'll be back for the brunch.

MPVZ5Xv7jGLidBRCglNnSA.text: Came here for some late nite food after barhopping down East Carson.  What else to get at a gas station-turned-bar than some cheap beer (Yuengling) and a big ol' order of 30 wings--both of which hit the spot. The beef chili was also delicious, with big chunks of peppers, onions and tomatoes.  Overall, I'd say this was one of the best places I ate at on my recent trip to the 'Burgh, and was a perfect way to cap off a night out with friends. I will be back.

61WCO_hIftwWm67JDn84GQ.text: Have always had a good experience at the Seven Fields location but on East Carson it was a severe disappointment. Our meal took forever to be served to us.. The seitan wings were cold and the huevos rancheros breakfast platter was not as described on menu, and also very cold, the meal was so small, about four little pieces of potato "hash browns", the three eggs seemed more like one scrambled egg in a small cold and hard tortilla shell,  the Mexican salsa was substituted with an Italian marinara! Not appetizing at all.

pAgPKd7RoFEj-HKSlrAzrw.text: A waiter said to my 8 yr old "you almost made me fucking drop my glass" when he bonked in to her. And they had no french toast at 1130am.

WsrVe67s_hFmNrzUNj5fkg.text: Double Wide Grill was okay. I had a platter with brisket and a 1/3 rack of pork ribs. The ribs were good, but I thought the sauce was too sweet. The brisket was extremely dry, and the sauces served with it didn't really help.  The platter came with french fries, which were okay, cole slaw that was unremarkable, and corn bread that I didn't eat because I'm on a gluten-free diet.  I shared a serving of wings, which I also thought were too sweet.  So nothing really wowed me, and the brisket was not good.  Total bill was around $25.  There are about twenty beers on tap.  Each item on the menu is marked if it is wheat-free, vegetarian, or vegan, and there are many options of each type; also a separate gluten-free menu which lists all the wheat-free options.  This was very useful, and I was grateful for it.  If I lived in the neighborhood, I might eat at the Double Wide a few times a year.  But I'm not in Pittsburgh much, and the food at the Double Wide was not wonderful enough to make this a place I would go out of my way to visit whenever I'm in town, so I think I'm not likely to go back.

cvs6dHSIpTAMG3HjWdYkSA.text: Ok so in all fairness I have to admit that I was not there to eat but for karaoke and booze filled bachelorette party fun. I can't say anything about the food, but the menu looks great, and it's nice to see such a large vegetarian/vegan selection for those who prefer that type of cuisine. This review mainly concerns our waiter, Mike.  Mike was about as awesome as a party of 11 revelers could ask for. He took every drink order, remembered it properly,even though we moved around the table,  and never blinked an eye at us when someone ordered 11 shots for the table...more than once. He also went above and beyond when one of the bridesmaids had a "wardrobe malfunction" with the strap on her tank top and brought us a pair of pliers to help fix it.  Mike is the kind of employee any establishment would be proud to have!!  (and I'm totally coming back here to try some pulled pork or brisket!)

N8nRSIx1eLBx8ZaUJSrLUw.text: I came here for dinner with a friend. She's a vegetarian and wanted to go to a place that had more options for vegetarians than just a salad. This place certainly fit the bill.  We were seated immediately when we got there and our waiter was extremely nice. He was really on top of refilling drinks and even gave us a few beers to sample before we made our final choices.   The food is a little expensive for what it is and it didn't blow me away by any means. It was good, but this is not a place I would crave anything in particular and have to come back.   The food did come out pretty quickly and the service was great. They have a lot of vegetarian options too so it's good for groups with both meat eaters and non-meat eaters. Everyone will find something they will like on the menu.   It was a bit cold outside so we dined indoors, but it seems like this would be a really great place on a nice summer night.  Go for the consistently good service.

fvvXH7Mr_lRKZrZBWvW3lw.text: Double Wide used to be one of my go-to restaurants for the great mix of omni and vegetarian/vegan options, and fast and friendly service. I'm not sure what has changed over the last year, but my last several visits have been incredibly disappointing. Wait time for a table can be 30+ minutes though there are seemingly plenty of empty tables available. Orders have taken 30 - nearly 60 minutes to arrive even outside of peak hours. Despite the wait time, the food has often been cold and/or undercooked. Even when the restaurant is fairly empty, some servers rarely (if ever) return to the table to check to see if drink refills are needed, or anything else is required.  Recently, I visited with friends and their dog to utilize the designated dog seating/eating area. There are not a ton of restaurants in Pittsburgh to which you can bring your dog, most likely due to liability/health/safety concerns. In order to attempt to bypass these issues, the Double Wide dog area is entirely separate from the non-dog outdoor section, and virtually no wait service is provided. You must get up from your table and go across to the counter to order, pick up your food, and pay. Forget drink refills unless you want to serve yourself from a pitcher of warm water that has been sitting out for some time. You are served with paper plates and plastic utensils that you must bus yourself, and then spray and wipe the table down. Again, I get that having your dogs at a restaurant is a novel concept in this city, and that certain safety precautions must be in place, but it is just not worth the trip/cost just to eat with your dog here.  On a positive note, the food (when cooked properly) is consistently good, and the selection of vegetarian/vegan options rivals almost all other omni restaurants in the city.

-eCODRBjw0ME3IlMNDSsqg.text: Let me paint the picture of my evening spent here.   Like most nights it began with a single thought "I want to get drunk." This thought usually turns into action and within an hour I have found myself a cozy watering hole. BUT, this night was different. Not only was I thirsty, I was also HUNGRY. Eating out isn't something I do often, I like to save what little money I have for libations.   I've always been intrigued by this place. It kinda has this late 50's service station look to it. Has some sweet lights and even some corn hole boards in the corner. Since I was the East Cayahoga state champ of cornhole back in '83 I figured it was reason enough to check out the place. Outside seating is a plus especially since the weather was actually nice.   The biggest plus was that I coordinated my visit with 35c wing night. I consider myself an amateur coniseour of wing and wing like foods (basically anything you fry) and let me tell you, these guys blew my socks off. They were fried perfectly with just the right amount of crispiness, they were pretty good size and the sauce was orgasm worthy.   So in conclusion roll on in to the double wide grill and let em lube ya up with the sauce and some frosty brews.

rZKyZVGpwe9cI6X5gfYj3Q.text: Double Wide on Carson St is probably the best outdoor eating establishment in Pittsburgh area. I know my way around Allegheny, Westmoreland, Butler and Beaver counties and choose to eat at DWG about once every 2 weeks.   The outdoor patio area is huge, easily tripling total seating capacity. On sunny, warm days the number of customers rises sharply which can lead to some extra wait time for seating and food. It can also lead to certain slow-cooked barbequed entree's selling out before the evening is over. Hey, I'm OK with that, it's totally understandable. The menu has broad coverage with lots of healthy & tasty options. I'd rate the portions and cost as average but quality is very good. I find it impressive that they can please both vegan and meat-eating customers. This makes DWG good for larger parties with picky eaters. For meat-eaters, the brisket, ribs, chicken, cajun fish and pulled pork is all really tasty. The vegetable side dishes are equally good with interesting combos you don't often see. I'm not into vegan entree's so I can't comment on that.  The bar is really nice and has a wide range of craft beers. We were so delighted to see former employee "Lisa the bartender" return to DWG. I'm betting the owners & mgmt are also thankful she's back. Lisa is super upbeat, interacts with patrons and serves to liven up the establishment.

42Hv1p7KatBsGACynExicg.text: Lots of choices on there menu.  The grilled veggie appetizer is very good.  Nice place with a different atmosphere than an ordinary restaurant.  Very friendly staff.  They also make there own soda  , which is  tasty.

cbl6Xsu5lPGENfb-aecPaQ.text: Visited the new Cranberry/Adams Twp location. Great food, atmosphere, service and now convenient location. Our new favorite for ribs. The sauce and rub are the best and the meat was lean and the bones pull out clean.

OP4iaGAiW9fmUM_FxDvSXw.text: Solid selection of vegetarian and vegan items at an American BBQ and grill style restaurant. Items are very clearly marked for veg or vegan, making selection easy. The veg dishes are mostly seitan, tofu, or vegetable/portabella based.  In the warmer months it is lovely to sit out on the patio to enjoy your meal and relax. The patio is very dog-friendly and many patrons bring their favorite pals along with them, leaving trails of "oohs" and "aaws" from other restaurant-goers. Service is typically quick, friendly, and knowledgeable of the menu-items. Double Wide is a good selection for a quick lunch or dinner for what you expect at a sit-down restaurant.   Drawbacks for the vegetarian items are that they seem to be out of stock of items on a somewhat regular basis.

AdNpvZCO-8pkfcAzDmmUfw.text: Don't let the rugged, garage-like exterior fool you -this place serves up some delicious, high quality food. The Double Wide is one of the first places I went to eat in the Southside, and its unique, vegetarian-friendly menu has kept me coming back.  I would highly recommend their vegetable tofu skewers (yum!). They come drizzled with BBQ sauce, which is a different approach to your average veggie dish. I'm also a big fan of their Saturday/Sunday brunch, during which you can find locals sipping on Mimosas and Bloody Marys. I usually order their tofu scramble wrap, which never disappoints.  Aside from its diverse menu, the Double Wide also has a really "chill" atmosphere. From its funky decor to its quirky staff, the restaurant definitely has a certain appeal.   I like to think of it as the hipster's version of Quaker Steak and Lube.

IRFiQcVFwKEYtAuMy0XNDA.text: Never disappointed with Double Wide. Food is delicious. Beer selection is plentiful. Service is good. It gets a bit crowded here during their busy hours. I guess you just have to time it right. I love going for Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner. Hell, I guess I just love going.

cAB6mKT1KPY8MSfuJiakLQ.text: We came here for brunch on a Saturday morning and the place was deserted. Which I actually liked because we basically had the place to ourselves. Good food, large space and a very relaxed atmosphere. We had the typical brunch food - omelettes and pancakes - services was fast and good! It's nice knowing you can go in sweatpants and not be judged. We'll def be back!

OzOtAukewC0c9G9MB4d9Ag.text: I love the hip atmosphere and food. it's a cool place to hang out in the summer. You get to eat outside in the parking lot and there are always cool people there in the evenings. The waiters dress in mechanic clothes with their name patch on their shirt and look like hicks.

vWvwUiHlFZ4he6-9fX_klA.text: Man, I really want to like this place more than I do.  I love the decor and the vibe, but the food is lacking.  I just moved here from Austin, Texas and I'm a vegetarian.  I like that Double Wide has veggie options, but they just aren't very good.  I've been there mainly for brunch and I always get the Southwestern Tofu Wrap and I add guacamole.  To be fair, maybe I should just order something else, but this always sounds so good.  It just doesn't taste very good.  It lacks in flavor and the guacamole doesn't appear to be housemade.  It look like something you get in a bag.  Another note, the portion sizes are tiny.  Not just for that dish, but I've been with several other people for brunch and I look around at everyone's plates and there just isn't a lot of food there.  Like I said, I really want to dig it, but I think you need to step it up in the food department.  I'll keep trying it, but maybe next time I'll get the veggie burger.

SZXQDqSRhWgSrTWHInkbog.text: I'm not quite sure how you can tell someone to their face that there are no seats available when half the restaurant has open seats. And also tell them that service will be ending shortly. (And service is scheduled to end in 40 minutes?)  2 stars for beer. No stars for douche-baggery.

fWSJb7GK87eBxnDdujEpjw.text: Surprised about all of the bad reviews here i thought the food was good and just the fact that it is on carson st in such a cool setting a convered car garage with a full size car.above the bar i enjoyed my experience here.

ou4KKFGLjmUwLDRs7HZaMw.text: The vibe here is nice. It's right in the southside with a huge outdoor seating section that allows for friends to get together and hang out. It's a great place to grab a cocktail with friends and enjoy the weather.  That's about all it's good for because to call this barbecue is a joke.  Again my southern roots don't fail me when it comes to traditional food.   Barbecue is supposed to be cooked for long periods of time on low heat to allow the flavor to set in whether it's vinegar, tomato, or mustard base the premise is still the same.    Here you can tell that the sauce is an after thought. The meat ends up really kind of dry with little to no flavor.  Service varies. The 1st time I went I had the most amazing server who was sweet and attentive without being over bearing and I loved her. Even though the food wasn't great I thought to myself at least the service is amazing.   The last couple of times I've gone (always with friends to just grab cocktails before we went out somewhere else) the service has been beyond lacking.  All in all, if you're looking for a cool spot to laugh it up with friends on your way somewhere better in the southside, Double Wide is your place. However if you're looking for tasty barbecue, try to find some place different.

sYM0RmotkjKmv4lhxtgQ3w.text: Great food with a lot of vegetarian, vegan  and gluten-free items. BBQ combo platter has fries, garlic pockles, cornbread, sweet potato fries and vinegar based cole slaw. Great tasting Hawaiian burgers.  Tilapia taco or roasted vegetable chili for a lite meal.

UZ5r9e6z2Lt4NLHanwKFsQ.text: My husband and I were visiting the city and someone recommended this place. We went with a taste for barbecue. Double Wide delivered! I got a platter with some pulled pork and brisket. So tasty and tender. It came with two small cups of sauces and I enjoyed mixing each meat with each sauce, to find the best combo. They also had the best cornbread I have ever had! There were two choices for coleslaw, and I got the vinegar and garlic option, which I didn't care for so much for. It wasn't creamy at all. Overall, I did feel like it was slightly pricey, but maybe that's just that area. Service was satisfactory.

7SdqhhS0now3gl5nzlNrRA.text: I go here for lunch often. Every time we go we get great service and have good food. The atmosphere is really cool and the prices are great. I don't think it's amazing but I've never had a bad experience. Sometimes some of the food doesn't measure up, I would avoid the mashed potatoes. The burgers and sandwiches are great.

oXxok71IhfjJPkQGx388YA.text: Got the grilled veggie and Brie salad w/ grilled chicken. It was delicious and hit the spot! Came with corn bread which was moist and tasted great. I love when I get a good meal away from home!

NaMtBnGN_OJrU44U0VNhmw.text: Brunch starts at 10 AM on the weekends. I had cream cheese stuffed French toast. Wonderfully delicious and a great portion size. Served with hot syrup and potatoes. My husband had the Black and Bleu Burger that was seasoned with blackening spices and covered with melted Bleu cheese crumbles. Had I not been in a breakfast mood, I definitely would have tried one of their make-your-own TV dinners.  Not that it appealed to me, but they have a lot of vegan/vegetarian options here.   Minus one star for incorrect operating hours posted on their website... Unless I missed them. I will check again and update to 5 stars if I'm mistaken.

S0t3ubDIQUSMD2WAGBPprQ.text: Always am happy with DWG's veg options! Have been there recently for brunch and lunch. Thank you for great, quick service and good food!

1rs6larlC7ZP7Wc9T4YQig.text: food was really good, even though one of our dinners came out barely warm. They made a new dinner. Menu choices were excellent, I got the TV dinner with brisket and tilapia, really excellent. Server was very friendly and nice, however really didn't see her much at all. Interestingly enough, seemed like a lot of the wait staff really didn't seem to be overly friendly, like walking around with smiles or anything similar. Probably took. At least 4 or 5 minutes just to flag someone down about the cold dinner. So food selection was excellent, however they could really use some work on customer focus, if that makes sense...Memphis BBQ (the thicker BBQ sauce) was freggin' FANTASTIC!

ScsIGYn7RVH5GDxlkoDsQA.text: Service is slow and the food was cold. Nice vibe. Probably a good place for drinks, but I don't recommend eating here. I had the tilapia tacos and my fiance had the ribs. Took a while and came out cold.

DWw_x8-Fliesw4Qc9dDhSA.text: I have give the double-wide a few more tries and have been pleased.  Service has improved.   the food is still good.   The atmosphere is funky-cool-good.  They have also seem to have gotten busier.....45 minute wait sometimes!     It's back onmy place to go list!

X3qMUWPnYsRcAkPvjnJemw.text: Family member brought me here a few days ago (friday night).  The place wasn't packed, and it was easy to find a table.  Good selection of beers, and the decor was rad (there's a CAR?!)  Place looks like an old garage, and the old advertisements are also awesome.    There's something called the Polar Bear Club, where if you consume all of your food/drink outside, your bill is half off.  Coming from San Diego, I have no idea why ANYONE would want to do that (esp. since there's plenty of room inside).  Needless to say the table and chairs were covered in snow, as if to say that they wouldn't be expecting anyone anytime soon.
